Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a super location.”
Reviews.Author: neshinoodle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in March in a superior room. Great modern hotel in a busy square. The room was exactly as i expected. I did asked to be moved to a higher floor as the noise from the square can continue into the night. The hotel is situated within restaurants and bars on your doorstep and other attractions are a walkable distance. The staff were friendly and helpful, although the concierge team appeared useless. I would not hesitate to book this hotel again for a trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “love the place”
Reviews.Author: srm b
Reviews.Content: great hotel, nice and central location at plaza st ana rooms are not that large, but very nicely laid out and a great bed breakfast is great - also for spanish levels

Reviews.Title: “Good City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WhelanJM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip. Location is fantastic, staff very helpful. Rooms are very small and space at a premium (even for a shorty like me). Between the bed and the work area, zero space, so unpractical for tall people. I'd also say the in-room entertainment is not brilliant and the lighting system is overly complicated.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel............”
Reviews.Author: Leaniebeanie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an amazing location, and within walking distances of most attractions. Was really impressed that the breakfast is served so late, so that for those of us that didn't want to get up at the crack of dawn we didn't have to! I loved the funky feeling of this property, and the music being played throughout. The staff were amazing and nothing was ever too much trouble! The little square outside the hotel was brilliant during the evenings, very entertaining! I would def go back to the ME Madrid, highly recommend it. Four our first visit to Madrid, we were dead impressed! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Great Weekend Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ord2002
Reviews.Content: During my first trip to Madrid, I stayed two nights at the ME Madrid on Plaza Santa Ana. It is centrally located with most of Madrid within easy walking distance. I paid extra for a room on the 5th floor with a private terrace. While this was a nice feature, it probably eliminated some of the interior space. In addition, with no outdoor furniture the terrace was mostly useless. I agree with the other reviewers, the rooms are quite small, in part caused by a very large minibar unit in the room. However, the rooms and bathrooms are very nicely appointed and the limited amount of time I spent in the room - did not care so much about the smaller size. While it was still cool in Madrid at night, the rooftop bar was not fully functioning outdoors, but it did provide a nice view of the surrounding square and city. The staff at the hotel were all very friendly and helpful - making you feel very welcome. I did eat in the restaurant for the breakfast buffet. It was nicely done with many options, although I do agree that 25 EUR is quite expensive - although consistent with other breakfast options throughout Europe. On my next trip to Madrid, would not hesitate to stay at ME Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel on Plaza Santa Ana.....”
Reviews.Author: devin57
Reviews.Content: we stayed here at the end of march for 6 nights.... i loved our stay here... really helpful staff, superb location, fabulous room, free wifi. great buffet breakfast, we had dinner in the restaurant one evening and that was great as well. close to everything, you can walk to where you want to go. great bathroom shower and aveda products! super clean rooms. i would HIGHLY recommend this hotel in madrid!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION+Phenomenal Service+COOL factor+Fitness Center”
Reviews.Author: X0ana
Reviews.Content: ###PERFECT LOCATION This is the BEST reason to stay at this hotel which sits in the heart of young, vibrant, hip Plaza de Santa Ana. When I am travelling I like to stay SUPER CLOSE to the nightlife (makes it safer that way) and walkable distance to all the major attractions. I did NOT take any public transport or taxis during my stay in Madrid. I was able to walk to all major attractions including the 3 museums (museo del prado, arte reina sofia, museo thyssen- bornemisza), retiro park, palacio real, gran via, plaza de espana, puerta del sol, calle del alcala, plaza mayor, arco de cuchilleros, chueca, salamanca (probably the farthest). ***If you are interested in participating in the nightlife (a must do in Madrid) I would recommend staying in this area rather than near the triangle of museums. The nightlife in this area is unbeatable- many great restaurants, tabernas (bars), tapas, and tucked away small clubs and much larger nearby clubs. ###SERVICE // Ritz The service here paralleled the Ritz. The staff was friendly and approachable. There was never a sense of arrogance and they were able to anticipate and/or respond quickly to any needs you may have. There is even an "everything is possible" speed dial on every phone ;). ###Fitness Center THEY DO HAVE ONE! I like a quick run before I start my day. The fitness center is small (just how I like it) with 2 treadmills, 2 ellipiticals, and 2 stairclimbers and free weights. This is where I got half my breakfast- scrumptious green apples alway stocked here (hehe). (There is also a nearby upscale gym if you care to pay). ###Room I went with a friend and we got a great steal via expedia on deluxe room for $140-160 US dollars/night (usually the price is > $200). We stayed for 8 nights. The room was small as many European hotel rooms are but the room was very clean/modern and the details were cool. Free WI-FI by the way. There were two electronic buttons on either side of room which turned on various lights and had a "hey you sexy thing" button that turned on this purple light in the room which gave it the same purple glow as the outside of the hotel. There was also a stereo system and a speaker with separate control in bathroom! We were on the first floor and faced the inner courtyard of hotel which although without a view may have been a blessing as it was SUPER QUIET. There was only a small hum when the rooftop bar was open from Wed-Sun night. Who needs a view anyway when you're out of the room (most of the day... and night...) anyway? ###IF I travel back to Madrid, I will definitely stay here for all the reasons above.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Intcopiers
Reviews.Content: I have stayed on three occasions, so good we are back again in November. The location is superb with quality restaurants all around. The roof top bar is amazing and Madrid is one of Europe's finest cities. The Urban suites look good Value and should be big enough. The queues at check out can be a little long, but worth the wait.

Reviews.Title: “Me Madrid Review”
Reviews.Author: AdeLee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days at the end of March and had a great time. On the plus side: - Very central location and clean hotel - Really pleasant and friendly staff - especially Ignacio in the bar downstairs - thanks for looking after us ! - Free Wifi throughout the hotel - Great roof top bar with some excellent views over Plaza Santa Ana - Plaza Santa Ana is on your doorstep and has some great restaurants where you can sit outside and enjoy the weather and watch the world go by On the downside - Deluxe room was really small (Room 432 same as one other reviewer) but another EUR 50-55 per night to get a bigger room is a bit pricey Over and above the hotel, Madrid was a revealation - really great city and would recommend if you have not been here before. Adrian Room 432. 22/3 - 27/3 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Very glamour trendy hotel!! but too small room!!”
Reviews.Author: travellAround8
Reviews.Content: I was located in center Madrid in this luxury hotel during a business trip to the city. I stayed 3 days here. Overall a very good hotel. Nice modern reception. Cool lounge bar behind the hall, and super cool bar on roof. But apart of all this appearance...the room is sooo small!!! I mean I am talking about a regular room, 200€ per night!! for me with 200€ is not so regular!! and NO breakfast included!!!! It was difficult for me and my wife opening the hand luggage. There isn't space for moving the extra bed pillows before sleeping. It's crazy small the room. Nice bathroom. Good toilet products of Aveda brand. Good concierge service!! kind and educated receptionists. Wifi gratis

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: jgreenwood_11
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend break in Madrid staying in the ME Madrid, which is located directly on the Plaza de Santa Anna, which is ideal for sightseeing and evening entertainment. I had emailed the hotel with queries prior to our trip and liaised with José Arenas, who made the effort to meet us on arrival and who could not have been more helpful. We had upgraded to a Supreme Room and this was definitely worth the additional cost – the room had a superb view overlooking the square. The room itself was extremely comfortable with everything you would expect and require. Overall, the hotel standards and service was exceptionally good, and although not cheap, was certainly worth the money and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “excelent choice”
Reviews.Author: Ethan A
Reviews.Content: 100 meters from Plaza del Sol means that the hotel is in the absolute center of Madrid. Just around the block are some nice restaurants, and the shopping area starts just north of Plaza del Sol. The historical center with plaza mayor, the castle, austrias and so on are within comfortable walking distance. Staff was friendly if slightly busy. Breakfast buffet was good : spanish standard; a bit heavy on the white bread but otherwise there was plenty to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in so many ways!”
Reviews.Author: Happiechappie35
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 days in Madrid. Fantastic location, superb customer service from start to finish, small touches here and there, makes a great deal of difference. Miriam was a joy to deal with as was alvaro. Rooms were a decent size considering the location. Room 510 was our room, incredible view overlooking the plaza. Only negative is the noise, music could be heard in room next door, and on Friday night was quite noisy on the plaza if you are trying to sleep, but if I was returning to Madrid I would definitely book this hotel and room( not if, but when). We have been to Rome, Paris, London, Barcelona, Lisbon, Prague, and Amsterdam on city breaks and Madrid easily beats them all! Such fantastic people, fab customer service, super value and locals everywhere, no real tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: JacquiAb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights, and it's an ideal springboard into Madrid due to the perfect location. The conference facility is good. The staff are friendly and professional, the breakfast is great, the room is small but sufficient, and overall the experience is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lanternlighter
Reviews.Content: Positives Great location in the heart of the city...close to the shops, bars & restaurants Fantastic shower Spacious bathroom Incredibly comfortable bed Turn down service with chocolates on the pillows - yum! Superior customer service from the hotel staff - nothing is too much trouble for them Free wi-fi that was very reliable Great lighting system in the room including 'sexy lights' which are very romantic Good AC system Negatives Cramped room - no room to walk around the bed - wouldn't recommend if you were claustrophobic Expensive breakfast at €25 - limited hot breakfast items Ask for a room with a view as you could get one with a view of a wall like me Avoid room 432

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kurt12
Reviews.Content: The bottom line: if you are young and hip, you might want to splurge on a room at the ME. For older folks, the ME is like a Marriot Courtyard hotel but with a hip ambiance that's useless to you. Pluses: Staff are pleasant and friendly. The Supreme room is a nice size. Street noise was not an issue (in February). Noise from adjacent rooms and hallway was suitably muffled. The room was kept spotless by staff. Minuses: The room curtains don't block out all the light. The rooms have a complicated lighting system. Supreme rooms may or may not have a view, as the ME counts rooms facing the little triangular strip on the side of the hotel (Plaza del Angel) as having a view. I got a rug burn on my elbow from the sheets. Everything is overpriced, e.g., a mini can of Pringles from the minibar is 6 euros; a drink at the hotel bar is 13 euros. Key cards demagnetize frequently - we had get ours replaced twice. We received our wake up call one hour early (ugh), but instead of acknowledging the mistake, staff hung up. Wifi was either slow or non-working for the seven days we were there. Regarding the key cards, when we went to get ours replaced the second time, the man at the desk asked us "Did you take any trains? Did you go to any museums?" He told us that going through security can demagnetize their cards. I thought it was pretty amusing that he thought we'd come all the way to Madrid and not go to any museums (e.g. they have this famous one there called The Prado) or take a train.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location but poor value”
Reviews.Author: bikiniamber
Reviews.Content: On the good side, its a nicely decorated, modern hotel in a great location in the centre of Madrid, surrounded by loads of bars and restaurants. It also has a very nice bar on the roof (although you don't have to be staying at the hotel to enjoy that) and there's free wi-fi. On the bad side, the standard rooms are tiny (we were told on check-in that we had been given one of the larger rooms, so I dread to think what the others are like) and, at close to €200 a night, its just too expensive for what you're getting.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever...”
Reviews.Author: Ellefolk
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed here, therefore I can't give my opinion about rooms or other in room services, but last night I was in the bar for few drinks with my friends. We were in a get together weekend after not seeing each other for a long time and as anybody could imagine, we were cheerful and excited. When we came in one of the bar tenders approached the other one and made an extremely bad comment about us being drunk and some other things I would prefer not to state in here. It was perfectly audible. Firstly, it was not the case but I was really surprised specially when they did not know wether we were hotel guests or not. I asked to speak with the manager as the two of them were making us feel very uncomfortable and all what I got from the manager was a poor apology. Sincerely, I did notice during my weekend how the service in Madrid has gone down terribly...but I would never imagine that in a place where you pay €12 for a drink (please take into consideration Spain's salaries and level of life) you would get that type of service or attitude. I'm sure they would not care about this review as they do not care about their potential customers.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey modern hotel, good area”
Reviews.Author: mintchip21
Reviews.Content: For 200 euros a night, we had a room as big as a closet (literally). And we always felt that the hallways smelled of an after-party...if you know what I mean. The clientele were mostly slightly older people who were trying to be hip. We liked the area, very central and could walk to all the plazas, but I wouldn't strongly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice... Central... Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Ladymann
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of friends in January. Rooms are good. Very complicated light and heat controls which kept shorting meant that we had to move room after midnight after a night out. Staff were helpful, friendly and well informed on all tourist needs. Free wifi is a bonus. Didn't eat at the hotel, but our friends that did really liked it. €25 breakfast is too much though. There are many nice eateries nearby. Centrally located, you can walk everywhere from here. Don't miss the flea market.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good”
Reviews.Author: BatterseaBoy
Reviews.Content: Nothing special. Rooms quite small but well appointed and clean. Staff helpful. Bar, however, not up to 'Madrid' standards.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel but better spot to have a drink on the roof and stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Eric R
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel. Great location and awesome rooftop (bar staff on the roof was super nice). Rooms were tiny. The fridge actually sat next to our bed (they should built the fridge into the closet). Felt like we were rooming with R2-D2. Unless your there's on the company card, there's better spots in Madrid with better prices. Front desk was nice but not overly friendly. downstairs bar nothing to get excited about.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wellfan485
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy walking distance to majority of main sites, and well situated for bars and restaurants. Hotels rooms are nicely done and if you can get one with a view over the main plaza from 3rd 4th floor then well worth it. Reception staff very helpful and all speak English. Too many tavernas to recommend as there is always an other one round the corner, but French restaurant casanis close to hotel is very good, expensive but worth it, nice coffee/breakfast just off plaza canalejas 100m from hotel, only 2.50Euro for tea, big croissant and orange juice and great location. Free wireless Internet in hotel is very good no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay when you visit Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Ashil18
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Location. It is close to everything ranging from historical sight seeing places to restaurants and pubs. The rooms very simply awesome. The service was very good. I got a free upgrade as well. The terrace lounge is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Zeepaard
Reviews.Content: Positive: - Fast checkin - Very good restaurant - Very nice breakfast - Staff speaks English quite well - Good water pressure, nice shower - Very nice and central location - Nice bathroom, good size. Negative: - Shower didn't drain well - Believe the other reviews: the rooms are tiny, hardly any room to move around the bed. Even for me alone it was too small. - Internet stopped working at some point, after they made changes to the wifi. The cable connection in the room didn't have a signal at all. For a business minded hotel, this is very bad in my book. - No hotel information in the room at all. Also no feedback form was provided. Apparently they feel like no improvements can be made? - Breakfast is very expensive at 25 euro - For Melia MAS members (which is free) they advertise 50% off the breakfast price. But this is not the case at all! The actual offer is buy 1 get 1 free. So no use if you're alone. I didn't agree with this and they corrected my bill, which was good. - No airconditioning in the room, to have any fresh air at all I had to open the window, which had no option to open just a little only. Overall, I guess my main problem with the hotel is its attitude. It feels like they're a bit too full of themselves. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “There is better out there...”
Reviews.Author: JudithChalmers09
Reviews.Content: Poor service , overpriced and soulless. No atmosphere in the restaurant or bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: leahsue0602
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very modern, clean and everyone was friendly and professional. We had the breakfast included in our stay and there were so many options to choose from. The hotel is in a great location, overlooking a town square with many restuarants with outdoor seating. We went in March and the roof top bar was not open. Room was good size for a european hotel, bathroom was beautiful with a great shower. The staff/service at the hotel was wonderful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and stylish”
Reviews.Author: Sue-and-Steve-Ascot
Reviews.Content: What a great fun place to spend a couple of days if you are in Madrid on business or pleasure. The ME is in a lovely smaller square in the older part of the city with winding streets, great tapas bars and small shops right on the doorstep. It is close to most of the big attractions and like the rest of Madrid, full of stylish, relaxed people. Some of the rooms are on the small side, but the balcony rooms give great views over the square and the roofs of the city. Everything about the hotel is achingly trendy and hip with all the decor and facilities being designed to create a youthful, urban buzz. the massive bar and lounge has a good vibe to it in the evenings and the restaurant delivers good food at sensible prices - though it is a bit dark for my taste. The staff are all really friendly and helpful and the overall pricing doesn't scare!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous european hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: diva221977
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great central location. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly! The hotel is modern, has a great rooftop bar and nice size rooms. Although they are small it was just right! I can only say good things about our stay and for the price we got it was a steal! I recommend this hotel 100% to anyone looking for fun, location, trendy hotspot and comfort!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, great room, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Racandtac
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights, it was fabulous. So quiet, clean, great bath products and the reception and door staff were just delightful. Their local knowledge was invaluable. One of the best hotels we have stayed in over the last four months overseas. We didn't have a car so parking was not an issue. We were able to walk for ten minutes to get the airport shuttle bus for a euro or two, better than a taxi! We got a taxi there from the railway station and it was ten euro so you can see it is easily accessible. Expensive but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “What a cool hotel!”
Reviews.Author: YetAnotherViajera
Reviews.Content: I googled "cool hotel madrid", and the ME Madrid Reina Victoria was one of the first listings that popped up. It looked good online, and TripAdvisor members gave it high ratings, so we decided to give it a try. It was perfect. We'd never visited Plaza de Santa Ana before. It's a somewhat cozier and brighter plaza than some others in Madrid, and only about a 10-minute walk from El Prado. Our flight arrived early in the morning, so our room wasn't ready - but the staff were very accommodating. They stored our bags, invited us to have breakfast in the dining room, and gave us suggestions for things to see within walking distance. We headed to El Prado - and, within half an hour or so, the front desk clerk called my cellphone to tell me our room was ready. How nice was that?! Our room was very comfortable. It faced onto the Plaza but was surprisingly quiet. We loved the room lighting - different buttons for different moods (work, romance, reading, etc.). And the rooftop bar is fabulous - great lights, great views. But get there early - everything in Madrid starts late, but the best rooftop bar seats here fill up by 9:00 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, a few trade-offs in room choices”
Reviews.Author: San_Diego_Traveler5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ME Madrid for a week-long business trip in November. I received a corporate discount of EUR 149/night. The ME Madrid is a luxury boutique hotel located a short walk from the heart of Madrid, including Puerta del Sol and Plaza Major. It is about a 20-minute cab ride from the convention center, which can cost 15-20 euros, depending on your cab driver's route and traffic. The cab ride from the airport should cost around 40-45 euros, except for on Sundays when there are additional fees. It's a good idea to agree to the price of the cab ride at the airport before you get in the car. I opted for an interior room because the check-in clerk said it was the quietest in the hotel, which is what I requested. There was essentially no view except of a concrete inner courtyard and the windows of the other interior rooms across the way. However, I was okay with this given the tomb-like quietness of the room. The rooms are very comfortable and well designed. The bathrooms are spacious, made of marble, and with a shower that has different shower-head options. There is no bath tub, which seems pretty typical of Madrid. The desk area had plugs that worked with American equipment (like my laptop) with no need for a converter. One interesting detail is that there are about 8 lighting options at the desk area and another 8 next to the bed. It may take a while to figure it out, but you can definitely have lighting exactly as you like it, including a setting called "You Sexy Thing" which basically lights the room up pink. The rooms have large-screen flat TVs embedded into the walls as well as a stereo that sits in a cabinet. Toiletries are Aveda products. A colleague of mine opted for a room with a view and he LOVED it. He looked out over the Plaza de Santa Ana. The only drawback was that it was noisy well into the morning given the partying happening in the plaza. There are many bars and restaurants nearby as well as shopping. What struck me about this hotel is how incredibly warm, friendly and helpful everyone was, from the front desk to the restaurant to room service. I came downstairs one morning too late for breakfast, but they set me up at the bar and made breakfast for me anyway.

Reviews.Title: “vacation”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne62
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel recently 1st October until 5th although it was in a good location for getting around the hotel was disappointing. The first room offered was too small and the view was a brick wall second room was much better bigger and brighter, beds extremely comfortable so good did not want to get up and the bathroom was also fantastic also the room was fully soundproofed when do you ever have that on holiday. The roof top bar did not open before 9pm and it was really great to have a drink up there why they dont open these excellent facilities earlier I do not know We found the downstairs bar dull dark and dingy no bright colours here everything was dark brown. Breakfast was excellent but was served in a room without natural light on holiday we expect to see lots of light and plenty of sunshine there are enough miserable dark places at home. So my advice if staying there would be book a non standard room and enjoy all the beautiful places to visit like the Grand Palace near Plaza Mayor which was magnificent not the Glass one which was empty but situated in a lovely park with boating on the lake and for the Art lovers the Prada takes ages to get around so allow plenty of time. Some fabulous restaurants within walking distance from the hotel so enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: raul151
Reviews.Content: The Location is excellent. The rooms are tidy and nice. I can call it a little party Hotel due to the excellent rooftop bar and lounge which is very popular in Madrid. It was a nice experience for me.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location with a fabulous roof top bar”
Reviews.Author: KelFryer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights after a long 17 hours of flying. First impression is clean, modern and welcoming. The rooms are on the small side so don't expect lots of walking room and you may need to be careful with your luggage. But it's very comfortable and the bathroom has an amazing shower!!! There's more space in the shower than around the bed. The location is second to none with lots of surrounding restaurants and not far from the tube. If you have the chance, head up to the rooftop bar. The drinks are pricey compared to what you'd get in the plaza, but it's worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, excellent staff, fun, central location”
Reviews.Author: bigd13
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel. Modern, a bit funky, and fabulous. The front desk staff couldn't have been more helpful. Their directions, meal suggestions and visit ideas were always right on. We loved looking out on the plaza (except on Halloween night, when it was quite noisy until rather late), and the room was very comfortable, with good storage space and are for 2 large suitcases. You can walk to almost every major sight, tapas bar or restaurant within 15 minutes, and the train station is also walkable if you don't have large luggage. There is also a rooftop bar, which has great views, but is rather expensive. We simply wouldn't stay anywhere else while in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JennyG81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days here on our first stop of a two week trip throughout Spain. We upgraded our room to a Supreme room and it was totally worth it! We also requested a room overlooking the Plaza Santa Ana which was fabulous. Great views at night! The room was beautiful with a wonderfully stocked mini-bar...even Veuve Cliquot champagne! During our entire two weeks, the service never compared to that of the service at the ME. The manager, Miriam, was amazing...she had a bottle of cava and chocolate covered strawberries delivered to our room, one night we arrived to a nice plate of Tapas and she left us a voicemail to make sure everything was up to our standards. You'd think we were celebrities! I can't say enough about how amazing this hotel is and physically, it is a gorgeous building! Location was also very convenient for all the main tourist attractions and close to a metro station. Great little area for dinner at night too and the Plaza Santa Ana is always a busy place! Overall, there is nothing about this hotel that isn't stellar! Stay here, you will not regret it. ME Madrid...we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: maddoginthefog
Reviews.Content: My stay at ME Madrid was awesome, best hotel I have ever stayed. Perfect location, walking distance to many tourist attractions. Rooms are not huge but very clean, pretty and comfortable. Also has cool sexy lights in it. Customer service? they are excellant, and front desk stuff is really helpful. Special thanks to Miriam and all the front desk. Definetly I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff. Rooms on the small side.”
Reviews.Author: jonnyred
Reviews.Content: Staying at the ME Madrid is generally a good experience. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the bars/common areas are really nice. The rooms are nicely decorated, but on the small side. They have fun colour changing LED lighting, which is fun - plus international plug sockets in the room so no need to bring an adapter. I didn't eat in the hotel, except for the room service breakfast which was disappointing. My home made granola was just Special K with strawberries! And it was served without milk. Scrambled Eggs came without any condiments. I would have complained were it not for the crushing hangover brought on by the evening in the excellent penthouse bar - well worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “I went for the roof top bar and got intoxicated”
Reviews.Author: Eelonora G
Reviews.Content: I know this hotel as I often go to Madrid to visit family and friends...I usued to go for the roof top bar ...too bad that last week I went for a rum&coke and got intoxicated!! I already heard the story of bar tenders “cutting” cocktails with illegal/low quality of alcohol, but I wasn’t expecting this from the Melia Hotels!! Especially when you pay 24 Euros for 2 cocktails!! Very, very poor! Will never go back...i spent a whole night puking!!

Reviews.Title: “Viva Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Valeman
Reviews.Content: Not being in the least bit interested in the likes of Goya or Picasso, my wife and I had never really considered Madrid for a city break, so when we did book up to spend three nights there it was more in hope than expectation. But, wow, what a pleasant surprise! Madrid turned out to be a fantastic destination for a short break; even if (like us) you are not interested in Spanish art, it is a worthwhile experience just for the architecture and the buzzing atmosphere. As for the ME Reina Victoria, its location is ideal. For a major European capital, Madrid has an amazingly compact city centre and everywhere of importance was within comfortable walking distance of this hotel. Another plus is that the hotel is surrounded by, literally, scores of restaurants and tapas bars, catering for every taste and budget, which made eating out at night highly convenient and stress-free. The ME prides itself in its “funkiness”, which becomes apparent as soon as you enter as the public areas, which are under-managed by hip young men in the contemporary hip young man’s “uniform” of lounge suit and open neck shirt. We had a standard room and would agree with other criticisms of the size, although being at the rear these rooms are wonderfully quiet. Although small, the layout was very functional and the bed provided a most comfortable night’s sleep. Also, the room temperature control was very manageable and the “sexy lighting” above the bed was a nice bonus – even for a middle aged couple like ourselves! However, in one respect the room was too “funky” for its own good – a lot of space was wasted on a huge drinks cabinet, whose drink prices were so high that only an MP living it up on expenses could have afforded them. We were on a bed and breakfast tariff and did not eat in the hotel otherwise as there was such a wide choice of eating places in the immediate vicinity. In themselves, however, the breakfasts were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, central and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Travelover84
Reviews.Content: The ME is located in a beautiful square near the old quarter of Madrid. Pretty close to the Plaza Mayor and Mercado San Miguel. The rambling streets around the hotel have lots of great tapas bars, kebab shops for late night snacks and interesting shops - with every turn giving you a taste of Madrid's illustrious history. I truly loved the hotel's authentic Spanish style that was both funky and luxurious. Rooms were a touch smaller than i would have liked, but not uncomfortably so. Great bathrooms. Beds were really comfy with a great, complementary pillow menu. The "ask ME anything" button really was put to the test, when my friend came home having stepped in something... undesirable in a nearby park. her shoes were picked up and promptly cleaned without any disdain for the request. we were truly impressed! Great rooftop and lobby bars as well. With beautiful and helpful bar ladies too! great stay and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeanneTan
Reviews.Content: We booked a room on The Level which faced the square. We had a balcony with excellent view and it was incredible to be able to look down on the busy square. If you have a problem with noise at night, I would suggest bringing earplugs as although not too noisy, it might wake you up. I was woken up by noisy partying very late/early! And sound of a rubbish truck (I think) early in the morning. The room itself was adequate in size (some might say it’s a bit on the small side but we didn’t mind) – beautifully furnished and you do get an expresso maker. The bathroom though is strangely positioned – door opens right next to the bed! But the shower is wonderful and we loved the aqua jets. The bed is huge and very comfortable. Worth paying the extra for a room on The Level. The rooftop bar is also great but the view was the same from our balcony – only a few floors higher! The drink prices at the rooftop bar are a bit high and you do have to wait a bit on a Saturday night top be served but worth doing just for the fun of it. Bar staff were very friendly. Be prepared to stand while having your drink because it can get very busy during the weekends. The hotel is also very centrally located and we had a great time walking around and if we did go too far, we just hopped onto the metro to get back. The hotel is a 10 min walk from the nearest metro station. Madrid is a small city and everything is within easy reach. We had a lovely time and I would definitely recommend the ME Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the revolving door”
Reviews.Author: Sampford
Reviews.Content: Went to Madrid for a 4 night break in October. Upgraded to the level room after reading Trip Advisor on the size of the rooms The Level room was expensive - very - but we were treating ourselves The Hotel- Super Reception staff friendly business like NOTHING to much trouble The same with the door staff The hotel was lovely quiet corridors never heard anyone else from our room - only the guy playing the piano accordion outside The room and ALL the hotel was immaculate I know it was a 5* but couldn't really fault anything Well if I am being picky the sexy lighting in the bar/public toilets was so sexy that you needed a torch to see The breakfast was scrumptious the service good Thank you to Julie who looked after us in the restaurant at breakfast The staff at the hotel oozed customer service and nothing was too much trouble Two things to criticize 1st the revolving door in reception is movement activated to as you got into a section it had already started moving so day 1 I got my case stuck in it Day 2 I almost got myself caught in the door after that i used the side doors - much safer 2nd the lift doors were surrounded by chrome mirrored frame until you were used to it it was quite deceptive and I walked into it on the first night and really bruised my arm - no I had not been drinking it was just deceptive to the eye Otherwise it deserved its 5* lovely hotel good area for eating out Good Stay

Reviews.Title: “The best located hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Stas12
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with great staff, superbe location, clean room (with very comfortable bed). Excellent price-quality ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall”
Reviews.Author: Ernesto A
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, very centric, walking distance from major tourist spots. The only concern is that I was traveling with my mom, and we were given a Queen Room, even though we specifically requested a Twin Room for our journey, and got there around 3-4pm, just around check.in time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PamelaF48
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a fantastic weekend. Staff were so helpful, a great variety to eat for breakfast, rooms clean, beds and towels changed everyday. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: MTF20
Reviews.Content: Very nice and fancy Hotel, Helpfull staff and excellent roomservice. The rooms are very nice and I can only recommend to book a stay at the ME Madrid Reina Victoria.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: whitemountainman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights on business. Right in Plaza Santa Ana which is walking distance to Plaza Mayor, Puerta Del Sol, The Prado, and most everything in Madrid you'll want to see. Restaurants galore all over the area. This is an incredibly convenient location. The room was very small but tastefully appointed. Excellent bed and bathroom. The only weird thing was the prominent minibar which was a big square cabinet mounted in front of the TV. Considering the small size of the room, it really took up a lot of floor space and just didn't make sense to me from a design point-of-view. I never got to use the restaurants or Internet. Staff at front desk very helpful and courteous. Housekeeping excellent. Quiet and comfortable. I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable one night stay”
Reviews.Author: ssinc
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 week break in Madrid which started and ended in Madrid. Our last night was in Madrid and we stayed at the ME. This was one of the most expensive hotels we stayed in during our holiday and the only one we had a standard room, we had suites in the other hotels. If we had stayed here at the beginning of our holiday I think we would have enjoyed it more, but we compared this to the other hotels and the room felt small. Having said that, it was a lovely hotel. The room was modern, clean and bright. We didn't eat at the hotel or go to the bar. The location of this hotel is excellent, it's very central and it's easy to walk around the city from here. There are lots of bars and restaurants close to the hotel. We arrived before the normal check in time, but we were able to check in early and get into our room. Staff were friendly at check in and after getting to our room they phoned to check everything was ok and whether we needed any help with the technology. The room was comfortable and quiet, I would consider staying here again but I'd try to get a better deal on a bigger room next time, there are a lot of nice boutique hotels in Madrid and they have better rates.

Reviews.Title: “Just one word: WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: alex m
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and I can assure that It was too short...Everything was perfect, the concierge support (Ms.Miriam De La Horra) was precious, the frontdesk staff were superb, whole employees were extremely polite and gentle. The location is absolutely fantastic, our room had a full view of Madrid, there were a Jacuzzi outside! Can you imagine how romantic was our stay? Simply one of my best experience in hotels worldwide!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Amazing Bed!”
Reviews.Author: DuffyNYC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the ME Madrid in May and were so happy with our choice of stay. The location was perfect and within walking distance from everything. The staff were so friendly and nice. The room (Standard Plaza facing) was very large and had an incredible view of the Plaza Santa Ana. The bed and the bedding was so comfortable that my wife and I ended up sleeping for 14 hours our first night (oops!). The decor is super clean and the bathroom was very modern and sleek. We ate at Midnight Rose and really enjoyed our meal. We also had drinks at the Penthouse and loved the view. It was great, as guests of the hotel, to be able to walk past the long line and go right up to the club/bar. We really enjoyed just sitting out in the plaza having multiple sangrias, being able to stroll 10 feet back to our room. As compared to the rest of Europe, especially Paris and London, the ME Madrid was super reasonable for the quality. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Very Cool Property”
Reviews.Author: SouthernCross99
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the ME last fall and loved it. The rooms were small, but clean. The staff was friendly and the location was beyond perfect. The Plaza de Santa Ana had amazing restaurants, bars and nightlife in the vicinity, and was walking distance to almost everywhere else. The hotel staff was very helpful in recommending restaurants and bars in La Latina and other trendy neighborhoods. Also, they recommended a great place to get massages around the corner, at the fitness center. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Popect
Reviews.Content: If you want a clean, cool and modern hotel in the middlenof the old world charm of Madrid - this is for you. The service was awesome and the food, roof bar, lobby bar were all really very good. Note to those that want real quiet - do not stay on the plaza side. My wife and I did and we were out late, so there was no issues. But if you aren't into the potential ask for a room not facing Santa Ana. You can see the entire city by walking, as this is centrally located. Great restaurants are in every direction along with the mercado. Looking forward to going back or trying another Me.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and central hotel in a lovely building”
Reviews.Author: psellus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in May and loved it! It is situated in a pretty and lively square very centrally near Sol. When you first arrive in the square you will think that it is next to the lovely building at the top of the square but in fact it IS the lovely building at the top of the square! The hotel is funky and has a trendy and popular bar. Initially I was worried that this was going to make it noisy at night but never had an issue. In fact the only problem I had was trying to figure out how the TV remote worked (and I'm a tecchie!) Had to call down to get instructions! Would advise you get a free Melia loyalty card as the good but expensive breakfast is half price that way. Would definitely recommend this as a hotel to stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at this lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maz22
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Plaza St Ana, which is a very central location. Room was contemporary with a very comfy bed and a lovely bathroom and Aveda toiletries. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We had drinks on the rooftop bar which is well worth a visit for the views and ate in the restaurant one night, which was really nice. Can't wait to go back to the ME Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ASeasonedTraveler060
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Central to everything. Upscale and modern. Helpful staff. Chooss a room with a view of the plaza, especially the "level" rooms with outside balcony. Great view of the city and the life on the plaza (but be forewarned the plaza is busy until late, but if you're on the top level, the sound is minimal).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: dandan76
Reviews.Content: Pos: Great location, right on Plaza Santa Ana. close to all museums, walkable to royal palace. Decent size room, modern bathroom, good house keeping service, friendly and helpful concierge. Very accomodating reservation process when I had to shorten my stay due to family emergency. Neg: 3 blocks from Metro so alittle walk. Way to many buttons to figure out(from lighting to A/C) very confusing. Movie or commercial plays across from the hotel in an outdoor setting so can be hard if to sleep with the bright lights and noise if you plan to sleep early

Reviews.Title: “5 star without the 5 star price”
Reviews.Author: Halme
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived the staff were attentive & informative. Our room was sensational, products were good quality, the pillows & bed devine. Would highly recommend this to anyone looking for accommodation with a little extra...

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ann C
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a superb location, the front desk staff - all the staff - were so kind, warm, welcoming. The rooms were very nice and very clean and I loved that the bathroom was separated from the bed area and that the closet was so large and that we got wash cloths! I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very central”
Reviews.Author: TheStevensons555
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel for a special event and were extremely happy with the hotel. The rooms are beautiful - our room looked over the square. You need to keep the windows closed at night though as the Spanish don't seem to sleep until very late. Housekeeping was first class. We didn't eat much in the hotel but what we did seemed a bit pricey. It rained while we were there - oh boy did it rain but the hotel staff gave us umbrellas so saved the day. Go up to the roof if you have the opportunity. The views are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy modern hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth7887
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the lovely Plaza Santa Ana, a 5 minute walk away from Sol and the heart of the city. Hotel staff was friendly and more than willing to offer suggestions and accommodate. There's a lovely rooftop bar and view, which guests are invited to enjoy. Rooms are modern, wonderful comfortable fluffy white beds that we compared to sleeping in a cloud. Bathroom spacious, fantastic shower. Only complaint is that for the price paid (same as The Palace, only $50 less than The Ritz) the deluxe rooms are very small (212 ft), a chunk of space in the small room taken up by the pricey minibar. For this reason we were glad we were only staying one night, had we chosen this hotel for the longer portion of our time in Madrid would've been difficult!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: Lilly197780
Reviews.Content: We're used to travel a lot (around 6 times a year) and we don't have problem to pay more to have better quality, comfort and services as it's a part of the holidays to feel very good. So our comment is in comparison with all Five stars hotels we've experienced. Having said that, I consider The Me Madrid as one of the best hotel I experienced. Staff available and nice, rooms are not the biggest but really designed, clean, the cosmetics provided are high quality ones. Bathroom is clean and practical Food is fresh and excellent Beds are very comfortable We recommend the cocktails in the roof to enjoy the view Position of the hotel is perfect, you can just go to all main streets by walk at less than 10mn We decided to be members of Melia hotels since this experience and we still appreciated Melia hotels all over the world !

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: IWC29
Reviews.Content: I think I may be able to claim my stay at the ME Madrid as one of my most enjoyable hotel experiences ever. The location is perfect right on top of one of Madrid's best squares, minutes from Sol, right by metro stops, more bars and restaurants than you know what to do with and walking distance from the majority of tourist hot spots. The hotel can't be far off claiming its 5th star as head and shoulders above your average 4 star anywhere in the world. I stayed in a basic interior room, which was faultless. Comfortable bed, quiet, great bathroom with rainshower, spotless and for a bottom end room in a city centre hotel surprisingly spacious. The Penthouse is worth a trip but at 5 euros a bottle of beer may not be somewhere you want to stay all night. Staff were superb and service was excellent. Also note lads that the girls on reception are absolutely stunning!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay we have had in Spain”
Reviews.Author: Halmoni48
Reviews.Content: We arrived here 2 days ago and have had exceptional service from the moment we entered the hotel. All staff have been so helpful. Our room is amazing. The beds and pillows Divine! We are coming back later this Month and looking forward to it. Location is brilliant. Really central. Recommend this hotel to anyone. In

Reviews.Title: “totally perfect”
Reviews.Author: brswizz
Reviews.Content: This hotel delivered everything I was hoping for. It was located right in the middle of the old city. We could easily walk to the Royal Palace and the Prado and everywhere in-between. Plaza Santa Anna is probably the 3rd biggest square in the city and very easy to get to. It also has lots of cafes and seemed both lively and safe. The actual hotel was also amazing. The staff was 100% perfect. They seemed to enjoy speaking english. When I checked in at 8am they didnt have a room ready for us but they were happy to email me as soon as the room was ready (which was at 10am). Our room wasnt the 'high end' room but it still had an amazing shower and all the nice modern decor I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Wish I was there now”
Reviews.Author: Hanswijk
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the ME for 2 nights and we enjoyed every minute of our stay. We had a Deluxe room (609) and it was very spacious, great bed and badroom. Nice smell in the corridors. Great breakfast, great service just a great hotel. Nice ladies at the front office. (they all speak English) I will definetly go back. Well located at Plaza Santa Ana all the sights at walking distance. Best place to stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: ELBrenno
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in ME Madrid. Excellent hotel in a great location. Very hip and boutique style. Rooms were really comfortable although I shared a twin and it was a bit small. Bathrooms were very nice all the same. Loads to do in the area and the Santa Anna square has plenty of atmosphere. It was also pretty good value bar the breakfast which is optional - I would suggest going out to a local place for breakfast as it will be pretty much the same.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in all respects”
Reviews.Author: HL2010
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a stay at the ME Madrid Reina Victoria and was hugely impressed. The hotel itself is gorgeous, very modern and in a fantastic location; walking distance to all the main tourist spots and museums. The rooms were well equipped and very clean, with daily room service. I quite liked the fact that there was a safe with a plug in it! Handy for charging phones/laptops whilst out etc. The beds were comfy and we never heard any noise from the plaza or nearby rooms, in fact as it was so quiet and we had blackout curtains,we frequently overslept! We also had an amazing shower with massage water jets- a godsend after a long day sightseeing and interestingly a light option called 'sexy time' which gave the room a purple glow. The staff were always friendly and went out of their way to help, which was appreciated. They had a much better grasp on English than their colleagues in the London Melia. Whilst we didn't eat at Midnight Rose we did visit The Penthouse for cocktails on the roof, a tad overpriced at 15euros but did include the best mohito I've tasted and good views over the plaza. I really can't recommend this hotel enough, for business or pleasure. We will definately stay here if we return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “not a good hotel!! bad standard on the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mikael Y
Reviews.Content: this was my first trip to madrid and gonna be my last.. what at bad hotel this was. holes in the walls, the stereo did not work. extremely uncomfortable beds. very small rooms. smell of sewage in the hotel hallways. porter who lost my laptop bag, so it was destroyed. Hotel would not replace the PC. poor service, and extremely poor English. nothing positive about this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel with Great staff and the Best location”
Reviews.Author: AndrevW
Reviews.Content: Best hotel ever been to. Staff was very friendly, rooms are big and very nice. Walk out of the reception and you will be in the middle of one of the nicest squares in Madrid. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable modern hotel in a vey nice location”
Reviews.Author: Michael_M_Moscow
Reviews.Content: Well designed hotel with excellent views of central Madrid. Has good restaurant though if you want less formal breakfast try small cafes around the square in front of the hotel for classic churros con chocolate and bocadillos con jamon serrano. Very nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Will definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: lunasuperelf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ME for a long weekend. The location is great: close to several central metro stops and in a picturesque square full of cafes and restaurants. The room was small but very clean, modern and well-equipped. The bathroom full of Aveda products which was such a nice treat. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Incredibly professional. The downstairs bar is a great place to have a drink before heading out for the evening. We tried a few of the restaurants in the square and loved the food and the atmosphere. The hotel's location is perfect for heading out on foot to explore the sights, and the area has a real buzz about it. I would definitely return the next time I visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in all respects”
Reviews.Author: Arthur S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was outstanding in all respects. The room was very clean, the beds were extremely comfortable, and the shower was amazing. The breakfast buffet was great and all members of the hotel staff went out of their way to care for us. We had a great view of the Plaza de Santa Ana from our terrace and the location of the hotel was perfect for us. I would give this hotel my highest recommendation and urge any friends going to Madrid to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location”
Reviews.Author: arjwales
Reviews.Content: The ME Madrid is a lovely building in a great central location. Right on your doorstep are great places to eat and drink and museums, galleries and parks are all in walking distance. The service was fantastic, helpful friendly staff (apart from in the rooftop bar where the bar tenders are too cool to crack a smile) who trip over themselves to help and the ladies look beautiful with their white blouses with pink sashes. The view from the rooftop at night is worth a look but maybe not worth the €18 paid for a beer and a mojito. Aside from the excellent galleries a must do is a visit to mercado de San miguel where the tapas and wine is amazing along with the atmosphere. I would return to this hotel and recommend it although the standard rooms are tiny but the bathrooms are great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: ceelynn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located on Plaza de Santa Ana, near Gran Via and Plaza Mayor. There are a few tapas bars in the Plaza directly out the door. Rooftop terrace is nice, but nothing to write home about really. Free wifi is a plus. Service is fantastic; everyone was very eager to help and extremely friendly. Rooms are modern with a nice lighting control panel near the bed . The air conditioning was really powerful and kept the room very cool even cold if you turned it up enough. (a must have in Madrid in August!) Oh, and the shower is the best ever! Only minor complaints is that the room was quite small, which made ironing a bit of a challenge. There is also no where near a mirror to plug in your hair dryer. I ended plugging the dryer into the safe and stretching it near a mirror. Not ideal, but not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “ME was a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goalieman688
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights during our return trip the states and really liked the hotel. The rooms and everything is modern, trendy and clean. The rooms were TINY and very tough to manuever for two people. The bathrooms and everything else were very clean and the showers had six nossles and an overhead thing which was cool. I found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful in scheduling dinners, spa treatments or just providing general directions/guidance.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING VIBE & EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: ChavonnehSolGroup
Reviews.Content: I completely enjoyed my stay at the ME Madrid. For starters, the location. It is in the heart of Plaza Santa de Ana- tons of local restaurants, tapa bars, shops, & culture. When my colleague and I arrived, we KNEW we were in a great area. The service, from arrival to departure, was so pleasant & warm. The staff really warmed the hotel. The hotel itself is a hybrid of old world design but with modern updates- yet it still retains it's classic soul. I walked into my room and there was top 40 music playing- which set a nice tone since I LOVE music. The ambient lighting was also very memorable. You can really 'set the mood' in these rooms (if you know what I mean). I also had a beautiful view of the plaza. I would highly recommend anyone going to Madrid to stay @ the ME. I would certainly go again. -Chavonne

Reviews.Title: “Modern Yet Maintains Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: annjensen5
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here one night and loved this beautiful hotel. The decor was fantastic and the architecture of the actual building was stunning. I slept during most of my stay but I can say that the beds were VERY comfortable and the mini bar especially was very well stocked. The staff and service were beyond helpful, almost too helpful at times! If I return to Madrid I will for sure be returning to this beautiful hotel which is very well situated in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel service”
Reviews.Author: Creeping_Death_LA
Reviews.Content: We drove in on a Sunday and had trouble getting to the hotel, finally we made it and luckily they have their own underground parking. This will cost you $40 per night to park your vehicle. We drove in from the south of Spain and dumped our rental car the next day, you don't need a rental car in Madrid. The hotel is very nice inside, the staff is beyond helpful. The deluxe room we stayed in overlooked Plaza Santa Ana. The room was spacious and the bathrooms were very modern. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to all the attractions. There are many restaurants and shops right outside the hotel. The breakfast was very good and the food was always fresh, no old stale bread like some hotels. The spacious roof top bar is a popular hang out in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: cbourdon
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at a chic hotel for a good price with a good location, this is the place! We stayed at this hotel during the first week of our trip in Spain and we loved it!! Never had to take public transportation since everything was close by! Great customer service and beautiful room! The hotel is located in a Plaza and many tourists were going to this plaza to take specifically pictures of this hotel! Beautiful view of Madrid at the top where there is a bar called the Penthouse. This bar is listed in travel books as well. Food around the Plaza is great, don't need to go far to have a good time. On the other side of the hotel, in another plaza, there is one of the best Jazz club, Cafe Central, where we saw a show live. It was simply amazing! I recommend this hotel to all!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: statters
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of July with my boyfriend and was very pleasantly surprised. Unlike some of the other reviews that talked about how bad the service was our experience was quite the opposite. When we checked in at 11 am on a Sunday our room was ready. We booked a room that looked onto the Santa Ana plaza and I would strongly reccomend you do the same. We got a peak at the interior rooms and they are smaller and darker. Our room was flooded with light and it was much more spacious. The bed was super comfortable. Overall the room was clean and well appointed. The people at the front desk were very friendly and extremely helpful (one of them spent 15 mins with us telling us all the points on the map to go to and all his recommendations were great - the best being that instead of going to the San Miguel market to walk to the Mercado de San Antón at Calle Augusto Figueroa 24, Chueca. We walked there every morning - takes about 15 to 20 mins - and bought our breakfast for cheap . A croissant downstairs at the food stalls and then up the escalator to one of the eatery places ...forget which one ...but they have a 2euro special of toast and a coffee. The toast is baguette style and the coffee is delicious. The hotel location was great and the Santa Ana plaza a perfect place to get a beer in the afternoon ...there is one patio about 2 patios over from the lateral restaurant patio where all beer is 1 euro if you order food...otherwise it is 2 euro. Hhowever you can get a cone of potato chips for 1 euro so if you do that and get a beer then you have chips and beer for 2 euro instead of just a beer. Do not eat at Lateral though...mediocre tapas would be a compliment for this place. If I were to return to Madrid there is nowhere else I would stay...you cannot go wrong booking a room at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Very trendy!”
Reviews.Author: MissTinaIrvine
Reviews.Content: Our room and stay at the Me Madrid was magnificent! We had the Level suite which had a marvelous terrace attached to it. The master bedroom was spacious and the master bath was luxurious. We had a sitting room with a couch that converted to a bed. There was also a separate bath with a toilette and sink. This room was perfect for our family of four. The staff here was very helpful and friendly. The location was great also. Walking distance from shopping and Plaza Mayor. My husband and I enjoyed the rooftop bar at the hotel called the Penthouse. I almost did not want to leave the ME! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Location”
Reviews.Author: circuitdogg
Reviews.Content: After a flight a checkin to the ME Madrid is like an oasis. The checkin staff were excellent, conceirge very helpful. The room was very comfortable, and rainshower complete with AVEDA body products very enjoyable. You can walk or take the subway as the hotel is centrally located. The restaurant and breakfasts are great, although a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “One Word - Amazing !!!”
Reviews.Author: MarcHanlon
Reviews.Content: I booked us for a short four day break for my girlfriend and I as we have always wanted to visit Madrid. After hearing so many good reports about the Me Madrid and wanted try and see if the rumours were true. We arrived at the Me Madrid at approximately 13:30 on a Thursday and was greeted by the receptionist, who explained that we was slightly early for check-in however our room was being cleared and should be ready within 30 minutes. This wasn't a problem to us as we was aware that normal check-in was at 2pm so we was happy to wait for a bit. He then took time our and explained where everything was i.e restaurant, breakfast room, bars etc and then asked us if we had visited Madrid before and what our intentions were whilst we were their. We explained that it was our first visit and that we was looking to do the normal sit seeing. The receptionist then took time out to explain his recommendation of the various sites and places to see/go to whilst we were there he also offered to booked anything that we wanted. After this brief conversation he told us that our room was ready and gave us our keys etc and asked for a porter to show us to our room. I booked us in a Deluxe room but was upgraded complimentary to s Supreme room which was amazing. Our room was fitted with the usual TV, free Wi-Fi, a 32-inch plasma TV & usual bathroom amenities as well as our own private balcony and views of the Plaza de Santa Ana and the Plaza del Angel which set the long weekend off to a good start. Once we unpacked we decided to take a little look around Madrid and see some of the sites that the receptionist talked about. After walking 5 minutes we came across the Grand via and realised that the location of the hotel was in fact better than first thought. After walking around for a few hours and see the sites we made our way back to the hotel to freshen up and the go our for a drink and bite to eat. Once we entered the hotel we was greeted by our names by the staff there. When we checked in we was recommended to to try the hotels own "Black Mojito" so we decided to give the hotel bar a quick go before we went out for a bite to eat. I ordered the Mojito and my girlfriend ordered a cosmopolitan. Both drinks arrived within 5 minutes, The Mojito lived up to it's recommendation and the cosmopolitan was left with it very own shaker for my girl friend to keep.. Obviously it's a small touch but these things make a difference. It was my girlfriend birthday on the Friday and we made our way down the the breakfast room for breakfast upon our return we saw a message left on our voice mail from the check in manager wishing my girlfriend a happy birthday, again another small touch which made a difference. We decided to take a bus tour around Madrid which the hotel booked for us. The tour took the whole day and once we arrived back at the hotel a complimentary cake and bottle of champagne was left in the room for my girlfriends birthday. This wasn't requested but it was gratefully received. For the rest of the weekend we visited other tourist attractions like the Royal Palace and Plaza Mayor and found that all attraction were within a good 15 minutes walk from the hotel. Although Madrid isn't a big city the hotel was still well located and the use of taxi wasn't really needed for our stay. Our overall experience of the Me was fantastic and I would recommend the hotel to anyone that wants to visits Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in an Excellent Location - would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: holly989blue
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best hotels we have stayed in. It was very clean and modern with lovely, original touches such as the 'sexy light' and purple mini bar. Although a bit more pricey than we would normally pay, we really enjoyed our stay and would return. My husband would retreat to the hotel every afternoon to escape the boiling July heat, because the air con was such a relief! We stayed on the 1st floor overlooking a little square, which was lovely. We would thoroughly recommend a little tapas bar called Lateral in the square infront of the hotel as the food was so delicious and great value for money. The hotel staff were very attentive and the cocktails on the roof bar to die for, if a little pricey. Be careful to check the prices before adding to your room tab since there is a glass of whisky which will cost you £100!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel In Madrid!!!!”
Reviews.Author: harj87
Reviews.Content: I have just recently returned from Madrid with my company and we stayed at this hotel. Having stayed at the Ritz previously we decided to stay at the ME, all I have to say is that it is FANTASTIC!!! So much better than the Ritz. The staff, the location, the restaurant, Breakfast,everything in my opinion was 5 Star!! My only negative was that our room (standard double) was a little on the small side and we felt a little cramped and annoyingly some of our colleagues were allocated a junior suite on the 6th floor which had amazing views of the Plaza. However I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a 5 Star type hotel. I was so impressed in fact that I have booked the hotel again in August for a midweek break with my best friend and cant wait to return for a holiday this time!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RSFJulie
Reviews.Content: We loved the ME Madrid Hotel! It is rather expensive, but worth it. The location is perfect -- you can walk EVERYWHERE -- the staff is incredibly kind and helpful, and the rooms are very comfortable. Also, the buffet breakfasts were terrific. Our view over the square from our 5th floor balcony was beautiful ... just be warned that people do party ALL NIGHT in the summer. On one of the nights, it got a little loud from 3:30 - 5:30 am! Our kids were across the hall (in a cheaper room) and it was perfectly quiet, there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for city break, superb location. Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Babyblackbird
Reviews.Content: Stunning building, newly refurbished with modern decor with great attention to detail. Room was well laid out, Aveda toiletries, excellent shower. We had a Level Room with a balcony looking over the square - couldn't fault the room for quality, although square footage was tight. The bed was very comfortable, and lovely quality cotton sheets. Choice of pillows. Staff were all very friendly and efficient too, no waiting around at all. The location is excellent, overlooking the Santa Ana Plaza with it's many bars and restaurants and a short walk to Plaza Major and the Sol area. Great hotel for a luxury city mini break. (Not sure how family friendly it would be though).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great position!”
Reviews.Author: mirolach
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. The rooms are very nicely fitted out, although quite small. We were lucky to have a small balcony with a view over Plaza Santa Ana and enjoyed opening out to the buzz on the street. The windows must be triple glazed as once closed we could barely hear the noise downstairs. The staff were generally helpful with booking tickets and restaurants for us, although we did have to convince one person that it was possible for him to book things online with a foreign credit card. But then another staff member was so helpful he was texting us with restaurant options while we were out - I have never had service like that before! Room service was very slow when we ordered, and our room wasn't ready by 3pm the day we arrived, but despite these few hiccups I would still recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Wolish
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a fantastic character in an excellent location for exploring Madrid. We stayed in the standard room which is very small but actually well designed so it doesn't feel uncomfortable. Bed was great as was bathroom. Breakfast had an excellent choice of hot and cold food. The front desk staff were very knowledgeable and helpful. Roof top bar was cool with an impressive view.

Reviews.Title: “Service leads a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: svale26
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we thought it looked very stylish and on arrival we were not disappointed. There are candles burning in reception, and the rooms are stylishly decorated with a nice bathroom and cool lighting. However, the service was next to zero. The reception was rude refusing to move us even though our room was noisy all night from the plaza santa ana- bottle in the bottle ban and the taxi rank all night... The penthouse is not all it is made out to be, the midnight rose is actually nicer- but rather loud.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel, comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: vietnambound
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ME Madrid hotel for three nights, and were pleased with our choice. The Puerto Santa Ana is busy square in front of the hotel, and we were happy our room faced the quieter Plaza Del Angel. There was double glazing and the weather was slightly rainy so we had no noise problems, though it's a busy area and we may just have been lucky. The room is comfortable, the bed and shower excellent, and unlike some I liked the "sexy lighting"! The front desk were keen to help with bookings, and the food at breakfast and the one dinner we had was excellent. TIP: join the hotel's frequent stayer loyalty programme - we got half price breakfasts. The one disappointment was the bar on the rooftop. The weather was slightly rainy so the outside seating was closed - but the inside bar was not full of interesting Madrid nightlife - the crowd were a bunch of boozing Australian tourists, barely out of their teens. Hardly the sophisticated scene i had anticipated! We found the location great - mid way between the Royal Palace and the Prado, and when we ventured further afield we used the Puerto del Sol metro station, easy!

Reviews.Title: “Far from perfect”
Reviews.Author: les52
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked as though it was going to be fantastic, and it was comfortable, and in a perfect location with the square outside with a variety of places to eat. However there were several problems and the staff did not behave in the way I would expect to ensure they were resolved quickly. Our room was not ready by official check in time and although we went off for lunch and a wander it was still not ready at the time they told us to come back. We waited another hour in the lobby, in the end I asked for a complimentary cup of tea while we waited - they brought one, there were two of us so another had to be requested. I would have expected them to have used more sense and to have routinely offered this with much apology for keeping us waiting for so long. The room was very small, facing in to a square of other rooms so quite dark, no view and the proximity of other rooms meant keeping the curtains closed. It was nicely appointed but we quickly found a problem with the socket in the bathroom, the external cover was loose so when you plugged the hairdryer in the whole plug fell out . We kept telling them about his, someone came and had a look and just balanced the socket cover back, we tried telling them again but in the end we gave up, so it took two people to dry hair, one to hold the plug in the other to hold the hair dryer. On the second day I saw a large cockroach run across the bathroom floor into my slipper so I was able to deal with it but thank god I had seen it or I would just have put my foot in, crunch, yuck. We told them about this, they seemed shocked but no sign of fumigation in the room or anything. We didn't have the breakfast or eat in the restaurant so can't comment on that. We enjoyed our time in Madrid but these problems and the lack of response by the staff made the hotel a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: NectaandChris
Reviews.Content: Great location, right in Plaza Santa Ana (which is packed every night with an abudance of people enjoying tapas and sangria outdoors). Hotel has one of Madrid's popular rooftop outdoor ba/club called the penthouse. Rooms are comfortable and the hotel is surounded by many great tapas eateries.

Reviews.Title: “When can we going back?”
Reviews.Author: SoCalGal41
Reviews.Content: This property is centrally located and was perfect for what we wanted. It was near great restaurants and sites, the rooms were swanky and the service was spectacular! While visiting Spain, this was our last property and a little of a splurge however, well worth every Euro! The AM breakfast was extensive and very well done! You can get everything from the classic tomate with pan, chorizo & prosciutto to American items such as mini pancakes and eggs. The view is worth paying a little more for! We had a panoramic view of the Plaza de Santa Ana and loved it. As beautiful, modern and convenient as the property is, the best part of it was the service. Upon arrival, we encountered Pedro at the Front Desk. He was helpful, informative, fun and most important, genuine. He took us to our room and explained every detail that we may need to know. Upon arrival in the room, we had a nice welcome note from Miriam on a notecard as well as written on the bathroom mirror. What a great touch! I thoroughly enjoyed this property and cannot wait to go back to experience more!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: tangojue
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 4 days and was very impressed, happy, and extremely satisfied. Service was impeccable, facilities state of the art modern, delicious food, perfect location with all major sights nearby, extremely comfortable rooms and the views from our room were beautiful. We got way more than we expected. An extra treat was the rooftop bar with spectacular night views of the area. Non guests at the hotel had to pay to get in to experience this. Staff at every level was totally professional and friendly. All greetings had a warm friendly helpful smile. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing in every single way!”
Reviews.Author: AdelePh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, 3 days in May this year and it was fantastic! The location cannot be any better, so close to everything. We were within walking distance to all the attractions.
