We came here to celebrate a birthday, so upon reading many reviews on this website and seeing many replies from Jose Arenas, a manager at the hotel, I decided to get in contact with Jose prior to booking the hotel. Jose was amazing. He replied to all my emails, answered all my questions and even personally selected the perfect room (room 528) for our stay. The room was perfect! It has a balcony that overlook the Plaza Sta Ana. And there was no noise from the plaza nor from the Penthouse rooftop bar and club reported by most in their reviews. Jose was even there to personally welcome us to the hotel when we got there. When we got to our room, there was beautiful music playing in the room (Jose has left an iPod in the room for us to use! How sweet was that! A great touch!), a cake for the birthday celebration and even a chilled bottle of Champagne! All these were complimentary of the hotel. All little details were taken care of and nothing was too much... It was simply amazing. We loved our room, all the little details that was taken care of and the kind of personal and warm services provided by Jose and every single staff of the hotel. It made our stay very enjoyable and definitely very pleasant and memorable! When I wanted to have a manicure, a staff of the hotel even walked with me to the Palacio Beauty and Spa which is just around the corner of the hotel. Talk about great service!  I would also like to thank Jose Arenas again for everything that he has done to help make this birthday celebration trip so amazing and memorable. He played a major role in ensuring that we had an amazing time in this amazing city. So thank you, thank you, thank you! You're a gem! And the hotel has many amazing staff that makes staying at this hotel so comfortable and amazing!  I have nothing to fault this hotel. It was perfect in every single way! I would stay here again without any doubt when I come back for another visit!

Reviews.Title: “Fancy hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Matossi
Reviews.Content: All new rooms, great roof terrace and bar and very good bar.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star in every way”
Reviews.Author: 2Fussy4words
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good things about this hotel. Perfect location, luxurious, friendly and exceptionally professional staff, everything you could possibly need or want. Without a doubt this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in and I wouldnt hesitate to recommend it to anyone. It may be a bit pricier than some hotels but believe me it is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel for the young at heart”
Reviews.Author: Fred3rick
Reviews.Content: It's about time I got around to writing this review. I visited Madrid with my fiancée in March this year. I booked 3 nights in the Melia Reina. We stayed in the urban suite (double room with separate lounge, bedroom and bathroom). With this suite came a variety of upgrades - which to be honest - I had no idea about when booking, which made the visit all the more engaging upon arrival....Our own "guest experience manager" 24 hours a day, privileged access to a VIP area on the rooftop penthouse terrace and unlimited easy access to drinks at the Midnight rose bar even when full of general public on Friday evening. The hotel is superbly located in the centre of town more or less and has walking distance access to almost all of the tourist hotspots in the city - it really depends on how much you like to get out and about. We found all of the hotel staff extremely helpful and friendly with really good local knowledge - plenty of advice given on the best places to visit and the best times to visit them - which to me, is even more important as Madrid is one busy city! Throughout the hotel you are greeted with a different fragrance depending on where about you are and what time of the day - Wonderful. The mini bar (we had two!) is well stocked with an excellent selection of refreshments (as you would expect from a 5 star) as guess what.....you can even purchase the various fragrances from your own mini bar! - Nice touch I thought. The room was equipped with an iPod which had the full selection of the various styles of music which is constantly playing around the hotel, and it even had the selected playlist from the exact room where you will have heard it playing - lobby bar late evening for e.g. - Genius!! Hotel could have done with a gym or massage facility as we liked to walk around the city and see the sites, so the end of the day would suit a foot massage! This is offered at the sister Gran Melia hotel near-by though and can be arranged by reception all too easy. Breakfast was excellent - with a wide variety of delights - if anything the breakfast room was a bit small - but well kitted out. Restaurant had great reviews - We didn't actually eat there but we met several people during breakfast that had nothing but good things to say. Drinks where good - beers & wine were cold, and the speciality "dark mojito" was excellent - but be warned, the cocktails are pricey around 14euro per mojito....but it is a 5 star and you do feel like a privileged individual drinking it at this hotel. Will we go back?.... Of course, I'm back there in September! Frederick

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: JimClose
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling to Madrid on a regular basis for two and a half years. I have stayed at many hotels in that time and discovered the ME Reina Victoria in early 2010. I have stayed there many times and can honestly say that it has become a home from home for me. First the down side - cost. It's not cheap, and a beer in the bar is quite pricey even by central Madrid standards. It also doesn't have a pool, but nor do most Madrid hotels. Simple solution - book early for the best deals, and limit your drinking (there are plenty of alternatives nearby if needed). Now the up sides. The outstanding feature of this hotel is the staff. The service is truly exceptional - no detail is missed, everyone from senior management to the "doers" is completely dedicated to making your stay as pleasant as possible. There are two bars - Midnight Rose on the ground floor which was voted "best in the world" in 2008 I think - and the Penthouse on the roof. Both are uber-cool, frequented by beautiful people, and are the place to be seen. The Penthouse is only open during the warmer months and is often hired out for private functions, but it's worth a trip up there just for the views across Madrid. The restaurant food is high class, and the tapas menu in the bar is outstanding (also reasonable value). The rooms are modern style, wooden floors, minimalist, but very comfortable. Most rooms seem to have superb walk-in showers and very good bathroom facilities. You have the usual hotel TV system, but also a DVD and connection for iPod and radio with excellent sound system. All rooms have irons too. If you can, go for the higher floors because Plaza de Santa Ana is busy until the early hours, but the hotel thoughtfully provides ear plugs, and actually the sound insulation is good anyway. There is a gym in the basement which has two each of running machine, cross-trainer, stepper, and also free-weights. It's rarely busy. If it's not too hot outside, then the Retiro Park is exactly 1km away and is a great place to go running. The hotel is well-placed for the top cultural attractions: the Prado, Thyssen Bornemisza, Plaza Mayor, Royal Palace and the shopping around Sol. There are dozens of bars and restaurants to choose from in the area. For users of the metro system, Sol is 5 minutes away, Atocha 10 minutes. The airport is a €30 taxi ride. Honestly, I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. I've been there on business and leisure and would not want to stay anywhere else in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Central Gem - Very Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Mon_Petite75
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with the value for money at this hotel. It is very modern and is in such a central location. It is sits right in the Plaza Santa Ana where there is a hive of activity and plenty of tapas bars and restaurants to chose from. It is centrally located within 5 minutes walking distance to Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Gran Via and almost everything else is within walking distance. It is not too far from the airport and the taxi cost me 37EU. You can also catch a train if you wish as the Puerta del Sol station is close by (note - you will have to change train stations to arrive at Puerta del Sol). As soon as you walk in you feel welcomed. The ambience they have created with the decor and music is warm and inviting. The rooms are well sized for European city standards. I stayed in a standard room and it was perfect. The bathroom was a good size too and very modern - the shower was large and even had extra jets on the side which were very luxurious! Despite being so central to all the activity you are able to sleep well as you cannot hear any noise from outside and they have the softest sheets. The tv also has many channels with about 9 different languages to chose from - handy if your Spanish skills are as bad as mine! The service was also great. My only regret is that I didn't have a chance to visit the Roof Top Bar. If I return to Madrid this would my first hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at its Finest”
Reviews.Author: Suzee2351
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled to Spain for a three city vacation (Madrid, Marbella and Sevilla). I stayed in Madrid for 2 nights on the front end and one night on the back end of my trip. From the moment I booked my trip the staff at the ME Madrid made me feel like a welcomed guest. Miriam De la Horra, an Experience Manager for the ME Madrid, contacted me by e-mail to make sure that I had everything I needed for my trip. She arranged for car service to and from the airport to the hotel and when I arrived at the hotel, she personally took me to my room and described all of the wonderful hotel amenities. I stayed on the LEVEL floor - which I highly recommend. On the front end of my stay I had a spectacular terrace off of my room with a 6 person dining table on one level and 2 relaxing lounge chairs on the other. The room and terrace had a view of the sky and after a long trip from the States to Spain - that is all I wanted to gaze at. On the back end, I stayed in a LEVEL room with a wonderful view of the Plaza that sits in front of the hotel. From my balcony I could hear the street musicians play and gaze at all the people enjoying a good bottle of wine and a fabulous meal. Speaking of fabulous meals - Miriam did it again with a wonderful restaurant recommendation when I mentioned my craving for paella on my last day in Madrid. I must admit that up until this point I was not very impressed with the customer service I received in most restaurants throughout Spain. Whether it was a negative American sentiment or the lack of a tip incentive (which is silly - I tip for good service no matter the country) - the restaurant staff in Spain was pretty consistently rude. Not my paella restaurant - the service was sublime. From hot dinner rolls, to LARGE water bottles at our table (you will only get that if you have ordered water at a meal in Spain) and attentive service (plus fantastic food), my niece and I could not stop raving about our dining experience. It would not be fair if I did not mention all the other staff at the ME Madrid that made my visit so special. Many thanks go to the room service staff who not only kept the Cava bottles coming - but took the time to recommend places to visit and bars that would be fun for my niece and her friends. Also, the front desk staff, each time I left the hotel and entered it I was greeted with a big smile and warm greeting. And housekeeping - my room was always clean and tidy and I welcomed the turn down service at night. The ME Madrid far exceeded my expectations and I would recommend the hotel without any concerns to business travellers, couples and people travelling with older children that want to be in a lively area of town. Fabulous restaurants are steps away from the hotel and the museums are a healthy walk or quick cab ride away. Last note, each night at turn down a pair of ear plugs was left for me. I have lived in NYC and many other major cities so street noise is not a problem. But if you are a light sleeper - the hotel has a very trendy bar on the roof and the noise may be a bother. HOWEVER, it did not bother me one bit!! LOVE THIS PLACE!!

Reviews.Title: “Biggest Bluff Ever!”
Reviews.Author: alicetravel
Reviews.Content: "everything is possible, but today im sorry not everything is possible" should be the moto of this Hotel. The conceirge is called "everything is possible," they make a point of telling you that everytime you call them; except when you actually ask them to do something-- as simple as a massage, turns out no it is not possible. The staff was awful, uncoordinated with eachother, unreliable. They were not rude most of the time, but they also were very incompetent and misleading. For example, we arrived with a rental car that was suppose to be picked up the next day. As we took a Level (upgraded) room, we were told that we had a car wash and parking complimentary. We told them, thats ok but the car is being picked up next day in the morning by the rental company. The next day in the morning no one came to take the car. At 3 pm i called the reception worried, the reception told me that they had spoken with the rental company not to worry that they would come by the end of the day. The same day after dinner at around 12, we went to see what was up with the car... it was still standing there and unwashed-- and there were only two other cars in the parking lot ( the lot had at least 50 spaces-- it was not hard to miss our car). So again we went to reception, as clearly they should have notified us that the car was still standing there and unwashed not as they had promised. In the evening when we spoke with reception, it was a different person and they had no idea that the car was even in the hotel (there were only 2 other cars), and promised us to make a point of having reception call the next day, first thing in the morning about the car, and accepted a very nice tip. Next day in the morning, I call reception at 11 and ask them about the car-- again they have no idea, of course no one has spoken to the car rental company, and the car is still there and they told me that no one even spoke to them the day before since the rental company was closed-- so we were clearly LIED to! So we called the rental again ourselves, since the hotel clearly could not handle something so simple as returning a car. At 3 pm we checked again with reception, and found out the car indeed was taken, but of course it was too much for the hotel to have notified us. Basically our whole stay we were chasing the reception about the car. Not to mention, at checkout they tried to charge us 20 Euro for those two calls after they told us local calls were complimentary and we should not have even had to call the rental as the hotel claimed they handled that. Again LIED! And they tried to charge us 30 Euro a day parking (60 Euro total), after telling us that parking was no extra charge. The internet-- slow is an understatment. It loads google and nothing else. We even tried to use the internet that you pay for on the TV which also did not work and cost 11E. When we told them this at the checkout, we were told "oh yes, we had a problem with internet yesterday and today" which is not the case, the whole stay the interenet was nonexistant, and clearly it still doesnt work... So again they have a convenient LIE to explain. The resteraunt which they are so proud of was very very mediocer-- a whole table next to us sent back their food-- we ate there lunch and dinner twice and it was all very average if edible at all (the tuna tartar is good), and of course super overpriced-- which does not bother me so much if the food is good but here it was not. Even the person who sat us for Lunch, acted very rude as if she didnt have the time of day for us when the whole resteraunt was empty-- only when I yelled at her that we were guests she paid attention as she realized she had no choice. Also in check in, one person promised I could have 3 shirts pressed because of the Level room complimentary. The next day a different person claimed that was not true and I had to argue with them. They told me all the shops would be open on Sunday, except 80% of shops were closed becuase it was the first of the month. Youd think a hotel would realize the date, but that was too much awareness for them. The card keys dont work if you go through a metal detecter of any kind, like the ones at the meusems and all the other shops-- but the hotel didnt even tell me this. Guests told me this becuase everyone was having that problem the whole time. And you have to use the key to go up the elevator, so people wind up just going up and down (saw several lost people before we all figured it out). They advertize on the TV in the room "ME spa" except as everything else, it is a bluff. There is no spa. There is a small room in the basement where they can bring a masseus from the outside to do a massage. I tried to do this as my boyfriend's back was completely ruined from the very soft beds in the hotel. but this day not everything was possible. AFter I pointed out how misleading they were, they managed to find someone although I have no idea where from. Every charge in the hotel has another hidden charge which they do not tell you about. For example room service theres a charge, a gratitude charge is added (7%), and tax... at check out there is a mysterious "habitacions" charge of 5 Euro added each time. Even at the check out, we put our bags into a room to be held for a few hours since we had to check out before we went to the airport. We came back the guy claimed they were not there. We told him he was looking in the wrong room, but he insisted it was the right room. Finally he listened to us, and brought our bags.... But basically everyhing you asked the hotel to do was impossible. And at checkout, there were 2 men at the desk, one was a manager who we had spoken to about the issues with the bill and had very reluctantly taken off the phone charges, but could not be bothered so he sent us a very petite blonde girl to help us drag two very heavy suitcases. She tried to explain to us that the guy who usually helps with the bags is "fixing something" (she made hand gestures to demonstrate) and said she would help us, except she couldnt lift the bag. So then she went backt o talk to the manager who then reluctantly came to help us. One of the managers was by far the sleeziest. He is a huge CONARTIST!!!! and if you speak to this man I would beware. In general, do not trust anything the hotel tells you becuase at best it is a half truth. Especially not what the manager says. You will notice that he has very bladly bitten nails, probably from all the stress of his scams and skelletons in his closet. He is short with black hair, BEWARE... this is serious. He will try to suck you dry for everything you have while he very politely smiles in your face. On the plus side, I agree with the posts below that the shower was pretty coolwith the jets (although it leaked) and also the cleaning ladies were awsome, on surface everything looks nice and chic(emphasis on surface), and with our upgraded room we had a very nice balcony facing the square which was very pleasant and espresso machine. And the location is very convenient. But do NOT go to the "tapas" bars in the square that the hotel reccomends. In general be weary, when someone says Tapas to you with a lot of excitement, sometimes its not even Tapas.. more like crapas served the same as in any other resteraunt around the world but tastes bad. My final reccomendation, if you must stay at this hotel since it has a central location, and its aesthetic appeal, do not expect to have any service and you are better off going to a internet cafe and figuring things out yourself. The hotel will simply lie to you and misinform you. Also do not eat at the hotel-- average overpriced food. Do not expect a spa, internet, or any modern functioning electronic equipment. And my main issue with the hotel is the conartist service you recieve. They lie to you instead of admitting that they did something wrong, which puts you in the position where you simply do not trust what the staff tells you. On a vacation you do not want to have to worry about all the little things when your staying at a hotel in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & restaurant, good room”
Reviews.Author: andre_in_oz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very new and well designed (modern design, if you like "oldfashioned" style then it's not your type of hotel). The location is excellent, we didn't use the metro for anything! We were able to walk to everything easily (Royal Palace and Prado/Thyssen in 10 minutes each) and the hotel is surrounded by many restaurants. The hotel restaurant itself is excellent! The room was well (big safe, good cupboard, big working area) although a little small for a 4-star-hotel. However the bathroom is spacious and very well. Per se I would re-use this hotel at a future visit. The breakfast is a little pricy but get the free "mas"-rewards program of the Melia-Group and you get 50% off.

Reviews.Title: “A dream hotel stay - like your fantasy home”
Reviews.Author: PrincessPeace
Reviews.Content: The staff are super friendly, they upgraded our room which having a baby with us worked really well as th baby slept really well in the separate corridor. The bathroom shower is amazing - these fantastic jets or rain drop shower head. The products are all aveda - no expenses spared here. Great mirrors, large beds I can't rave enough about this hotel - babysitting can be arranged for an additional cost... The one bad thing is that wi fi while free is very very slow - so slow you can't rely on it. So don't.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alewishotel
Reviews.Content: Clean, Tidy and unique ! Excellent location and great staff. Roof top Terrace is great, Amazing views and great place to have a drink after great dat in the city

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel...Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: fpotucek
Reviews.Content: ME Madrid sits perfectly in the heart of Madrid. Just 25-30 minutes from the airport and 10 minutes to Atoche train station to catch the Renfe. We were greeted by friendly english-speaking staff and able to check in to our room early (7am). Most of the important stuff in Madrid stems off of Plaza Mayor. In fact there is an excellent 3hr walking tour that is provided for FREE which meets in Plaza Mayor at 10:30am (look for the red umbrella) Be careful with the Atoche train station and give yourself plenty of time to get your tickets validated at the ticket office and get through security before getting on the train. We almost missed our train to Sevilla!! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the best place...”
Reviews.Author: kokiton
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the middle of Madrid at St. Ann Place, one of the best bars with tapas and terraces. The hotel has that unique fasion style that makes an old building new reformed with young and great service. All workers are always smiling and the only complain after more than 10 nights there, is the booking program (some times it just does not work). The breakfast is great (this is the tenth hotel for me in Madrid) and the room is very very nice (it has shampoo, lotion, body, mouth wash...). It also has at least 4-5 magazines at the room and all the papers ar available at the front desk. Ah! another stupid thing is the remote control, it makes you go through all the paid channels (?) and you need to be an engineer to go through...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but did not live up to the hype!”
Reviews.Author: HertfordshireUKGill
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks stunning outside and the location is great. Our room was small but nicely decorated, there is lots of storage space. I found the reception staff very poor and could not be bothered with us especially the lady that checked us out, she was more interested in what was going on with the next desk - she was very rude. On Saturday night we could not sleep as the music from the Penthouse bar was so loud and we were on the 1st floor! Breakfast was not worth getting up for, limited choice and service. Overall a very average stay - this hotel could be amazing but they need to work on their customer service and staff attitude and they say " Everything Is Possible" i don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about it!!!”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyerUAL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four days and must say it was an amazing hotel! I took the Metro from the airport, which I don’t really recommend if you have a lot of luggage. You have to connect at a couple of different stations and drag your bags up and down several flights of stairs. When I arrived at the final stop, Sol, it was a little overwhelming and I wasn’t sure which way to go. So I took a taxi from the station to the hotel. The Metro only costs 2€ and the taxi from the Sol station was 3€. When I finally arrived at the hotel, the porter was prompt at retrieving my bags. Check-in was easy and the front desk staff is extremely knowledgeable and accommodating. The room was a decent size, but I only had a view of the rest of the building. The bed was very comfortable and the turndown service very prompt. The ‘sexy lighting’ added a little special touch to the room. The hotel is in an excellent location within walking distance to Plaza Mayor, Museo del Prado, Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza, and Parque del Retiro. There are tons of restaurants and places to shop around the hotel. I did not eat at the hotel so I can’t comment on the food. Overall, the service was great and I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially if you’re a female travelling alone. I decided to take a taxi back to the airport when I left and that was 26€.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a break in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Rachel_9
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel in short: Good 1. Lovely room, well decorated and perfectly adequate size for a city break. 2. Exceptional front desk and concierge. They could not do enough for us and were charming. 3. Brilliant location for seeing the cultural sights 4. Overall a good looking hotel Could Improve: 1. The service in the bar was poor and the staff were not as attentive and charming as the front desk For a few days away, this would be a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not for the those seeking peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: broonbiker
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand some people's reviews on this website. One person says this hotel is poorly located (rundown area apparently), another says it is a great location. Which is right? Seeing as you can walk to all three of the best art galleries, I'd say the location was pretty good. It's not a rundown area at all. Some of the streets around are a bit tatty, but it's no slum district or red light area. This is central Madrid after all. I know far worse locales in London for example. What is without doubt is that if you are looking for a nice, peaceful hotel, this isn't for you. But then I don't think they deliberately disguise the fact. They provide earplugs on your bed after all! Again, the centre of Madrid is not the place for a peaceful break anyway. Madrilenos like to enjoy themselves late, especially at weekends. The hotel is central, clean, has pleasant staff who try hard in English and the rooms are modern standard. Plaza Sta Anna has a buzz about it and there are tons of restaurants nearby of all shapes and sizes. We only had breakfast at the hotel, which was fine, so cannot comment on the in house restaurant. The room service menu includes preparation of picnics if you just want to stroll in the parks and gardens. Vegetarian ones too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average - Recommend Staying Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: mike142
Reviews.Content: We consider the ME Madrid to be a poor choice for the city, and wish we had stayed elsewhere. The hotel is very average in a poor area, while there are much better options out there, for the same money. It is really a business style hotel, with busy front of house and not a welcoming vibe at all. Check in was abraisive and unhelpful. When you pay this much for a room you don't expect to carry all your own gear and have to ask where the lift is. The rooms are ok, we stayed in a superior with view of the square. It was large and clean, with good sized bathroom. The often mentioned hi tech stuff is actually a bit old hat now... a very large sound system and dvd setup that is impossible to navigate, and a bizarre lighting system that is at first very amusing (there is a purple/pink sexy setting) but gets old fast, and has a few bugs in it... waking up in the middle of the night as the lights came on was irritating. The restaurant was strange... poor service to get a table at lunch as we were told to wait 10 minutes as they were very busy... only to go through to a near empty room. Quality is good but comes at a hefty price for the city. Prices for room service and breakfast in particular are outrageous... 60 euros for two people for breakfast! Hotel does have a nice small gym with running and eliptical gear which was welcomed. Overall we were disappointed with the ME and also with the location - a mixture of run down and slightly bad vibe, and the square itself is very touristy. If we returned to Madrid we would definitely stay in the Salamanca area instead.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy looking hotel but basic service”
Reviews.Author: snowphalaenopsis
Reviews.Content: We had a very small room with no view. I guess we could have paid for an upgrade but we weren't planning to spend too much time in the room anyway. We stayed for 6 nights and the cleaning staff came at all hours! One morning they came knocking at 8:30 am in the morning! Way too early.... The next morning they came at 10am. Then another day the room was not cleaned when we returned at 3 pm. It might be due to occupancy rate and workload but still, I have not encountered this huge a variation in times before. Overall I think it was more hype than substance but it was average at least. Plus points: Good location, free wifi, the fancy rooftop (it was too cold to be outside in January so we didn't go),...

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel in heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: getmarshall
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the ME Reina Victoria. It is situated very well for the tourist sites in Madrid. We walked everywhere and didn't use the metro until the last day. There are quite a few bars, restaurants, etc right outside the hotel. Its a 3 min walk to Puerta Sol, 20 min walk to Royal Palace and maybe a 15 min walk to the Bank of Spain and City Hall area. Location could not be beat. As for the rooms, I booked a standard room and it was tiny. Two twin beds, no desk and it faced out to a courtyard, so not a lot of natural light. The bathroom was oversized, which was impressive. Great shower and plenty of space. The television was nice and we also noticed a CD player in the closet area. Was very impressed that they had a north american power outlet in addition to the european ones. Never seen that before and it was super handy to keep the laptop and iPhone charged. The free wifi was available throughout the hotel and in the room and was fast and worked without a problem. The room we booked did come with breakfast which was good. Many choices, american and european, good coffee. My only complaint would be the mini bar, it took up a lot of space and was drastically overpriced. Overall the ME Madrid was a fantastic hotel right in the middle of everything Madrid has to offer. It provided a base for a fantastic 4 days in Madrid, was sad to leave. Certainly would return to this hotel again if visiting Madrid in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like Heavan !”
Reviews.Author: FoogmanDiggler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my girlfriend over Valentine, absolutely great location right whack bang in the middle of Madrid, santa ana plaza with great tapas restaurants on doorstep. Stayed in a City View room, nice big windows to let that gorgeous spanish sunlight in! The mini bar is great, the bed is wonderful, comforatable and big with crisp cotton sheets, the mood lighting in the room is great too. The Bathroom is perfect, walk in massageshower with Grohe quality fittings. Staff very friendily and nice resturant downstairs. Only negative point, the TV is far too complex to operate, and no ipod dock, else perfect !!! Book it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: PHILIPMARSHALL
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for business and booked a room facing the square (175 euro excluding breakfast). Positives: 1. Check-in & out were efficient and friendly. 2. When calling reception from the room, pick-up was fast and responsive. They sent up a fax within minutes. 3. Room was spacious and clean (I noted some reviews stating tiny rooms....certainly the one I had was spacious, possibly due to upgrading to room with view of square?) 4. Shower was very good...powerful and plenty of hot water. Nice soaps, etc. 5. Hotel was clean and fresh smelling throughout. Carpets looked clean also. 6. Had a small gym, was empty when I used it (which is good considering it is pretty small & basic). 7. Very comfortable bed. 8. Free internet connection (that actually worked) Negatives: 1. Breakfast is expensive at 25 euro (I just took something outside for 8 euro). 2. Area around hotel isn't really that pleasant. The square is attractive but all surrounding streets look quite neglected (graffiti, etc). 3. No coffee/tea making facilities in the room. I never used the restaurant or upstairs bar, but overall was impressed with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location - beautiful hotel - little room”
Reviews.Author: Floberna
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, modern and clean. The location excellent, a very elegant square in the city center. All the staff is very kind and helpfull. Our room was very little but clean and bright. Just to let you know, at the check-in they charge on your credit card 100€ per room per night as a garantee that they refound you at the moment of the check-out.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: sandiUKLondon
Reviews.Content: This is almost hard to rate, because it depends on which room you get. This hotel could potentially get a 5 from me, except we had the smallest room i've ever been in. Was it a problem? No. I had more of an issue with the design of it. For instance, the king bed took up basically the whole space that was the bedroom. They had a desk against the wall with a chair, but there was no room to pull out the chair to sit at the desk due to the bed. So don't even have the desk. There was ample space to walk into the room from the doorway and use the bathroom, but once you turned right into the room the bed took up all the space. And it was a great bed. But, considering the size it was overpriced. Would I stay there again? In a heartbeat. The location ended up being my favorite in madrid, I think Plaza Santa Ana and the surrounding streets are the best part of the city. In walking distance to everything, we did half the city in one day and the other half the next. The hotel is very trendy, cool vibe when you walk in and right off the plaza. So many cute tabernas within a 5 minute walk. Again, I was fine being in a room as small as ours, but I think it was overpriced. But the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was great, and the location was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexandrospassalis
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, attractive hotel with smart, modern interior. The rooms are rather small but contemporary, with up-to-date facilities. The Central Cafe, one of the most popular Jazz bars in Europe, is located right across from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Things are simple here: Just the best hotel in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: anastasiakom
Reviews.Content: The best situated hotel in the most central point, for fun and for business and culture and shopping. For everything. All in less than 5 minutes. The building is amazing and with a captivating and special story. The stuff very helpful. The best terraza in whole Madrid with great views, where you can also have a drink (meeting point for many local people in Madrid) A great breakfast and the restaurant has a complete menu in very appealing prices. The food is perfect and the value for money combination too. However, many other good restaurants of the area are just in front of your feet. The rooms with the views to the Plaza de Santa Ana are just breathtaking, and the most amazing is that NO NOISE ENTERS THE DOUBLE CRYSTAL ROOMS! Do you want only one slight disadvantage in the rooms? The bathroom being next to the bed. But also it is so huge and marvellously lighted that all the complaints go away. Great hotel, great value for money! Just live this (or with this) hotel. I don't go to any other during my stays in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Worldreviews
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the ME Madrid was very pleasant and I would definitely recommend the hotel for its location and value. The front lobby staff was professional and attentive. All our requests were answered promptly and our comfort truly seemed to matter to the hotel staff. The hotel has been recently renovated and the compact room had a plethora of technologies from the heated bathroom to a fabulous modern shower stall with jets. The television and access to international channels was superior. The business center was always accessible and empty. My only negative was that even though the hotel supposedly has Madrid's best suites our room was tiny with only an interior window to an enclosed courtyard. The deluxe doubles are modern and luxurious with great beds, however the limited room space only large enough for the bed and the built in cabinets made it feel like one was in an Egyptian tomb comfortably appointed but a tomb none the less. My partner and I had sleeping issues because it was claustrophobic and the only place to sit in the room was the bed as the desk chair literally touch the bed when one sat in it. I must admit that an upgrade was available for a thirty percent increase in price and we chose to stay in the room we had booked online. Definitely the hotel service and location diffuse the negatives. This property was steps away from the city hub of Plaza Major and Puerta del Sol as well as the Mercado de San Miguel that is a gastronomical and visual delight where it seems much of Madrid eats and drinks in this area. Plaza Santa Ana is lovely and uncrowded with tapas bars, cervecerias and restaurants nearby. Also accessible to banks, convenience stores, pharmacies, and access to important tourist attractions. From this central location we were able to enjoy this fabulous city to it's fullest. All in all I give the hotel a thumbs up on location, value, and exceptional personal service. If you need breathing space do not book the deluxe double.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Ecosseresurgam
Reviews.Content: For our Xmas break in Madrid I booked this hotel due to the trendy and boutique style website which quotes : "An experience beyond accommodation. A showcase of forward thinking destined to raise eyebrows. To blur boundaries. To tempt, to tease and ultimately to transform" We booked the level room and on arrival were shown into what was in my opinion a single room !! The size was a joke and their trendy design consisted of some puprle lighting around the tv area which when switched on resembled an Ikea style brothel. ! Another trendy piece of furniture was the purple minibar which had it not taken up half the window blocking the light and also almost in the bed due to the small room might have been acceptable. Lucky our room was changed next morning as that is one item we would have put on the balcony to give us more space !! That said the staff were lovely down to the last one and when I told them that the only blurred boundaries were mine and the only transformation was of us into 2 walking zombies as we had not slept a wink all night due to overlooking the very noisy Plaza Sant Ana, they did kindly show us another couple of rooms and we moved. A huge loss of time when we only had a few days to spend there. The new room had very much the same decor but in a slightly less noisy location and much bigger.I say slightly less but that still did not ensure we had a good nights sleep as it was still noisy. When I also queried that we had booked a level room as we had expected that to be bigger, they said that the only difference to a superior and level room is that the level rooms have extras such as a free car wash---we had no car with us. Free local phone calls---no big deal and free newspaper which we never saw for the duration of our stay nor were we asked if we wanted this. Oh and a nespresso coffee machine which I admit was constantly refilled with capsules as we needed but not in my opinion what makes the difference between one room standard and another. The room service I must say was spot on and really polite and super quick so full marks there. Reception staff were polite and knowledgable so again full marks to them. However, I feel that their website is totally misleading and apart from the afore mentioned "sexy" lighting, the purple minibar and a few quirky expressions written on the mirrors etc it really did not tick any of my design boxes. The suites did look nice but the standard and superior rooms in my opinion leave a lot to be desired. The quiet rooms we were shown all overlooked a rather dowdy inner courtyard and so we declined them . Breakfast again was avaerage and not the amazing extensive buffet their website led us to expect. We did have breakfast there a few mornings but it was always an overheated and crowded atmosphere with no great design or appeal to start the day. It reminded me of being in a very bleak and dark overcrowded cafe rather than a showcase of forward thinking. Hotel Location is very central and easy walking distance to Plaza del Sol Plaza Mayor and Prado etc but boy is the location very noisy so beware. We were also somewhat taken aback at the goings on in and around Plaza Sant Ana which saw hoards of drunken youngsters with bottles of spirits etc all over the place. Not nice to be honest. So would I stay there again? No and that does make me sad because the staff really were to be given full credit. They just need to be honest and rethink what is trendy and boutique really means. Next time we will take a lot more care when choosing a hotel in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: LondonBeryl Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very centrally located, just a minutes walk from Sol in the centre of Madrid. The rooms were very clean and the on-suite spacious. My only critisism would be the overpricing of the bar and resturant facilities, however given the hotel is a stones throw from many much more resonably priced bars and resturants this would not put me off staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: julcull
Reviews.Content: Having been to Madrid many times before we chose to stay in our favourite area we love Plaza Santa Ana and the surrounding area by far the best of anywhere in Madrid. Our first hotel cancelled our booking for some reason last minute so we picked the Reina Victoria as we knew exactly where it was. This hotel is not cheap but I guess you pay for what you get. The room was extremely small but clean with good large bed and very quiet (only because of where room was situated I think ). The bathroom was lovely so were the complimentary bath products. Breakfast was really good couldn't fault it, the staff were lovely too. I would stay here again but depending on price. The only gripe I had on check out they thought we had a couple of items from mini bar which we didn't and hadn't even opened it, the amount was negligable and we weren't charged but I had to sign the bill to say we hadn't had anything, they didn't make a big deal but I felt a bit embarressed which I shouldn't have. Anyway no harm done.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck because of the strike - and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sameera3000
Reviews.Content: I was stuck here because of the December air controller strike (originally in a standard room and then given a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite). - The Junior Suites on the 6th floor are lovely - large flat screen tv built into the wall, sexy lighting, stunning views of the Plaza Santa Anna, beautiful bathroom with walk in shower and a separate standalone bath. 5 star through and through - The standard rooms are comfortable (some with limited/poor views) but a little small. - The bar and roof top bar are VERY trendy (people come from around to hang out there and they take themselves a little too seriously). - If you need a gym/Spa, go next door. It's not part of the hotel but its lovely. - 10 minute walk from El Corte Ingles if you need to go shopping.

Reviews.Title: “5th floor outside rooms great, so are staff”
Reviews.Author: CornwallListener
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay here while working in Madrid. We were working strange hours, including one night, so needed somewhere where nothing was a problem - this was it. Staff were really friendly and helpful. I can understand why others saw lounge as pretentious but nobody seemed bothered by us meeting there looking scruffy! Service in restaurant equally good, although the noise from the adjoining bar can get a bit much. Beds may have been the most comfortable I have ever had in a hotel. However, I was lucky in getting an upgrade to a 5th floor superior (outside) room - I am not surprised to hear that other rooms were noisy. Due to a delayed flight I had an extra night in interior 5th floor room and it was slightly small for the price and with more bar noise.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else in Madrid?”
Reviews.Author: TravelPlanningFool
Reviews.Content: Arriving in the evening when the outside neon lights were on, we were blown away by the commanding majesty of this very centrally located historic hotel. We were equally blown away when we learned we'd been upgraded to one of the best suites in the hotel! Unbelievable. We stayed up all night just to take it all in. Beginning in the lobby, to the bathrooms, elevators, etc. , this is definately has got to be one of the hippest decorated hotels on earth. Reception and room service staff were upbeat, approachable, helpful, efficient -- in a word, impeccable. We were blown away (again) to find that all we wanted to see, including famous flamenco dancing, was within walking distance. Also if you want to party, this apparently is one of the trendiest places in Madrid to do it. The sumptuous breakfast buffet also left us more satisfied. We would not stay any place in Madrid other than the ME Madrid -- even if we don't stay in an owner's suite!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location...”
Reviews.Author: AllyMac77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in October and really enjoyed the trip. There were some minor issues with the tv and room cards needing re-setting but overall very positive. It's got a lovely rooftop terrace bar with free access for hotel guests, though cocktails are a bit on the expensive side... The hotel is on Plaza de Sant Ana which is excellent for either a cup of coffee or a meal. Ten minutes walk from Plaza Mayor, Gran Via and museum triangle, 5 mins to Puerta del Sol, basically in an ideal location. Always felt safe walking back to hotel and in most areas of the city. Plaza Santa Cruz, right next to Plaza Mayor, had a couple of nice cafe's for lunch. If you're looking for nightlife there are plenty bars etc on Calle Cava Baja, again fairly close to Plaza Mayor. I'd happily recommend this hotel, you could get somewhere less expensive but if you want a wee treat then it's very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, trendy, great location”
Reviews.Author: eil83
Reviews.Content: i booked ME Madrid on Jetsetter.com for $136/night in August, which was a great deal for the quality of hotel. Staff was friendly and recommended great restaurants. Perfect location. It was a little noisy at night since there were so many outdoor restaurants right outside of our window.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CanadaVoyager
Reviews.Content: We (a married couple) stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in November. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted at the reception. Staff there (Javier, especially) was very friendly and helpful, engaged in a very pleasant small talk. We asked for a quiet room, request was accomplished and we were issued the keys without a delay. The room was very quiet indeed, windows facing the courtyard, very clean and SMALL (as expected - we have booked Deluxe room). Unusual and intriguing hitech lighting, sophisticated entertaining centre add a nice touch to the room. Bathroom - also very modern, sparklingly clean and of full size has floor to ceiling marble, rain shower, etc... Our rate include breakfast. The breakfast room is very well appointed, staff is very helpful and responsive. The quality of food and selection is very good. We would definitely recommend this hotel, although would book a larger room when traveling with a partner.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Location, Staff and Food!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SAVB1
Reviews.Content: My husband treated me to a short break to this wonderful hotel for my birthday. We had such a great time from the moment we got out of our taxi to the moment we left. The front of house staff as well as the bar and restaurant staff were all very helpful and polite, we really could not fault this hotel at all and Madrid what a fab city. My husband and I have travelled all over the world and have never experienced such lovely people, everyone was so kind and helpfull. We loved it so much that we are going back in February for our anniversary!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in the Center of it all”
Reviews.Author: NYC2Ohio
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the center of the action in Madrid. We had a suite and it was large and spacious. Only things is that it would be difficult for people who are not up to date with their tech. The TV remote and the lighting were all high tech, way surpassing the U.S. hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room, Subpar Service, Very Pretentious”
Reviews.Author: Tonystarks81
Reviews.Content: So me and my wife ended a 2 week European honeymoon by staying at the Me Madrid for 3 nights. We got in at about 12:30 and were told our Room was not ready, come back in an hour, because they were at capacity. No problem, check in isn't until 3pm anyway. We go to lunch. Come back at around 2:30. I ask the woman at the desk if our room is ready, she asks my name, then tells me no, should only be about 10-15 minutes. I reply no problem, then tell her I will be sitting about 10 feet away from her on the couch, when its ready to call me up. So me and my wife proceed to browse the web on our phones. 10 minutes goes by, 15 minutes, 30 minutes. Throughout the whole time, she is giving out rooms like candy on Halloween. I don't want to make a scene, the chick sees us, we're 10 feet away from her. After about 45 minutes my wife gets aggravated and storms up there asking whats the deal with our room. She asks the name again and finally gives us our room. The Room was on the FIRST floor facing the square. I knew it was going to be a dreadful nights sleep when I saw Earplugs neatly placed on both pillows. The plaza didn't clear out till 3am, and the club goers didnt stop hootin and hollerin till about 5am. So if you're looking to enjoy your sleep ask for a high floor, NOT facing the square. The Room was nice, don't get me wrong. Comfy bed, great shower, big tv with home theater, lots of English channels but the room was SMALL. Also, the place was crazy pretentious. The whole lobby scene felt like some my $h!t don't stink Miami/LA/NYC scene. I'm not a fan of the pretentious crowd, and lots of the folks who stayed here (front desk staff included) gave off a very pretentious/ostentatious vibe. The location was great though, lots of great tapas bars and pubs nearby and we really enjoyed the food in Madrid. We didn't let the hotel staff or vibe of the place ruin our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelernow
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Christmas in 2009 and would never return. I was changed from a tiny smoking room ( I specifically asked for non-smoking) to a slightly larger room in a VERY dark corner of the hotel. I was afraid and before going to sleep I placed a chair up against the door. I was facing Plaza Santa Ana which was loud and there were homeless people having a bonfire which made me feel even more nervous. The reception people were not the least bit sympathetic and the only good thing that came out of my stay here was that I met a lovely family from Pennsylvania in the dining room and they also were very upset about this hotel. The woman told me that she was pickpocketed while entering the hotel. I would never return here and I called my travel agent and asked to be moved to another hotel after my tour of Spain was over. They complied and I stayed at the Sol Melia Princesa which was lovely and I felt so much better. The only thing I can say in favor of this hotel was the restaurant had delicious food and the waiters were wonderful. I think they should be at the front desk instead of the rude, uncaring staff that are there now. The restaurant is also where I met the lovely family from Pennsylvania so I guess it wasn't a total waste.

Reviews.Title: “Great trendy hotel and good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: FOBNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, good location on the vibrant and busy Plaza Santa Ana, and great rooms, if a little small. Impressive interior space all round for those who like the 'modern' vibe. Fantastic breakfast. The much ballyhooed outdoor penthouse bar/club was showing signs of wear.

Reviews.Title: “Surely the best in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: GhirlGlasgow
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a superb location with the best service ever. Miriam the Aura Manager was wonderful and all other staff were extremely helpful and professional. Room was a superior overlooking Santa Ana square with floor to ceiling windows and a most modern and comfortable lliving/sleeping space. Great bars on ground floor and on rooftop. Couldn't fault this hotel in any way, apart from some noise during the night from the Square outside, but this was a minor problem. The service from all departments was truly exceptional and Miriam arranged everything in advance, from dinner reservations to football tickets, She even accompanied us to a ticket collection point to make sure we got our tickets without any difficulty. Excellent trip all round, mainly thanks to the brilliant service. Well done ME Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - TINY rooms!”
Reviews.Author: goofy4prez
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great location to everything! When we first arrived, the lights in our room didn't work and it took about 90 minutes for the technician to fix them (a fuse shorted out) and numerous calls to the front desk as he didn't speak English. The rooms are tiny - but the bathroom is quite large compared to the room size. The bed took up the entire room and there wasn't much place to walk. My husband caught the stomach flu and we needed to extend our stay. We were only able to do so for one night as they were fully booked the 2nd additional night. They didn't even offer to help us find a room in another hotel nearby. The hotel has the best bar with a view in the city and the music on Saturday night was very loud and we heard it in our room until after 3AM. If you are looking for a hotel in a great location and near the night life- this is the hotel for you. If you are looking for service and helpfulness, you might want to look elsewhere. They didn't have a concierge so you had to depend on the front desk staff and there was often long lines. There is free wi-fi in the lobby and you can grab it in some of the rooms but it is very slow. To pay for internet, I would have had to use the internet on the tv and this wouldn't have worked as I was downloading files from work. They said that some of the suites had actual connections to the internet from your computer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Neftist
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 wonderful days at the ME Madrid Reina Victoria. Not sure what rooms the folks who are complaining about the room size were staying in, but we found ours to be quite large for a European hotel room, and we were not staying a suite. The bathroom was quite large as well. We initially had a room on the third floor facing the plaza and yes, it was on a Saturday night. The noise outside was quite loud as has been said in previous reviews, but it was Saturday night in Madrid. We asked for a change of rooms, not because of the noise but because our initial room only had a shower and no bathtub. We were instantly transferred to a room on the fifth floor not facing the plaza with a tub. The staff could not have been nicer in making the switch for us. Unfortunately, where our room was located on the fifth floor was night next to where the housekeeping staff all met in the mornings to be given their daily assignments. The noise coming from these housekeepers made the folks in the plaza on Saturday night seem fairly quiet. They had no consideration at all for the fact that some people may have been on vacation and wanted to sleep past 8:00 in the morning which was impossible with the ultra thin walls of this hotel. The staff at the hotel could not have been nicer helping us with everything from calling restaurants for us to make dinner reservations to helping us purchase train tickets for day trips to giving us advice on things to see and things not to waste our time on. The Penthouse bar on the rooftop is not to be missed. At night, it gives a wonderful view of lit up Madrid, and admission is free with your hotel key. Non guests have to pay a 15 Euro cover charge. The best part of this hotel is its location. It was a five minute walk to Puerta Del Sol to catch the Metro, 10 minutes tops to the Mercado San Miguel, and 15 minutes to either the Prado or the La Linda district which is where we found the best places to get tapas.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY”
Reviews.Author: bjgeno
Reviews.Content: Our first room was a room facing the Plaza Ana, it was so noisy we requested a different room. The Plaza on a Friday or Saturday night makes NYC Times Square look quiet! Even the desk clerk commented on how poorly the rooms were soundproofed. We then took a downgrade to an inside room and it was by far the smallest room I have ever stayed in. The staff and service are excellent. This is a great hotel for location and if you are looking for a "in place" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but be prepared for noise on weekends.”
Reviews.Author: woodyck
Reviews.Content: My husband, 18 year old daughter, and I stayed here at the end of August. We had a corner urban suite on the first floor. Everything was excellent - location, service, cleanliness, bedding, buffet breakfast etc... The only problem we had was with noise from partying locals on Friday and Saturday night . The fact that they give you earplugs at turndown should have been our first clue. However since it was our first stop in Spain and we enjoy experiencing the local culture we used our earplugs and had no problem with it. I would defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Glam hotel, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: kbs_chicago
Reviews.Content: I loved the style of this hotel, a huge white beautiful building on the north side of a sprawling plaza with outdoor cafes and restaurants. Everything about the hotel oozed cool. The rooms were small, but chic. After this experience, I would love to see other ME hotels!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: gili33
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel is excelent, in walking distanc from most attractions. The crew is attentive and helfull. The room i received was small, the bathroom is large & well equiped, the bed is superb. the hotel has a beautiful garden/bar on the top floor with a nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Staff, Dollhouse Rooms”
Reviews.Author: alkram
Reviews.Content: This is certainly a hip, modern, well run hotel. The staff is very accomodating, helpful, and they even exchange currency at pretty good rates. Young crowd, hip, and in. The problem is the size of the rooms unless you spring for the top of the top. We didn't even have room for our bags, without tripping over them. Don't bother unpacking, becuase there is nowhere to unpack. By far the smallest rooms I have ever stayed out, even smaller than Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best room we ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Dreamstimer
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels we've stayed in. Travelling with small children, we booked the Urban Suite and got upgraded to the Grand Suite, one of their best suites. A huge terrace with dining table, sunbeds and jacuzzi were our own. I felt like Mick Jagger for 3 days, what a treat. See photos and check for yourself! The suite consists of a living room with a sofa and a bedroom. Two (huge) dressing closets and two bathrooms (yes, Mick Jagger always needs two). There is also a coffee machine that makes great coffee (a Krups). There are also two Marrantz amplifiers (though a little bit difficult to use). The suite's main bath has two walk-in showers and a bath tub. Two sinks, tons of cosmetics (4-5 only for him, 10 for her). There are two flat screens in the room, allowing us to view the World Cup Final in there (we stayed right during the Soccer World Cup 2010) as the children were (supposed) to sleep. Spain won, we hit the streets, what a night! The staff was very friendly, did their best to teach us the room's specifics (we tried to skip that, as there were too many electronics - even a wii console). Everything is clean and the view is terrific. The plaza outside is very handy, with a few nice places to eat. If you're there in summer, delay dinner after 8:30PM as earlier is way too hot. Because of this we had to return to our room at noon, way too hot for visiting the city with two small kids. Review above is for a suite, but many things apply to a regular room. I suggest to try anything at the Level (as they call them) if you can afford it. However, you may wish to avoid the inner court rooms. They don't really have a view and it's less privacy for them. Talking about that. the hotel seems to be targeted more to couples or people without children. The pink room light, the bar downstairs and overall ambiance are suggesting that. Our kids were welcome and the staff always had a smile for them. If I am to really pushed to find a downside, some of the furniture and outside terrace wood start to wear, being several years old. It's rather a suggestion to management to keep it in mind, than a negative feedback. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kingofbranton
Reviews.Content: Excellent Great food Great rooms if a little small Get a room over looking the square Well Done Melia ME!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gilesaspen
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny, but the service was outstanding. The location is fantastic, within walking distance to everything. All the staff were helpful, courteous and friendly. Even with all the late partying outside, we could not hear any noise in the room at all and slept pretty sound every night. We'll stay there again and recommend it to friends! Fantastic customer service will always bring me back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - one of the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: jillhm
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect. Plaza Santa Ana was a great place to stay - restaurants, bars etc. Our room looked over the plaza and was surprisingly quiet. The hotel was beautiful, the staff friendly and accomodating. This was one of the best hotels I've stayed in. We stayed three nights then left for Toledo for a night and came back. The hotel held our bags for us while we were gone and even attempted to give us our same room. We booked the room on hotel.com and then found a lower rate which they honored after our reservation had been made. The hotel staff all spoke english and truly couldn't have been nicer. I would highly recommend the ME Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: NYJanet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, picky NYers in our early 30s, loved our stay at the ME Madrid. After an overnight flight from NYC we arrived, exhausted, at 11 AM and were able to quickly check in to our room (check in is usually at 3 pm). The staff was fantastic, extremely welcoming, helpful and they all spoke fluent English and helped us with our Spanish. They gave us maps, pointed us in the right direction and gave great restaurant recommendations. Our room was clean, trendy and comfortable. There's free wi-fi so we were able to Skype with family and friends and brag about our fantastic trip. The hotel is in a great location, right on a plaza with restaurants and cafes, and it's walking distance to Plaza Mayor, Sol, Palacio Real and more. There's a nice bar on the roof and the bartender makes a mean mojito. The dry cleaning service at the hotel is top notch. On our last night, I spilled red wine all over my brand new white jeans. When we returned to our hotel around 1 AM, I called concierge and they were at our door within minutes. My jeans were ready within hours and they were returned in perfect condition. As I said before, we really enjoyed everything about the ME Madrid. It's a great hotel that I would certainly recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with Wow Factor!”
Reviews.Author: Ash-Shin
Reviews.Content: We visited the Me Madrid to celebrate our first anniversary and absolutely loved it. The journey from the airport took about 30mins and cost 25euros. The location is very central and after a few problems checking in, we arrived at a beautiful room overlooking Plaza de Santa Ana. The room had all the mod-cons and plenty of amenities plus a balcony with stunning views over Madrid. The weather was perfect at this time and we made the most of all the wonderful Tapas bars in the square below., 'Turf' being our favourite with old time classics and a few modern dishes. For classic Spanish paella we went to El Caldero on a street just off the square. The hotel has two excellent bars. The Midnight rose is quieter, classier and with excellent food, cocktails and chill out music. The roof top penthouse bar has great views and is a lot busier with long queues to get in, hotel guests get VIP access to the bar. Overall a great weekend, the hotel is not cheap but the location, rooms and bars make up for this. Watching Spain win the world cup with 250,000 people on Paseo de Recoletos was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Matthanach
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ME last Easter weekend with my fiance absolutely LOVED this hotel. The location is perfect for a long weekend away and the view we had from our room across the square and rest of Madrid was awesome. I'm not sure how long it had been open when we stayed but the room looked brand new, the decor super trendy and the bathroom incredible. It was really cold when we went so probably didn't get the most out of the rooftop bar but I imagine in the Summer it would be amazing. As for eating I highly recommend the tapas restuarant on the immediate right as you come out of the hotel but get there early as it gets super busy. Alternatively there are a ridiculous amount of restaurants available all within a short walk of the hotel or on the square.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay”
Reviews.Author: steph00a
Reviews.Content: The ME Madrid definitely exceed our expectations. Typically European hotels leave much to be desired. However, this property was not only centrally located, but the rooms were clean, spacious, and quiet. The property's restaurant is exceptional. The breakfast buffet offered many choices, even for the pickiest eaters. The bar on the ground floor was lovely. Excellent service and menu. Overall, we had an amazing experience. Knowing we had a lovely room to return to after a busy and tiring day, made our trip that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: ParadiseChick
Reviews.Content: Great location for a few days to immerce yourself in Spanish culture - plazas, resturants and bars all around. Doesn't look much like a hotel from the outside, but inside is well decorated, great rooftop bar and another bar and restaurant. Conference facitlies leave much to be desired, particularly the terrible 10 sandwiches provided for over 200 people. Rooms are very very small but excellently decorated, very cosy and comfortable. Bathroom is a real treat - excellent branded toiletries, lots of mirrors, stylish double shower with jets. Not centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch location, comfort and style”
Reviews.Author: drmeb
Reviews.Content: I am afraid that if I reveal how truly wonderful this hotel is, it may be tough to get a room there on my next visit. However, I'll try to be bigger than that and share this with you. This large, stately hotel is in the best possible location in Madrid - right on Plaza Santa Ana, a classier and quieter version of the lively Sol and Plaza Mayor areas, which are just a 5 to 8 minutes walk away along winding old streets packed with shops and cafes. A five minute walk from the hotel in the opposite direction takes you to the Prado and other museums. The beautiful plaza at the hotel's doorstep has every type of cafe suitable for plain or fancy breakfast, lunch or dinner. Rooms are modern and very clean, beds and bedding are super comfy (they have a pillow menu), wifi is free in the room or you may freely use a computer in the business center, staff are excellent and attentive and knowledgeable, windows are soundproof so rooms are quiet (we did not overlook the plaza so i can't speak for all rooms), and soaps and shampoos are good quality and plentiful. We plan to stay there on all future trips to Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: cattivaxox
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at this amazing hotel. Service was amazing, the attention to all the details. from the reception I got when I checked in, to the check out... everything was perfect. I felt ill one day and the waitress at the restaurant even brought my left over lunch and some tea in my room while she was preparing the check. THAT'S service! :) The room is so well decorated. Loved the atmosphere! very modern. Don't expect it to be huge, but after all we are in Europe. But I find that it was of a decent size and very well decorated and comfortable. Loved the bed, the shower and yes the lights... :) The Penthouse club on the roof top... wow it was great. bartenders were really nice and the view! great time at the ME Reina Victoria ... and so well located. Walking distance to all the main attractions. One word to describe my stay... Amazing! I would recommend to all my friends. One note: If you are a ligth sleeper and wants to go to bed at 10pm, this might not be for you. You will find the room comfortable and lovely, but if there are some activities going on in the Plaza... and you want to call it a night very early, you should know that its a busy enough place that you might have trouble with the noise. I was facing the Plaza, there was a band playing on the Saturday nigh.. I loved it! But some might be disapointed. So I wanted to give a fair review to the people that are reading this. Although for me it was not an issue... I actually liked it! (At 10pm its still light outside in Madrid ), it might be a concern for a different type of travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: tennisgirl10
Reviews.Content: I had a group of 14 here for the Madrid Tennis Open and I have to thank one of the staff in particular, Miriam de la Horra, for her great attention to detail in helping me organize tours, receptions, etc. Not only was she extremely helpful, but I would like to highly commend the two concierges, Chela Morales and Leslee Tabarina. Regarding the rooms, they are somewhat on the small size albeit normal for a European hotel room, but I have to admit that the showers are some of the prettiest that I have seen in a European hotel. Actually, an enclosed shower! I have to admit that I thought that maybe the hotel was going to be too "hip" for my group, but the staff made all of us feel extremely comfortable. Also, there were other Europeans travelling of the same age group.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Fleeting-visits
Reviews.Content: A very "boutique" hotel. The minibar is almost the size of the room. I had a great room (the level, 5th floor) overlooking Santa Ana Plaza. Not huge, especially as the minibar took up so much space, but comfortable enough as I was the only occupant!!! Great for people watching in the plaza below. Very central and within easy walking distance of all main attractions. Staff were friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chicagoTRVLR
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the ME and could not have been more pleased. The reception desk personnel are very friendly. As stated in other reviews, this hotel is in a wonderful location right on the Plaza Santa Ana. There are food and drink options everywhere. A couple minute walk puts you on the Metro and you can go anywhere in Madrid. The room is small but normal but European standards. Loved the international plugs and the awesome shower. Access to the rooftop bar was a plus and we loved checking out the views. Would return to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone traveling in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and fun”
Reviews.Author: lighthouse25
Reviews.Content: Booked a Supreme room for 3 nights Requested a room facing Plaza Santa Ana and got the 2nd floor with floor to ceiling windows that opened up so we could enjoy the plaza. It got a little noisy at night, but the double-paned glass kept our room quiet and comfortable. Room was of a good size with plenty of furniture and closet/drawer space. Very simple and modern decor with vivid colors (purple and orange, with optional "sexy" pink/purple lighting). Bed was super comfortable. Bathroom was great -- loved the rain shower and wall jets. Great location -- Plaza Santa Ana was always buzzing and there were some great restaurants. Easily within walking distance of the major sights. Supposed to have one of the hottest lounges in the city on the rooftop -- listed as one of "the" places to go and is known for long lines to get in. Benefit of staying at the hotel meant access (per the website), but they failed to mention that it is only open a few nights each week. It happened to be closed the whole time we were there, so we were disappointed. Price was a bit steep, but we got a discount for pre-paying online. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel, Right in the Heart of Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Carlos
Reviews.Content: The ME Hotel was a very trendy hotel in a great location right in the heart of Madrid. However although the hotel had tried to maximise the space in the room I couldn’t help feeling that it was a little on the small side considering the quality of the hotel. Having said that the décor of the room was very modern and the bed was really comfortable, most of all though the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate”
Reviews.Author: VTNRBLD
Reviews.Content: The location is terrific. Unfortunately, upon arrival there was confusion on room availability. The staff tried to be accommodating, but honestly I had just e-mailed the day before our arrival and when coming from a transatlantic flight with little sleep the last that a family wants to deal with is chaos, especially when the rooms had been prepaid. We finally got into the room at 7pm. To add to this everything and I mean everything is extra! So the price of the room is merely the starting point for the amount of money you will end up parting with..... breakfast package that can run $25 per person, per day ! Outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located trendy hotel w/ great staff!”
Reviews.Author: EShields
Reviews.Content: ME Madrid is located on Santa Anna plaza, which is a wonderfully convenient location for a first time visitor to Madrid. The plaza is outlined by delicious cafes and cervecerias that makes it easy to grab a bite to eat when you first arrive. The plaza is bustling when the weather is nice with lots of outdoor eating. The hotel lobby was modern and comfortable. The hotel room was tiny, typical for Europe. Fun accents were mood lighting (a light button that was labelled, "I'm sexy" and when pressed turned out purple mood lights above the bed) and a cute quote on the mirror. Aveda bath products and a wonderful shower. International charger built into the wall and free wi-fi throughout the hotel were convenient perks. A highlight of this hotel was the staff. I've never encountered such helpful and patient staff before. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: shaarawim
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights on pleasure. a very nice clean modern place and the staff all over are really a bliss. arrived late evening after a disappointing experience with another melia hotel. but this hotel was a pleasant make up. reception staff would go all the way for you. room was small but good enough for a solo and kept always clean. didn't really try food there as i was out all the day but wouldn't expect any less from what i have experienced would surely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and super hip”
Reviews.Author: BenKap
Reviews.Content: ME is a great hotel in the heart of Old Madrid. It is right on Plaza Santa Ana and is very stylish, hip, and has great amenities. While the overall rooms are small they are loaded with features. The bed was probably the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in at a hotel and there was a big flat screen, sound system, great mini-bar, and a great bathroom. There was also cool lighting options for the room which are an added bonus. The rooftop deck is also a plus where you can look out over the city at night. All guests get to go up whenever they want which is important b/c the rest of Madrid wants to come up to. They have to wait in line. I'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KEGALL
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a central location on the Plaza Santa Ana. It has everything you expect of a central hotel of the Melia chain. We were lucky enough to be given an upgrade to a room overlooking the square. The room was spacious, actually with a double bed! ( A lot of these "nice" hotels push 2 single beds together ), great power shower with jets for the body, Aveda toiletries, "Maxi" bar - very expensive though, desk, large tv.
