In the hotel itself i would recomend a vist to the Penthouse rooftop bar for a cocktail. We timed our vist with sunset so the views of the square were fantastic. Breakfast is buffet style inc Cava, & the usual options. Staff we met were all very helpful & friendly, especially Miriam who showed us our room. One thing which did impress me was the fact that they made me a little dessert as it was my birthday. It is in the little gestures like this which for me make a great hotel experience. I would definitely stay here again!! There are plenty of tapas bars around which are ok. Lateral on the square is good but the best meal we had was in " La Vaca Argentina" a 10 minute walk away. Excellent steak with excellent service. To reach it, head out of the hotel & walk straight down the street on the bottom right hand corner of Plaza Santa Ana & it's on your right, around the corner from the Westin Palace.

Reviews.Title: “The urban design choice in Madrid - Grat location”
Reviews.Author: PMSweden
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four days weekend stay in Madrid with two of my friends and we really enjoyed both the city of Madrid and the Hotel ME. The atmosphere of the hotel is urban and chic five star, it is looks great and the location is, in my opinion, the best. We stayed in one Urban Suite with a connecting Supreme room wich gave us two bedrooms, two bathrooms and a really nice corner living room with floor to cealing windows in all rooms and also facing Plaza de Santa Ana. Regardless your budget my recommendation is to go for "The Level" and ask for a room facing Plaza de Santa Ana. It gives you that little extra and it is worth it. Turndown service and roomservice is really good and so is the staff, especially concierge Miriam and Franzine at the experience team. Thanks for all your help :) The Midnight Rose restaurant and bar is a great place to have drinks in at any time at the day or night. Also the food is really good. Looking forward to my next stay in the Hotel ME Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: jviel
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on other Tripadviser reviews, and its location. We were not disappointed! The hotel location is good and the staff is very helpful. The rooms seem recently re-done and the fixtures and features are all modern and well done. The beds are also very comfortable. Note - join the club!! It cuts the cost of what seems like an expensive breakfast in half. It was a daily brunch complete with cava. We read stories about the loud nightclub, but never heard it. The rooms do have earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were a blessing”
Reviews.Author: BAMAAlabama
Reviews.Content: When we arrived without a reservation since our flight was delayed and had to cancel the other hotel previously booked and without luggage the staff at the counter treated us very kindly. The girls at the counter spent 2 days calling Delta regarding our lost luggage since we could get no help calling on our own. We were glad we chose this hotel taking a cab directly to this hotel as a friend had stayed here sometime ago. I think the best thing about the hotel was the staff. They were helpful with translation, cab reguest, booking tours, etc. The room was clean and quiet. The staff could answer all our questions. One of the girls from the counter called us late one night to tell us our luggage would be here for sure the next day which saved us a lot of trouble and a second trip to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Very Accomodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: eor7
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there had been a mix up between the hotel and Expedia regarding the room types I booked. We were 6 guys in Madrid to watch the football. There was only 1 twin room and 2 doubles, being football fans from Glasgow we didn't fancy sharing beds! After explaining that they didn't have the rooms we wanted for the first night they offered us all free breakfast for the whole stay, they even wiped our mini-bar bill! I couldn't speak highly enough about the staff they really did go the extra mile to make sure we were happy with everything. The hotel is perfectly situated right in the heart of Madrid surrounded by great bars and restaurants. The rooms are very modern with great showers and bathroom. The only negative is the rooms may be a little small. Overall I would definitely return to this hotel. Thanks David

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hotelscout
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a very central location. We stayed in a deluxe room overlooking the square and everything was just as promised - nice big comfortable bed, good shower room (no bath, but that didn't really matter), great AV setup and a balcony. Good sized room for a city hotel, and we didn't hear too much noise from the square...but it was cold and wet so maybe it's different in the summer. The roof top bar is great once you're outside, but the indoor bar area is a bit of a place to be looked at rather than looked after. Spectacular views across the city. The staff were very helpful and we were greeted personally after having had a few exchanges of emails (what to do, where to go etc.) before arriving. There are a few comments about the price of the drinks on here, but I reckon they're around the same price as an equivalent 4 star hotel in the UK - why do people expect mainland Europe to be cheap? However, there are plenty of places within a short walk to go for good value tapas and drink, and we didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the food. Try the Adventurous Appetites (ww.adventurousappetites.com) tapas walk if you're looking for some help on how to do this tapas thing properly - we're quite travelled but this was probably the best single thing we did to make the most of our weekend. I'd definitely stay here again. The one thing I'd look out for in Madrid is the smoking in bars and restaurants. It still happens in most places and they get round the rules by declaring some fictitious area to be under a certain size.......got bored with the exact details but have a look before you go in anywhere if it really bothers you.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jameslb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend. It's a great base for walking around the city, and comfortable to return to each night. Modern, stylish rooms, with funky mood lighting and boutique touches. Safe was missing when we checked into our room which seemed to confuse the staff as to why, so we had to change room in order to have one. Bit of a hassle, but the staff were helpful. Good aircon throughout the hotel - important in July obviously. The rooftop bar is very popular with non-residents queuing up outside to get in, but as a resident you can just get the lift up there. A sunset it's not too busy and amazing views (perfect for a pre-dinner drink or two), then becomes more of a nightclub after 9-ish (so not so ideal for a quiet nightcap - but there is a more intimate downstairs bar for that).

Reviews.Title: “Use the room forget expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: fmcintyre
Reviews.Content: My husband visited this hotel last year and loved the atmosphere of the Rooftop Bar so much he booked for 4 days over Valentines to take me as a grand romantic gesture. Unfortunately, he visited in the warm days, we were there for the cold ones, as a consequence it was empty and had no atmosphere at all, a complete waste of my new KG 'trailer trash' shoes bought for the occasion. However, we did have a fab room, right in the centre overlooking the square and I suspect in the warm days the noise may have been a problem. As it was, you still could tell the difference between quiet week day noise and weekend 'don't give a damn who I disturb revellers' but it did not detract too much as the ME provide sumptuous bedding and pillows. Did not eat in the hotel or use the mini bar as the prices just could not be justified, walk out into the square and you pay half. Thought the Valentines Day gesture of two EMPTY champagne glasses was a bit tight (you were then supposed to use the Champagne from their minibar to fill) and of course pay the ridiculous charge). However, the staff on the front desk were pleasant and friendly and the location is so good. Only a 15 mins walk to most of the Art Galleries and surrounded by an excellent range of restaurants and bars. Hip and vibey kind of hotel for couples.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Lyndy123London
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nicely located with several bars, restaurants and places of interest to see. Our standard room was a little on the small side, with not much room to move around the bed but was fine for an over nighter. The staff were very helpful and my husband and I found their restaurant recommendations were spot on. We only stayed for one night, but found the Hotel location was ideal for us to eat, relax and see the sights of Madrid all within walking distance. Breakfast was included in our stay and was most enjoyable. Staying at this Hotel enabled us to have a most relaxing, comfortable experiece of Madrid. And we would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and memorable”
Reviews.Author: EFACS
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights and cannot wait to return. What an experience this hotel was, and I stayed in over a hundred hotels around the world. This one is one of my all time favourites. The location cannot be beat, right in a pedestian center filled with outdoor cafes and great food and people. The room I had was an upgrade because I only waited 20 minutes to check in which they thought was unreasonable, they could not find my reservation for the longest time but I was good with the wait and surprised by the gester. The room overlooked the center and was bright and spacious with state of the art technology. They even have dual electrical outlets to charge your 110 or 220 volt items. The mini bar is a maxi bar as they like to say and yes it holds a small bar and grocery store. I was truely impressed with the attentive service, bring me to my room, showing me how everything works, very Asian like quality service. I was pick pocketed there and remember being so careful not to be in physical contact with people but one guy bumped me for just a second and gone was my wallet with credit cards and such. I flagged down a police car and reported it right away and they offered to take me back to my hotel where I was immediately greeted by front reception staff attesting to the fact that I am known as a guest there, and I was so impressed with the care and attention they gave me when I was quite anxious about losing my wallet and 130 euro. They brought me water , they comforted me, they stayed with me throughout and I will always remember how they removed from my mind, such a terrible experience, in just minutes. I loved the breakfast buffet with champayne and orange juice, assorted cheeses and fruits and all the other items you would expect on a buffet breakfast in a hotel of this class. The hotel is not well marked and it was difficult to find because it looks like a condomunium from outside, but you will best identify it by the large floor to ceiling windows and white framed facade on the outside. They have a business centre available to all guests and the price was right too. loved this place, hope you do too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - couldn't fault it!!”
Reviews.Author: cabernetsue
Reviews.Content: I just had to write a review of the ME, following our stay earlier this month. We simply couldn't fault anything about the hotel, and the service and staff could not have been more helpful. I'd like to particularly mention Miriam de la Horra, the 'Aura Experience Manager', who made every effort to ensure we were happy during our stay - even down to one day leaving some fresh strawberries dipped in white chocolate in our room! Admittedly, the 'deluxe' rooms are small - as others mention - but we upgraded to the next level, and had a fantastic room overlooking Plaza Santa Ana, with an amazing view. The bar on the ground floor is lovely. It's quite large and spacious, and you can just chill out and relax anytime. Also, there is a nice sitting area in the lobby area, and books are available (even in English!) The Penthouse bar was not open, but we did take a sneaky peak, and it's lovely up there; am sure it will be fabulous in the Spring/Summer. As for location, you cannot be better located in Madrid. This was our second time there, and the ME is definitely the place I would choose to return to. As mentioned previously, the staff were exceptional. Nothing was too much trouble. We really felt welcomed and comfortable. Would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: hawkeye38
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, fantastic location, fantastic service and the staff are fantastic. This is the hotel to stay in in Madrid. I was there for 3 nights and every morning i woke up happy. Free internet is a big big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mcginn88
Reviews.Content: The Me is a modern hotel with trendy people and in a great location. The breakfast was excellent, and the restaurant downstairs was also very good. The gym was a bit lacking, but they had a gym. Our room was tough to find, but other than that, its a great hotel. They charge for TV, however.

Reviews.Title: “Great food, friendly staff, decent rooms but bar service not 100%”
Reviews.Author: josefa68
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights over Christmas 2009, in an Urban Suite. This was a corner suite on the 4th floor overlooking the Plaza Santa Ana and had a huge living room with plasma, wii, nespresso etc, along with the bedroom (with another plasma) and small bathroom. The bathroom was *ok*, with the standard small Aveda amenities (which weren't always replenished) and whilst it had a bath (small), and a nice power shower, it was the kind you have to step into, ie not a walk-in shower. This isn't a big deal, but there's always the risk of slipping when you have to step up and out of the bath. Shame that with all the space that the bathroom couldn't have been configured to accommodate a bath AND a separate walk-in shower. Also one has to fill the bath via the shower head....bizarre. We checked in painlessly and several minutes after arriving in our room our special "Level" manager came to the room to show us how all the technology worked. (She was super nice but had no knowledge of Madrid!) It's a good idea in theory to have all this kit in the room, but without proper instructions it's easy to see how guests can reconfigure the settings...an engineer was called to fix the speakers in our room, which was done within a matter of minutes - very impressive. When we came back from our walk, a complimentary bottle of cava and strawberries was in our room. Each day we were left a small dish (small, mind) of chocolate covered popcorn, which was a nice surprise. Another comment about the suites - again, all very well to have huge speakers and subwoofers in the room, but the noise from next door during the day was bad! We politely asked reception to deal with it, and they did, fast - but we were a bit surprised the rooms weren't better soundproofed. However, there were clearly some glitches over the Christmas period with staff. I completely understand that staff numbers may be reduced at this time, but if that's the case, I think that the rates should be lowered accordingly - we were paying over €430 per night...which to be honest, and having stayed at many other hotels at a similar level, was a bit steep for what we got. Christmas Eve meal was nice, but we spotted our waiter doing his real job as a barman the next day...we had to ask for courses to be served, plates to be cleared etc - and at €100 per head, again, not what you'd expect. In the bar, the service, apart from one excellent lady bartender, was bad. Nobody was interested in serving during the day, and several of the wines by the glass were unavailable. Two ports were on the menu, neither of which were available, neither was one of the dessert wines..so for a hip hotel that promotes its bar, I thought this was poor. On our last evening we ate at the hotel again and the food and service were excellent - so clearly a Christmas staff issue on C. Eve - but trying to get seated in the restaurant, having made a reservation, and being a guest at the hotel, was laughable. Good job we had a sense of humour really! (Lots of computer checking and headset talking. ) BUT - it's in a great location, and the concierge (guy) was really really helpful. (We went to an incredible flamenco show at Cardamomo on his recommendation.) Everyone was friendly, the breakfast was great (but at €27 it should be, although this seems to be the going rate these days - consisting of the usual meats, cheese, all kinds of bread, bagels, danish etc, and delicious scrambled and/or fried eggs etc. Good quality food it has to be said. Somehow though I felt that we'd paid five star prices for four star quality - I guess you're paying for location and the buzz that the hotel has generated. I should think in summer it does buzz and that the rooftop bar is amazing. All in all we felt a little bit let down having looked forward to our holiday/Christmas for some time - there was little soul or atmosphere. I'd recommend the ME, but would strongly advise you to negotiate your rate...and get breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Always go at least for 'supreme' room (not deluxe)”
Reviews.Author: goofy75
Reviews.Content: We spent fantastic five days in Madrid at Christmas 2009 and we just loved the hotel. Having said that, on our arrival we got a 'deluxe' room, which actually means the lowest in category. The room was nice BUT extremely small (probably the smallest I'd ever seen). Therefore we paid an upgrade the following day and didn't regret it. We got a room on the fourth floor with a view of the square. The view was magnificent (especially because of the French windows). Our recommendation is to get an upgrade. It really makes a big difference. The staff were really helpful, always attentive (receptionists, door men, waiters). Speaking of waiters and breakfast, you could actually get a glass of bubbly for breakfast, which was nice. A carafe of freshly squeezed orange juice was always delivered right to our table, which does not happen often. We didn't have a Nespresso machine in our room (it is not available in 'supreme' rooms but in 'level' rooms and suites), but there is a Nespresso machine in the breakfast restaurant. All in all, I must say that the hotel looks fantastic from the outside as well as from the inside, rooms (from supreme up) are fantastic, staff are very professional and we can simply recommend the hotel. The only flaw might be the price as it may get high.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lean_10
Reviews.Content: it's located right accoss Santa Ana square. 5 minute walking from SOL. Hotel is very nice and trendy, rooms a too small but very well decorated. Staff is friendly and always willing to help. If you are looking for a fun place to stay this is definately the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Concierge/Front Desk - Great Location w/in Plaza”
Reviews.Author: FIUPANTHER
Reviews.Content: Stayed here about a year ago. Great concierge staff who helped me prior, during, and post my visit. They were caring and were extremely helpful with city info and reservations for our Christmas Eve Dinner. They were always able to get us the reservations we needed especially for those hard to get into places. Rooms are great, very clean, and modern. The decor inside the hotel is modern but yet warm (not a "cold modern"). Many people confuse modern decor with a "cold decor." Location was the main reason I had chosen this hotel. Located right w/in a plaza..You have access to a bunch of bars and tapas, restaurants right next to you. Mornings we ate at La Suiza for breakfast. A few blocks away you have PUERTA DEL SOL & PLAZA MAYOR (these places are the center of town) Great interior and exterior architecture - great for pictures! Rooftop lounge is also great for a panaramic pic or just sipping on a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, lovely staff, modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: T_Belgique
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! I moved from the Urban Hotel to this one. The hotel is a trendy place with friendly staff. They have cool music playing throughout the hotel and there is also a lovely scent. The rooms aren't very large but they have all the modern facilities (dvd-player with home-cinema system, domotica lighting, free internet,...) The bathroom does not have a bath but has an amazing relaxing shower with Aveda amenities. This hotel also has one of the best room-service I'd ever experienced!! Take a room with views towards the Santa Anna place, it is definitely worth to upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Funky Mod-Tech”
Reviews.Author: RajinderSingh
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location on the Plaza Sta Ana square, which is popular with locals. A very funky, high tech, modern hotel in a very traditional building facade. A combination of compact and larger spacious rooms in the deluxe price range, therefore ask at reception if there is a larger room available. Enrol to MAS rewards to receive additional benefits such as free late check out. All rooms are very cutting edge and modern with mood lighting incorporating a “sexy” setting. Front desk staff are young, sophisticated, very friendly and accommodating. Were very efficient in arranging a last minute bullfighting show for a group of 10. After all, this hotel is a long time preference for bullfighter’s parties. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Modern, Funky, Young, Trendy”
Reviews.Author: mjpm24
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly lives up to it's 4.5 star rating. It is clear, however, that room sizes vary significantly. I stayed in a standard deluxe room for 3 nights, and judging by the photos I have seen, this was significantly larger than some of the 'tiny' rooms that exist. Location is perfect - all sights and attractions are within walking distance. There was plenty of walking space in the room and the bed was very comfortable. Cleanliness was good throughout and the AV facilities are also very good. The shower was spacious and very powerful. This is most certainly a young people's hotel. I would say that it is targeted towards the 20-40 age group. Everything is trendy, cool and modern. The entire concept of this hotel from design through to lobby music is intensely focussed on being 'cool'. If you want traditional, do not stay here. Service for me was excellent. Check-in was instant and pain free. On my final night (possibly because I was staying with my partner), my room was candle-lit upon my return with several heart-shaped chocolates left at the bed-side thanking me for choosing ME Madrid. I requested a wake-up call using the menu on the AV system. This worked perfectly, however, reception also called to ensure I was awake and asked if I would like a taxi to the airport. This was a nice touch. Check-out was polite and quick and the taxi was ready as promised. An excellent stay, excellent service and overall very comfortable. I would say the trick to a good stay here is to ask for a larger deluxe room at the time of booking. Try and stay on lower floors away from the noise of the roof bar/club. Also, ask for a room facing the side street of the hotel so you don't get the street noise from the Plaza (though you will miss the nice views of the Plaza). A thoroughly excellent stay and will stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: MarieSylvia
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is close to everything- metro, museums, good restaraunts. The Plaza Sta Ana is lively . As you enter the doors of ME Madrid, you will be amazed by the modern decor and cleanliness of the place. Then you will be surprised how friendly and accommodating the staff at the front desk. They are very helpful in every way. They are very considerate too. We arrived in Madrid at midnight and parked the van for 6 hours but they never charged us for the parking. My room was located in the back overlooking the court but it was Ok. It was so quiet. The bed and linens are so comfortable. The room is a little small but it did not bother me. The bathroom is soooo beautiful . There is no tub only shower but the shower has multiple jets. If ever I will go back to Madrid, I will stay in ME Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Comfortable, Spacious for European Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Patalidis
Reviews.Content: 3rd time to Europe, Me Madrid rooms High tech, large bathroom, spacious rooms, beds down comforter , ear plugs on nights... We stayed 4nights Fri.-Tues. Supreme Room 4th floor view of Plaza Santa Ana never had a noise problem. " I'm tried of hearing winey America's saying rooms to small". Over 10 years stayed in many different Hotels in Europe, the Me Madrid Hotel more then we expected. Plenty of closet space w/safe, stereo, mini bar,desk and adapter panel built into the wall for laptops, cell phones etc. The shower is large w/pressure, rob/slippers, and beds soft... We enjoyed a bottle of Champagne on the Roof Top Terrace great view ... By our 3rd night we had drinks in the Rose Longue and dinner in the Hotel it was so good we did the same thing after walking crowded Madrid on our last night. The breakfast spread lots of choices. The staff good English and helpful. The location is great many Tapas Bars and shops close good walking distant to sights. Life's to short relax and enjoy.... Husband and wife age 38-40...

Reviews.Title: “You'd struggle to find a better location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Mordonian
Reviews.Content: Situated in Plaza Santa Ana this hotel is right in the heart of Madrid, 5 minutes walk from a number of metro stations and a stone throw from numerous eateries and tapas bars. The hotel is easy to reach from the airport using public transport - although a couple of metro changes is required. The rooms are generally on the smaller side but are all kitted out with modern technology, including free Wi-Fi - which to me is a real bonus. The bathroom is right up there with the best hotel bathrooms I've ever come across on my travels. Another big plus was the UK three pin mains socket in the room. All staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself has recently been refurbished and the decor is very stylish, modern and n some ways bordering on minimalist ... but I quite like that. The breakfast buffet included was very good with plenty of choice, and everything was fresh and well presented. Didn't eat any other meals in the hotel so I'm not able to comment on those. During the 5 day stay the hotel was a good base for sightseeing as many sights are easily reached by foot from the hotel. For those sights which requires transport 'Sol' and 'Sevilla' metro stations are only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. As well as bar and restaurant at ground floor level there is also a popular roof terrace bar with excellent views over Madrid. Beware though, drinks are expensive - e.g. €11 for a gin & tonic, but worth doing at least once just to experience the views.

Reviews.Title: “MODERN HIP HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ggisonna
Reviews.Content: Modern, quiet even thought there's a club located on the roof BUT our room was on the first floor. Awesome bathroom and shower. Bathroom had Aveda products. Room has purple rugs and funcky "sexy" lights. Very helpful staff from the moment the cab pulled up to the hotel door. Able to exchange money without a charge. Walking distance to everything. International airport is 25 minutes by cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Experience”
Reviews.Author: kdub_SF
Reviews.Content: We kicked off our honeymoon in Madrid at the ME and could not have been more pleased. The location was perfect - 5 min walk to the main square, but even better, right on the Plaza Santa Ana, so tons of good food/tapas restaurant choices, great people watching on the plaza, nightlife on the trendy rooftop bar (which we could skip the long lines to get into since we stayed at the hotel). And Temo at the front desk was super helpful, accommodating, and friendly. Honestly, not a bad word to say, except that the room was tight. But it was perfect and well-layed-out for sleeping and relaxing when we needed a break from the heat (great temperature control). Highly recommend to anyone traveling to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Begonia21
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a weekend at the ME Madrid. Hotel was very modern and funky. The delux rooms are great, if not a bit on the small side but otherwise was great for a long weekend! The beds were amazing, if you like soft comfortable beds. The ensuite was spacious (considering the rooms were on the small side) with a brilliant power shower. Our rate included the breakfast buffet which was a pretty good selection. The staff were very friendly and attententive. The location of the hotel is just by plaza santa ana, which is a really lovely sqaure full of manay tapas places to eat and drink, and is brilliantly located for going out as well. The penthouse bar had amazing views and a great vibe to it. Though you are able to hear the music from the club, so perhaps if you wanted a quiet weekend not so ideal. Otherwise, it is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - could not have been any better”
Reviews.Author: casandra16
Reviews.Content: I normally do not write however this was the best in Madrid for location, fun, food, hotel amenities and service. This was absolutely super.......directions on metro to hotel great, directions to sights great, great atmosphere, all in all would not stay anywhere else in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nightclub in your room”
Reviews.Author: adlondon41
Reviews.Content: If you intend to have a relaxing week-end, do not go to the ME hotel. They have a club on the top floor of the hotel and the music and vibrations traveled down to my room (situated on the second floor of the hotel). Being on Spanish time, the club only closes very late (around 3am). Another problem was the difficulty to operate the lights in the room with a remote control that was very confusing. The plus sides are that the rooms are comfortable and the location is unbeatable. The concierge is useless, no good recomendations to give for restaurants etc so go prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Great, modernized hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CS01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the Me in Madrid and it's a real gem. The hotel is beautiful, located right on the Plaza de Santa Ana, and has a very contemporary feel. Their service is also excellent; prior to arriving, I emailed asking what would be the best way to get to the hotel when using the Metro. What I got in return was a very detailed response, telling me each train, each stop, and even the color of the train line that I should be looking for. Really great for someone who's never been there. Once inside, the hotel is very modern. One thing I particularly enjoyed was the free wifi in the room, allowing me to check emails and read news on my phone. We had drinks on the rooftop which is one of the largest I've been on in any of the hotels we've stayed. We ate a small meal at the Midnight Rose and were very impressed. The hotel was situated near everything so we walked everywhere. Parque del Retiro, Museo del Prado, Teatro Real, etc, were all within easy walking distance. All in all, if we were to go back to Madrid, we wouldn't look anywhere but the Me. It was an excellent stay at an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice decoration but poor service and the worst management I've seen”
Reviews.Author: Suabo
Reviews.Content: If you are not a party animal stay away from this hotel. We book a room for a romantic trip to madrid, but couldn't sleep at all until 3:30 am. Even after several calls to the reception they would not lower the music from the disco at the terrace. I could even fell the strong vibrations with the ear plugs. We decided to go up and see how the party was, but we where told then that it was a private party... I could not believe it... I strongly do not recomend this hotel. The desing by itself is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Try and stay in the bigger rooms”
Reviews.Author: fj74582
Reviews.Content: I have been to Madrid several times and usually stay at the Westin Palace. This trip was for about two weeks so I decided to stay a few days at the Westin, Palace and the rest of my time at the ME. The ME has a great location (in front of la Plaze de Santa Ana) walking distance to pretty much everything. Good service, great rooms (make sure you get the bigger rooms), roof top bar, gym and free internet. Pros; 1. Location. 2. Service 3. Free internet 4. Roof top bar 5. Modern Cons; 1. Restaurant and food need a major upgrade. 2. Regular rooms are SMALL! 3. After hours room service is can be problematic. My stay at the ME was great, will stay there again. There is also a great restaurant located right in front of the hotel called LATERAL that has great food at reasonable prices. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED if you are traveling with a significant other who enjoys nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Hotel in a magical city”
Reviews.Author: keciaanne
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 glorious nights in room 502. I highly recommend upgrading to a 5th floor room, and requesting a balcony facing the plaza. The room - king sz bed was extremely comfortable, high quality sheets, great lighting, TV, stereo, fabulous espresso machine, flat screen TV (several English-speaking channels), great A/C. Bathroom is small, but has nice modern fixtures and great shower head with multiple spray options. Robes and slippers provided, surprisingly soundproof. The location - very safe, an easy walk to several main plazas - (Plaza de Mayor, Plaza del Sol), and the Prado. I highly recommend a visit to Retiro Park - rent a paddle boat (4 euros for 45 min) or enjoy a drink by the water. Great view form the rooftop, although the Terrace was packed every night and had limited space. Staff was friendly, effiiceint, and extrmemely helpful. Definitely my first choice hotel in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault the hotel”
Reviews.Author: schloofer
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to be in a beautiful, modern and funky hotel, in a great location! Staff were so helpful at all times, room was beautiful and the hotel restaurant and bar were perfect if you are looking for great food and drinks without having to leave the hotel. Lots of lovely shops, restaurants and sites, all within walking distance of the hotel. Couldn't fault the ME Hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: farhanakhan
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great. The location, my view from my room, the staff was very helpful. We ate at the midnight -rose , which is located in the hotel and it was really good. Over all i would stay here again. Make sure to up-grade to a room with a view of the outside streets.

Reviews.Title: “ME Hotel Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Geeman63
Reviews.Content: This my first time to Madrid and without knowing the "lay of the land" I picked the ME Hotel in Madrid - it turned out to be a great choice. The hotel is fabulous and the location gets a 10 out 10. Really comfortable and well appointed funky rooms. I'll be retuning to this hotel again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Roof Terrace & Location”
Reviews.Author: TheGrimesReview
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May for a long weekend with friends. I have been in Madrid twice before and knew of this hotel from previous visits as it looks spectacular when standing in Plaza St Anna where the hotel is located. On reading reviews I decided this would be the best base for our weekend in Madrid. The hotel itself is in a great location as so many bars and tapas bars nearby and also in the middle of the old town. The hotel has a great design inside and the rooms are also well designed if a little on the small side however big enough for a city break when you really only use it to catch up on some well needed rest. We were booked in room only so cannot comment on the food. To be honest there are so many places to choose from nearby it would seem crazy to spend money on hotel food. I can comment on the roof terrace which is stunning. It has been designed by Randy Gerber (Cindy Crawford's husband) and no expense has been spared. The views over the city are amazing and would recommend that you try this place out at least once. Only point about the hotel was the price of the drinks. The roof terrace attracts a who's who of Madrid at the weekends and the bar prices reflect this. Typically a cocktail will set you back 15 euros and at the current exchange rate that amounts to a pricey drink. However if you are prepared to spend the money it is a great place to party at the weekend and you only have to fall into the lift to your room when you have had enough. All in all a great hotel in a superb location and with access to an amazing roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Quiet room”
Reviews.Author: FloraDenmark
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location. The Santa Ana sq. is a nice place to eat tapas and you can walk to the museum triangle and the nearest metro. Staff is friendly and speake english very well. Our room was clean and modern - and quiet. Our overall impression is positive, but a few things would have made our stay even better. Our room was very small - one have the right to expect a larger room in a hotel like this. The room had no view - unless a very small court yard count as a view (in case of a fire - no escape/rescue through the windows). The internet is not free - you actually have to pay for it! You also have to pay for watching TV. Breakfast is quite ekspensive - at ALICIA Room mate Hotel / Tapasbar at the corner of Plaza Santa Ana and Prado/Principe you find a good alternative.

Reviews.Title: “agree with everything written, but.....”
Reviews.Author: magicwand
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a stay at Me Madrid Reina Victoria and I agree with everything written. Great hip hotel, perfect location, central to everything, etc. However, do not book a standard room.....these rooms are way too small to stay in for more than one person, or more than one night. Further don't expect an automatic upgrade unless your willing to pay a supplemental fee. After being told there were no rooms available to upgrade to, we were then offered an upgrade as long as we were willing to pay for it. So, after being told they would not refund our advance payment and tired from travel we relented and paid a supplement for the first evening. I will say however that they did agree to upgrade us for the next two evenings to a beautiful supreme room with a view of Plaza Santa Ana. Again, stay at this hotel. Maximum 10-15 minute walk to everything. Location is clean and safe and Plaza Santa Ana is one of the nicer areas to sit and eat and drink. There is also a great Flamenco club( one of the highlights of our trip ) 1 block away, so when it is over at 1:00AM it only takes you 2 minutes to get back to the hotel. Stay here just pay the extra money for the supreme room.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Aatu
Reviews.Content: ME Madrid is a modern, fashionable hotel in Madrid. I stayed there for 4 nights in late March. If you’re looking for a classic luxury hotel, then this isn’t for you. However, if you want a “trendy”, clean, well functioning hotel with a great location then this is definitely it. If the price is right, I would definitely recommend it to all my friends when they visit Madrid. In my case they honored their best rate guarantee and took 10% off of the quote I found. Location can only be described as perfect! Facing the lovely Plaza de Santa Ana, the hotel is within a walking distance to most sighs, restaurants and shops. Santa Ana square is also lovely for sitting on a terrace and drinking wine / eating. If you’re driving to the hotel (as we were) get a GPS or a very good map. Most of the roads leading to the hotel are very narrow or one way. We had a supreme room with a wonderful view of Plaza de Santa Ana. Room was modern, clean and had an impressive list of equipment, such as a 32” plasma, free wifi, cd/dvd systems, safe, good lighting, bathrobes and an iron and a board. The room isn’t big but suited us well for 4 nights. Minibar is called Maxi Bar and it takes out a rather big space of the already small room. It was well stacked, but I found it to be rather expensive. Bathroom was clean as well, had a large mirror, shower and good selection of toiletries. We didn’t hear any music from the bar upstairs, some noises from the Plaza in front of the hotel, but not enough to bother us. Breakfast at the ME (as in most hotels) is expensive compared to the local price levels in cafes etc. However, as a member of Solmelia we got breakfasts 2 for the price of 1 which made it affordable. It was very nice with a number of different juices, cereal, cheeses, etc etc. A nice touch was that there wasn’t too much, but enough and most of the plates and jugs for juices were rather small. This made sure that product didn’t stand there for too long and thus was always fresh. We didn’t try the hotel’s restaurant as there are many outside close to the hotel. We had drinks at the bar upstairs but it seemed quiet (it wasn’t season just yet). Great views, and probably a nice place to sit for a while in the evening. Service at the ME was very efficient. Although I really can’t complain, as the check in was swift and was handled with a smile, I missed something overall. The staff would seem to focus so much on ME’s everything is possible brand that they forget the personal touch, which I appreciate. This however, was a minor detail and didn’t affect our stay at all. All in all, a great stay, lovely room / view and a perfect location. I will definitely stay there again when visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gjb6774
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! Terrific, modern decor throughout the hotel. The room was a decent size, look out over Santa Ana Plaza and we got a terrific deal. The staff was wonderful and couldn't be more helpful. We had drinks at The Penthouse Lounge at the top of the building and it was really nice to look out over the plaza and have a nice view of the city. It was extremely convenient having the plaza right at the doorsteps given there were a few good restaurants. It was nice to be just a little off the tourist path. Defintely recommend the ME.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: FESG
Reviews.Content: I was gonna write a longer review on this fantastic hotel, but noticed that a previous review entitled "Excellent Hotel and Great Location -- Would definitely visit again" perfectly resumed our thoughts.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, love it, love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonGirl009
Reviews.Content: I've been to Madrid a couple of times and this is by far the best hotel in Madrid and in the best location! This hote is, genuinely, at the centre of all that is modern and cool about Madrid. The rooftop bar is among the most popular in the City and is full every night. The hotel is also facing on to the best square in Madrid, opposite the theatre and with plenty of cafes in it. The room was perfect and the staff couldnt have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good location, trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: empedernido
Reviews.Content: Very trendy, with restaurants and rooftop bar. Rooms very clean and modern but not very spacious. Excelent location in Madrid if you are a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Delighful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David777
Reviews.Content: If you want a change from the run of the mill chains - try the newly refubished ME Madrid - a very well located boutique hotel right in the heart of Madrid. Beautifully appointed rooms with CD players, wide screen TVs and well appointed bathrooms. My room overlooked the pedestrianised square in front of the hotel - be warned though the Spanish eat very late and you can hear some noise from the square in the early hours unless you ask for a room on a higher floor. Especially recommend the trendy roof top hotel bar with great 360 degree views of the city from the plush comfy sofas. Large meeting room in the base of the hotel with all the usual av facilities including wireless internet. Buffet breakfast very good with attentive staff - you are spoilt for choice for tapas and traditional Spanish restaurants within a short walk of the foyer - ask the very helpful and mulitilingual reception staff to make a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Portia08
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here after getting a terrific online non-refundable rate. The promised room was a small interior one, which we deemed sufficient for our first two days in Spain. We were upgraded to a slightly larger room in the same class with windows to an exterior courtyard. Everything in the room was very modern, and the bathroom shower was outstanding. The bed was comfortable. Be advised that at night light does shine through the opaque bathroom door, and might disturb a light sleeper. The location was excellent for exploring Madrid on foot, and visiting the main museums. The Plaza Santa Ana is ringed with small restaurants that provide outdoor service on the square. The staff at the hotel do everything possible to assist you and make your stay pleasant. They speak excellent English and can make reservations and answer questions about the city.

Reviews.Title: “The ME is MEarvelous!”
Reviews.Author: kayeen
Reviews.Content: This chic hotel provides an excellent location for visiting Madrid along with warm attentive service, well designed rooms with exceptionally comfortable beds and great views! We found the front desk staff to be warm and friendly and all the staff always greeted us were ever we were in the hotel… even the housekeeping staff. Check-in was very welcoming, quick and efficient. The front desk agent even escorted us to the elevator! We booked a deluxe room directly through the hotel website for 118€ and had the good fortune of being upgraded to a superior room facing Plaza Santa Ana. This upgrade was likely due to our being enrolled in the MAS program. The room was great! The aspects of the room that we appreciated were that there were no electrical cords to be seen: the floor lamp outlet was in the floor under the lamp base (very clever), the room offered exceptional and flexible lighting, the floor to ceiling windows had shears drapes as well as black out curtains and a sliding door that provided additional soundproofing from the hallway (although we encountered no noise issues). The room has a nice sized marble shower room (no ugly bulky bathtub) with modern finishings and very strong water pressure. The bed provided ultimate of comfort… although we were excited to explore Madrid each day we had to force ourselves to get out of the comfy bed! The windows are double-paned and open up to let fresh air in as well as the happy and bustling sounds of the plaza outside. The views from the rooftop (The Penthouse) are wonderful too! The plaza outside offers a mass of cafes with outdoor seating. Meson Cinco Jotas, the place with green chairs to the left as you exit the hotel, offered very affordable and delicious tapas. Most places open at 9Am or later so it can be hard to find a coffee and morning bite for us early risers. There is a nice place to start the day at the far end of the plaza on the right side. The location is perfect for exploring Madrid. One can walk to all the main sites and back. There are tons of cafes in Madrid so it is easy to rest and enjoy a drink on the way. We walked to Campo de Moro after visiting the Palace Real and did not want to walk back to the hotel from there so took the nearby dark blue line metro from Principe Pio to Tribunal and then transferred to light blur line to Anton Martin back to the hotel area. The final stop is only a few minutes stroll from the hotel. The metro was very simple to use. We only used it this one time as we found the city very accommodating for walking everywhere. The Catalonia Las Cortes and the Hotel Room Mate Alicia are both at the far end of the plaza, but the ME dominates the plaza area over these other properties. The Urban is a few blocks away too, but again the location of the ME is far superior. We were concerned that the hotel might be a little to hip and trendy for us and so we were very pleased to find that, although hip and trendy, the hotel is a very welcoming and accommodating place for everyone! The ME reigns supreme!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property, best in Madrid for luxury and location”
Reviews.Author: Soulmates33
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing stay at the Reina Victoria. I'd say that this property is the best in Madrid if you're looking for the best of both worlds in luxury and location. * I would absolutely recommend this property to anyone looking for the perfect mix of luxury and location. * LUXURY The Reina Victoria is a stunning property. It's a strikingly large and elegant building. As we were approaching in our taxi, I was surprised to find that this was our hotel. It looks almost stately. It also provides quite a nice backdrop for Plaza de Santa Ana in the evenings as it is lit up in a purple hue from top-to-bottom (refer to my pictures). With a stately look to the exterior, I was again surprised to find that this property was very modern on the inside. The lobby was filled with plush couches and lounge music. The bar on the ground floor as well as the impressive penthouse bar were always quite packed with people. The good was just fine and breakfast was quite EXTensive, although also very EXPensive. The room was amazing. Flat screen TV built into the wall with an integrated stereo system. Lighting was also interesting. There was a lighting remote control of sorts that allowed me to customize which lights were on the in the room (i.e. over the desk, over the bed) as well as the color of the lights based on my mood. The bathroom was covered with large ceramic tiles including the glass shower with head-to-toe shower jets. The bathroom also had heated floors, which was nice touch. LOCATION The Reina Victoria sits directly on Plaza de Santa Ana, which is very lively during both the daytime and evening hours. The plaza as well as the surrounding streets are filled with tapas bars that are reasonably-priced and well worth your time and money. Puerta del Sol along with the metro station are less than 5 mins away by foot. Plaza Mayor and the Gran Via are slightly further, about 15 mins away by foot. * Again, I had a perfect stay at the Reina Victoria and would recommend this property to anyone looking for the best location and luxury in Madrid *

Reviews.Title: “Good choice even for the honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Qia
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel for the honeymoon: good choice! Great location; a walkingdistance to everywhere. Excellent modern room with comfortable double-bed and tv. The room was a bit small but the bathroom was spacious and there was also enough space to empty your suitcase into the closet. Be careful for pocket thieves on Plaza Puerta del Sol; I nealrly got robbed there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely AMAZING!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCchick82
Reviews.Content: OMG!!!! This hotel was GREAT!!!!!!!! Its located right in the center of Madrid with walking distance to all major sights. Its in this amazing square that has bars / restaurants right outside to enjoy the views and great food. The service was amazing and so were the rooms. Although, the standard room is very small and has no view (you're looking into the wall of the other side of the building) it has all the top ammenities. If u dont mind spending a little extra money, upgrade to a better room. We wound up getting their Level Room - amazing view of the square outside and ALL of Madrid, big room and HUGE bathroom. They provide Aveda bath products so you dont even need to take anything with you. We didnt hear anyone walking in the hallways or making any noise. Staff is very helpfull and nice and go out of their way to serve you. They have a great bar on the roof with amazing views of the entire city. Overall, we absolutely enjoyed our stay there and I would only tell my friends to stay in this hotel. It has absolutely everything you need, great locations and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Kathy84
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and the city! the hotel is situated in a pretty piazza in the centre of Madrid, there are nice bars where you can sit out in the sunshine and enjoy a meal the building is very impressive, modern and the service is wonderful our bags were swiftly taken off us upon arrival the checkin was friendly and the receptionist was very friendly and took an interest in our trip the room was lovely a bit small but that didnt matter as who comes to Madrid to sit in a room all day. the bed was so comfy I literally had to drag myself out of bed in the mornings! the facilities are excellent, power jet masage shower, lovely Aveda beauty products and big fluffy towels, telephone, bath robes and slippers in the room there is a wide screen tv with pay to view movies, internet, dvd player and music (That could be heard in the bathroom if you wanted there is a volume button nice mini bar but expensive so we went to the super market down the street and got our breakfast and drinks . I would stay here again and we got a great deal on last minute

Reviews.Title: “Great concept, very fashionable hotel, painfully small rooms :o(”
Reviews.Author: swj101
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to the 'boutique' label nicely and it turned out it was quite the place to be seen. Generally speaking, you won't find another hotel of this standard at the prices they charge in any major European city, although Madrid is generally full of bargains. Our room was clean and had all the boutique mod cons, although it was painfully small. Just 60 cm to squeeze around the bed on all three sides and strangely a desk at the food of the bed with no space for a chair, meaning that you could only possible sit at the edge of the bed. The bathroom was almost as big as the room, although the shower design meant that the entire room flooded each time we showered. Note that it wasn't designed as a wet room and the water didn't drain away. p.s. the mini bar was possible the most expensive mini bar I've ever come accross. 8 Euros for a small bottle of mineral water. Take your own!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dannydev
Reviews.Content: the hotel is an a fantastic location, 15 min walk to the main art galleries, all set within the old city lots of plaza and cobbled streets. There are plenty of nice bars and restaurant in the local area within a stones throw of the hotel even though we were told by the receptionist at the hotel that there were no bars and we would have to book a table at the restaurant, not true. The hotel is very clean and looks good, but the deluxe room was tiny, nice touches such as a good hairdryer and aveda products and a very comfy bed. Walls were a little thin and not sound proof. THe airport is 5 min away buy taxi and when ordered through the hotel is an extra 5 ish euros. Madrid is a wonderfull city and Santa Ana is a perfect base.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: fitzpap3
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with a great location. Our room looked out onto the PLaza Santa Ana and what a view it was!! There are loads of little bars and restaurants around the square, creating a great atmosphere. The hotel had a lively bar with a nice restaurant. There is a great nigh club on the top floor but you hear none of the noise as all the bedrooms are sound proofed. The staff were very nice and helpful. It's only a 15 minute taxi ride from the airport and is within walking distance of most of the tourist attractions and shopping areas

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lluviagirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in January 2009 for five days. When I made the reservation I specified a room with a view to the Santa Ana Plaza. And exactly, we got this view. It was a beautiful view with all the snow. The breakfast was fabolous! It includes Cava(spanish champagne)! Many Thanks to Blanca(she was always there to please the guests) and to Federico he was very helpful and polite. The location of the hotel is ideal. The room was very pretty, everything clean, the toiletries very good. The TV, DVD set excellent. We certainly will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra $$ - well worth it”
Reviews.Author: granvisconti
Reviews.Content: Had a few days free at the beginning of the year, so booked a last-minute week in Spain, splitting the time between MAD & BCN.I had previously stayed in Madrid at another boutique chain (highly rated by this and other travel sites), but knew that the location of the ME Madrid (it's still the Reina Victoria to me, the bullgfighter's hotel from the 50's) was fantastic. as was the "scene". I was hesistant about the additional cost of the "superior" room (with prime holiday rates), but in comparison shopping, saw that it was the same price as my other choice of hotel, which wasn't as centrally located. Maybe the noise complaints in other reviews come from people who aren't used to the late-nite life in central Madrid. If you want to go to sleep by 1130pm, you should look for accomodation farther away from the scenic old neighborhoods. My room faced the Placa, which is now just a cement rectangle, but it is surrounded by a wide variety of excellent restaourants, cafes, and the Theatre. It is also bustling after 10pm, but I rarely heard any sustained partying (but I wasn't in the hotel before 4am myself). The neighbors in the adjoining room had children, but because of the layout of my room (306), the vestibule with the sliding door muffled almost every noise from them (or from people in the hallways). I travel in business class hotels around the world (4 & 5 star), but will often find cheaper, less commercial, lodging when travelling on my own dime. This was possibly one of the best hotel stays I have encountered in Europe in several years. The bed, the linens, the bathroom, the FREE internet and flat screen tv THAT WORKED - things we take for granted at home, but become vital when travelling - all were top-notch. Similarly, it's not the Ritz - there is a rowdy nightclub two doors away, as well as the revolfing door for the trendy restaurant and bar located in the hotel, and the crowd isn't the young royals or the Aga Khan. The location is defintiely a main reason to stay here, with nearly all of the main museums, historic shops, great dining, etc., literally with 1-10 minutes outside your door. My new 1st choice in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annisobel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the MeMadrid hotel from 11th to 15th November 2008 for a preChristmas City Break. We had booked a supreme room on Expedia and joined the Mas Reward scheme beforehand. I emailed the hotel before our break and requested a non-smoking king bed room overlooking Plaza Santa Ana. The room we were allocated was simply superb and had a fantastic view of the Plaza. The bed was very comfortable and the techy equipment and lighting was great fun. The shower room was equally superb with a fantastic shower. The reception desk and concierge were at all times very friendly and helpful. The bar staff, both in the ground floor bar and the rooftop bar were at all times really friendly and good at their jobs. We had absolutly no problems with noise even though our room overlooked the plaza - we slept exceptionally well and heard no noise from the plaza or the rooftop bar. The windows in our room had the original windows overlaid with excellent double glazing windows. The location of this hotel is excellent. On our previous trip to Madrid we had stayed at one of the big hotels on Gran Via but would now always stay in this location. We ate in the restaurant for one breakfast and the food was excellent. The other mornings we ate at a local cafe - we were too full from all the tapas we ate in the evening to justify eating a large breakfast. again. The hotel is walking distance to the 3 great art museums in Madrid and the only time we used the metro was to go to Real Madrid football ground to do the stadium tour. I guess you get what you pay for - if you choose the cheapest rate you will get the smallest room, if you choose a mid rate you will get an excellent room with a great view. By joining the Mas Reward programme we were able to receive two English newspapers for free every morning and to have the buffet breakfast in the restaurant for half price - how great is that. I have recommended this hotel to many friends since our return - if you want to stay in a great hotel in a fantastic location in a fun city like Madrid, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice small room”
Reviews.Author: turistomerIstanbul
Reviews.Content: Early 2000 I spent one night in this hotel .At that time the name was Reina Victoria and hotel building & facilities were nice however Plaza Santa Ana is a nicer place so we have decided to spent one night on our way back from Andalusia to home. The interior design is renovated and reception area is equipped with nice staff and music. The room was small however quite nice and decorated with wonderful lighting system with high tech bedside control panel. Our accommodation was without breakfast so no explanation about this. Front desk staff was perfect, they supplied free maps and also some umbrella to other visitor. We would recommend this hotel because of it’s venue as we agree with the members about it’s wonderful location full of bars and nice restaurant hence quite close to Museums Thyssen and Prado.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Tiny Room!”
Reviews.Author: NJEWHU
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in an excellent location. However its not cheap. Its going for the boutique feel which I liked but having spent 2 days here and trying to work in the room it feels a bit like being stuck in a hutch!

Reviews.Title: “Spanish version of a groovy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drossoulites
Reviews.Content: There must be quite a variation in room size from reading other reviews - I stayed 3 nights in what must have been the smallest double room I've ever been in. The room was well-appointed though in current hi-tech, minimalist hotel-designer style (why must they those push-pull taps! Did they ever test-drive them or just choose for looks!) - wood laminate floors, big flat screen TV, bedside controls for lighting, a/c etc (had a struggle to get the room warm enough). Shower is amazing with massage jets every which way. Best feature for me on a biz trip - FREE WIFI that worked! The hotel almost tries too hard with the cool image - the website looks like they're a bordello, and is close to being guilty of "style over substance", but then I'm an old fart! As others have said, great location in a the beautiful Plaza Santa Ana

Reviews.Title: “Hip, happening and great value”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_Hunter123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ME Madrid in August 2008. The hotel is in a great location, really central and in a pleasant square with a number of tapas bars in. We had booked a standard (i.e. deluxe) room, and found it to be really spacious, with a massive bed, flat screen TV, 2 armchairs, coffee table and well stocked minibar. Loved the lighting options too! We had booked on the "ME wants you in Madrid" package, which meant that there was a bottle of cava with strawberries and dipping chocolate in our room. The bathroom was also huge with a fantastic double shower. Contrary to some of the other reviews, we didn't have a problem with noise at all (We had an internal room with no view but probably the best bet if you prefer quiet at night). Tip - try to get a package which includes breakfast as it is otherwise quite expensive. There are a number of packages available on the hotel's own website and I found these to be similarly priced to supposed discount websites. The restaurant and downstairs bar are fantastic, very hip and trendy but certainly no attitude, and the service was very good. The upstairs bar is great for views (although very windy!), the only frustrating point was that despite going up there early (9pm), all seats were reserved - which doesn't make sense given that there wasn't a queue at that point to sit on them - I think the hotel needs to manage this better. Altogether though, I couldn't recommend the hotel highly enough, it's reasonable value and a stylish place to spend the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern and funky!”
Reviews.Author: diva80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the ME Melia for 3 nights last week and enjoyed our stay. To minimise on cost, we took a Deluxe room (which despite the posh sounding name is a standard room!). It was very small, but as we weren't planning on spending that much time in the room and it was a short stay, we didn't mind. If we had been there for a week then we definitely would have chosen a larger Supreme room. Our room was clean, cosy and comfortable though. All we could see from our window was a white wall outside, but we weren't too fussed about that. The DVD player was a very nice touch, as TV channels in hotels can often be quite limiting. When you come back in the evening, there is a nice lips-shaped chocolate on your bed, along with a small candle by the bedside. The bathroom was lovely, and the shower is amazing!! They provide lovely Aveda products and good quality robe and towels. There is plenty of storage space too. I took my own teabags but unfortunately there was not a kettle in the room, I am not sure if the larger rooms would have had one. Although we didn't ask them much, the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. This is definitely a hotel for the younger crowd as the staff are all young and hip, and often wearing designer clothing. The location of the hotel is excellent, Plaza de Santa Ana is where there are a lot of cafes and bars for the evening, and it is within walking distance of the main shopping area (Sol/Gran Via). We even walked to the museums, although it took about 20-30 mins, but we wanted the exercise. We popped up to the rooftop bar to have a look, and it looked really nice but was closed when we went (monday evening) but on a weekend it is supposed to be excellent. The whole hotel has a nice modern funky feel to it. Although this is a hotel review, I will say a few other things about my trip in general! If you have a sweet tooth, you must have some chocolate y churros (long donuts with very thick hot chocolate) from Chocolateria San Gines, they are to die for! we had it about 5 times in 3 days, so you can imagine how much we loved them! Also just opposite it is a nice italian place with excellent quality pizza, but I forget the name. We also went to a chain called Ginos but the pizza there was awful! A friend recommended Siam which is a Thai restaurant on Calle San Bernadino near Plaza de Espana which was really nice, and although was hidden away, seemed to be popular and full of people. Somehow I didn't manage to find a good place for tapas, but am sure there are plenty of places, probably in side streets. All in all I thoroughly enjoyed my trip, and would definitely consider staying at the ME again.

Reviews.Title: “Only suitable for party people”
Reviews.Author: Kerrser
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if you want to get a good night's sleep. We stayed for 2 nights. It is "party central" with booming dance music coming from the rooftop bar and lasting until 3.30 in the morning. There is also loud music from the bar on the ground floor. We tried to change rooms but nowhere was quiet. I would emphasise that it was noise from inside the hotel, not from outside that was a problem. It obviously caters for party people and the staff will politely apologise for the noise but do nothing about it. The hotel would obviously rather have the extra revenue from club-goers than give other guests a chance to sleep. The hotel is hip and looks good, the staff are generally helpful and the rooms are comfortable enough if rather small. However these positive aspects are irrelevant as you cannot get a good night's sleep here and that's what most people want from a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful and patheti service”
Reviews.Author: NOMERCYMad
Reviews.Content: At the terrace, After paying an expensive and tasteless mojito, me and 9 friends sat at a sofa table, with permission of the waiter. But after a while, he comes with a group of HIS friends arguing the table was reserved and that they didn´t have the reservation card on because of the rain (???) and made us stand up and leave. IT IS NOT A PROPER WAY TO TREAT A CLIENT, YOU CANNOT MAKE A CLIENT LEAVE THE TABLE TO SIT ANOTHER CLIENT, UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCE. We told the manager, his answer was a sorry for the mistake. YOU CAN NOT EXPECT A GOOD SERVICE FROM THIS HOTEL...even the manager doesn´t care as he should.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the ME!”
Reviews.Author: melissa_stills
Reviews.Content: Me and my best friend stayed at the ME for a long wkend at the beginning of September and the hotel was just what we were looking for. The location is fantastic with some great bars just in front of the hotel where you can eat tapas and drink beer outside in the square and watch the world go by. You are not far away from the shops either. The service we received was impeccable, the staff are very polite and friendly and couldnt do enough to make sure we had everything we needed. The whole decor of the hotel is amazing, very modern but comfortable, as was our room which was just the right size with a plasma screen and the sexy pink lighting! Beautiful bathroom and great shower too. A must is to view Madrid by night on the roof of the hotel at the Penthouse bar. The views of the square all lit up and in the distance needs to be seen. The bar itself was brilliant, you could really dress up, or you could wear jeans, either way you do not look out of place. Yes, it gets busy but the atmosphere is friendly and lively. We went on a tour bus to see Real Madrid's football ground which I highly reccommend, the bus travels all around Madrid and has several stops and you can get on and off the bus as often as you like for a day's pass. Its a great way to see Madrid. One bar I would really reccommend which is situated just outside the hotel is Miali, attentive staff and great food!

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room on earth”
Reviews.Author: needasherpa
Reviews.Content: I've traveled quite a bit through Europe and have stayed in some small hotel rooms, but this one takes the cake. The hotel is funky and cool, but the rooftop bar is loud. The rooms are nicely fitted out and its in a good location (Plaza de Santa Ana), but I can't get past the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Muy bien!!!! Great Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vigilanteviajero
Reviews.Content: Great room they assigned me. Service was good and the hotel is very well located. Yes, perhaps a bit noisy outside but it is lively and fun. Breakfast is outraggeously expensive but good. If you fancy comtemporary and modern, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: cleo74
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Sept 4 through 6 2008. I am NOT a picky traveler and the most important thing for me is to be able to sleep at night. All else I can forego. Well, I had specifically asked for a quiet room. I got a room facing the courtyard but the bar on the roof of the hotel played LOUD music unit 3:45 in the morning!!! The windows are not double-paned which I find absolutely ridiculous for this hotel seeing how their DJ blasts music till practically morning. We stayed a Thursday and Friday, both nights the music was loud but especially Friday night. We had an early flight on Saturday morning so we slept around 3 hours even though we went to bed at 11 at night. I was very upset but still so professional towards the receptionist. She at first was not believing me and kept saying are you sure it was not the bars outside. I was like YES I AM SURE!!!!! Her name was Sabrina. I told her I wanted to see the manager, she said he wasn't there. I told her I did not think I should pay 150 euros for the previous night as I had not slept. She said she'd talk to him and either contact me by phone or email. Needless to say neither has happened and my card was charged for both nights. We got a "complimentary" breakfast and that was it. The rest of the hotel is OK. The rooftop bar looks very cool but the noise is just insane. Location is very good. I am willing to bet there are a ton better hotels though. I would skip this one because I am not a light sleeper and it was too much even for me.

Reviews.Title: “We just loved it”
Reviews.Author: lunotas
Reviews.Content: We spend 5 nights at ME MAdrid with our Kids ages 9 and 13. We got two connected rooms and they were small but that is what we expected. They were however very comfortable. Great lighting and AC was perfect. We chose to have interior rooms to avoid the noise and the fact that they faced and inside cortyard did not bodered us at all. If you want a bigger room then just pay for it. We signed up to become Melia members and got breakfast for all 4 for 44 Euros instead of 88 every day. The staff was great! Thank you Ivan and Celia. They guided us very well during our stay. The location of this hotel is fantastic. You can walk to the museums, to Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real, Calle Serrano... everywhere. The location is also fun, Plaza Santa Ana is busy and charming. Celia recommended El Lacon for Tapas and it was great, also went to "Huevos de Lucio" and loved the "huevos con patatas". One night the kids stayed in the hotel and we enjoyed an incredible meal at "Ramses" in Plaza de Alcala! to our surprise we sat next to Pedro Almodobar... Ramses also has a great bar and dancing area, but be aware that the dancing doesn't start til 2:00am. Make reservations in advanced. DO NOT EAT AT ANY OF THE RESTAURANT INSIDE PLAZA MAYOR. Our only bad experience in Madrid was a dinner at one of the places in there, the food was terrible and very expensive. Later we commented our experience with the concierge at ME Madrid and they never recommend it there. The restaurants at the side streets are much better. We did two day trips to Toledo and to Segovia and Avila and they were both incredible. We wished we had stayed a cople of extra days to fully enjoy Me and Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: g12doc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2008 for 4 days. Perfect weather and almost perfect hotel - just missed the mark in a few minor ways so don't let my 4* review put you off!! Reception From the welcome at the door as we stepped out of the taxi, to the fluent-in-English staff behind the desk, to the more than helpful concierge this was one of our better experiences. The hotel aims to be 'boutique chic' while actually being quite large, and manages to pull it off easily. The decor in the reception area was spotless and apparently effortless. Room The bedroom was tiny - but probably because we'd booked it through lastminute.com! But despite it's size was very serviceable, the bed comfortable and very quiet (but it was an inside room). If you really like looking out of the window at the nightlife at night time rather than sleeping then this room (533)probably isn't for you. The negatives were that despite being adcertised as having twice daily maid service our room often wasn't attended to until 7.30pm which was somewhat after the turn down time! As a result we were handed our chocolate lips and candle before the maid had been to tidy up. Sheet changes were also a little variable - some days they did some they didn't... On the up side the air con was perfect and the 'sexy' mood lighting was very amusing - you have to see it to believe it! The maid on our first day had only one word of English - "Sexy" which I didn't immediatley understand as she closed the curtains for us, turned down the lights and pointing to the bed said 'Sexy' several times. This was not quite the welcome I was expecting but was a source of some amusement when we realised it was not my animal magbetism she was referring to but in fact the button on the light switch which selected aforesaid mood lighting! Food OK it's Madrid and capital city prices can be n the up side - but we paid 96 Euros for two breakfasts which were OK but nothing special before I realised the error of my ways and we had a better breakfast for a fraction of the price in the plaza outside. Go to El Lacon if you like Tapas (200m away) 60 Euros for 2 with wine, Indian Spice if you like curry (250m away) 55 Euros with beer and St James (taxi) if you like paella and upmarket fish dishes 140 Euros with wine. Location Perfect for the 3 major Art Galleries, within easy walking distance. Go on Sunday and you get into Reina Sofia free 10am - 2pm and The Prado 5pm - 8pm Get a city Vision open topped bus for a look around but don't bother with the blue line - go for the historic red line which is slightly more interesting. It gets you orientated though! In summary, there are few hotels I would definitely go back to, but if I was in Madrid again I would definitely go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing,”
Reviews.Author: G7ONY
Reviews.Content: My strong recommendation for this establishment is DO NOT CONTEMPLATE STAYING HERE. Madrid’s beautiful and enchanting with numerous alternative hotels which hopefully won’t prove to be such a disappointment. The roof top terrrace may well be as good as others have suggested but it was unavailable when we stayed, as it was booked for private functions and residents cant even get access for a few pictures. A complaint was dealt with several weeks later with the offer of a "free drink" in response to the thorough runiation of a birthday treat and a bill close to €1,000. Staff clearly dont care, the roof top "manager" was bloody rude to my wife, clearly Basil Fawlty is alive and well, though now living in Spain!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon heaven”
Reviews.Author: honeymoonersingreece
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location.. there is no better place to stay in Madrid than this hotel. We went on our honeymoon for 3 nights before going to greece. The hotel was super chic and modern with the most comfy bed ever. The shower is so high tech with many jets hitting you from every angle. The cleanliness was high and room high tech. I could not figure out the remote control... the mood lighting is awesome. MAKE SURE YOU GET A ROOM FACING THE OUTSIDE...the inside courtyard is lame. The staff is wonderful and use the concierge to go to the best tapas spots as some are better than others. Our fave was "La Trucha" just down the street. Get the shrimp in garlic sauce... the clams at the Allemana tapas bar in the plaza out front are the best... you can walk everywhere from this location... book now
