Reviews.Title: “decadence (probably)”
Reviews.Author: fearanti
Reviews.Content: On two occasions I have been lucky enough to stay at this hotel...but on each the crazy Madrid pace meant i didn't spend enough time in this amazing place to really benefit. I stayed on the fourth floor (406?) which overlooks Placa Sant Ana. It has a great sound system, TV, really comfortable bed and lighting control system. It'd be a GREAT place for a weekend, unfortunately I will have to keep trying my luck to get back there on a Friday. very modern, coooooool and tredy. Apparently the roof terrace bar (not a rare occurrence in Madrid) has a queue at weekends to "be seen"

Reviews.Title: “Great rooftop bar and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonaustralia
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I love sending time in Madrid, and although disappointed not to get into our previous hotel, we were very pleasantly surprised to find a deal with the ME which we had seen on a previous trip. Without a shadow of a doubt, the best feature of this hotel is the wonderful rooftop bar. Occupied with what appears to be the beautiful people of Madrid, the drinks were well priced and very tasty. It is however the setting that is the bars biggest selling point. Even if you don't stay here - go. Book a private lounge bed if you can (bottle service only). As with all places, your experience will depend on the room that you book. Ours was facing onto an internal lightwell, and so wasn't as bright as one would hope. In spite of this, the room was comfortable, with a great audio visual set up. The mood lighting was very special. The only thing that was frustrating about the room was that the bathroom door was prone to slide open if you weren't careful. One final tip, join with the ME hotel group frequent user programme to get a free breakfast for one of your party (based on two people). The breakfast is worth getting up for, although expensive, so eat up!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location, excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: JR1977
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on its location and its modern design, I was not disappointed on either front. I took my girlfriend for a weekend break in Madrid and the hotel really made our trip. The hotel oozes style from the second you enter the reception, the rooms are very impressive in design and decor. The room had some very nice touches the 32" LCD tv built into the wall, the dvd/Bose sound system and the mood light settings were excellent. The bar on the ground floor is excellent and very popular as it is regarded as one of the coolest hang outs in the area to socialise and be seen. To be honest this bar is only out done on that front by the hotels rooftop bar called "Penthouse". There is always a que outside the hotel for this bar but guest can use the internal lift which takes you directly into the bar on the 7th floor, you get a fantastic view from up there. The location is excellent it faces a beautiful square with fantastic cafe's and tapas bars and most sights are within walking distance and those that aren't the metro system is just a couple of hundred yards walk. We will return to Madrid and will be staying at this hotel! Highly recommended A+.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: SixtyDays
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for business in a Supreme room. The room was well sized, clean and the bed was comfortable. The Aveda products in the bath room was also a nice touch. The turn down service in the evenings with mood lighting was also very inviting. However, there were some skuff marks and the room was starting to show its age since wood floors etc. generally will wear and tear with age. I would recommend this hotel if you can get a good rate. The roof top bar is very nice and recommended in the evenings when enjoying warm weather. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the centre of the old city”
Reviews.Author: denany
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights with a friend this past April. It was my second trip to Spain but the first to Madrid. Its a lovely hotel with a very popular bar / restaurant on the 1st floor and lounge at the top. The location was great on the Plaza Santa de Ana within walking distance to the Prado and the Plaza Mayor. We did upgrade rooms. The initial room was very very small and faced an interior back courtyard. It would have been ok for one person but it was way too tight for 2. The second room was lovely with high ceilings, modern decor, a great large bath (a shower with body spas) and a bar. There are bedside electronic lighting control (one setting was "sexy") and just an overall cheekiness to the design. We had a great view of the Plaza. Only downsides were the very high price due to the awful exchange rate and the slow shower draiin (a pet peeve of mine).

Reviews.Title: “Uber-Cool but Over-Priced”
Reviews.Author: Hypnotist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ME Melia for two nights on business last month. The public areas are very spanky. However, beware of "special events" because on one night both the roof terrace and lobby bar were closed for private promotions (some cigar launch I think). I guess my conference rate meant the smallest rooms. Very pleasant and comfortable but no room to swing the proverbial cat. But even that was over E250 a night. Personally I prefer the Urban, which is similarly priced but a little more spacious (at least the rooms I have stayed in). However, Santa Ana is buzzing so the Melia's location comes out on top.

Reviews.Title: “Top 10 hotel”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED. Likely one of the top 10 hotels I've ever stayed in. Check-in flawless, very accomodating. Room was TINY, so if you need space (e.g. business trip work from hotel), this likely won't work for you. Ultra chic though furnishings. Room lighting to die for, including SEXY mood (gotta see that). Bedding extremely comfortable. In room stereo. Bathrooms large, well illuminated, nicely appointed, great showers. Our room was on the inner courtyard, it was very quiet. My friends, who had a large room, facing the square complained of late night noise. Hotel security was very high. Door staff extremely polite and helpful. I went with my partner and the property was very gay friendly. Bar scene was also quite chic. Hotel is located in a largely tourist area but you are easy walking / taxi to all the major sights. Again -- a top rating from me, a road warrior.

Reviews.Title: “The best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: vrodrik
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the beginning... A great location! in the middle of the city but not on a busy street so no traffic noise! As soon I we arrived they upgraded us. The room was amazing, bright, the decor is as seen on the website... very modern and chic. The bathroom was also very nice and modern. This hotel was reopened in 2005 so pretty recent. The concierge service was amazing as well. After asking for a restaurant where to celebrate my husband's birthday, we found a cake and note in the room when we came back! Even if you don't stay at the hotel, you need to check out the lounge they have upstairs (view of Madrid) as well as the spa next door. The best retreat ever!! Very romantic! We will definitely go back. It seems that every detail were perfect. Also, they have plasma TV and free internet access. The chic, modern and young in Madrid.... you got it.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the pessimists.... hotel is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: EnglishRusty
Reviews.Content: After reading some 'mixed' reviews, I was slightly cautious as to what I might find when we arrived at the hotel.... However, it was fantastic. Tired? Not in the slightest. The hotel is decorated in a very modern and chic fashion. The rooms aren't large - but if you want bigger, upgrade to a bigger room. They are MORE than sufficient. The beds are so comfy and the bedding 1st class. The bathrooms are luxurious and the complimentary Aveda products were a dream.... Furthermore, the reception staff were very polite and so helpful. For my partners birthday they arranged for a cake to be delivered to our room - with their compliments - and as a surprise. Aloof? Not that we came across. They are effiicient and curteous. All in all the stay was first class. The bar and the restuarant is verging on the pricey side but the atmosphere is good. It is where the beautiful people go and if you like people watching stay here to join them..... If you need a central location, where the sights and bars of Madrid are in walking distance, then this is the hotel for you....

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and well located”
Reviews.Author: Coopers4
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here over New Year in two rooms The hotel is in a great location for restaurants, tapas bars and cafes as it is at one end of the very lively Plaza Santa Ana. It is easy to walk to all the main tourist attractions from here as well. We were pleasantly impressed by the friendly and helpful staff at reception and in general found the service at this hotel to be good. Our rooms faced the internal courtyard which meant they were quiet, even on New Year's Eve. The rooms are small, although not exceptionally so for a European hotel, but are well appointed and quite stylish. There are flat screen tvs, good quality linen and bathroom accessories, quality magazines and easy internet access. The room lighting offers a sophisticated array of options - from 'sexy' purple through to good, strong reading lights. There is a small but well equipped gym. The restaurant on the ground floor offers a good buffet breakfast. We ate in the restaurant on New Year's Eve when it was a fixed menu - expensive but great fun and elegantly done. I would definitely consider staying here again, largely because if its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: l0ul0u35
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great location, staff friendly and professional. We had a supreme room overlooking Plaza Santa Ana which was great, spacious and really comfortable bed! Standard rooms looked to be very small. Bar and restaurant really good. Modern and trendy if a bit pricey. Would definitely reccommend to couples or a group of friends away for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding central location with upscale accommodations”
Reviews.Author: gemgirl42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ME during our 4-day visit to Madrid (Jan. 4 - Jan. 8, 2008). The ME was everything we hoped for while visiting Madrid - central location, luxury accommodations for weary international travelers, and excellent staff to help with sightseeing and reservation questions. The rooms were smaller (compared to US standard) but very nice - comfortable bed, plasma TV with American channels, and great bathroom with an outstanding shower! The hotel's food and room service was even better - we became addicted to breakfast at the hotel every morning and late-night snacks in our room at night. The hotel also had a very fashionable bar, offering good people-watching while having a drink in the evening. The staff was very helpful and willing to do anything to make our stay better. Finally, the central location of the hotel was absolutely perfect - we were within walking distance of almost all of the sights that we wanted to check out, including the Prado.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Me”
Reviews.Author: mayoman
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a four night stay in the fantastic Me reina Victoria. On arrival we were up graded to a supreme room overlooking the lovely Santa Ana square with strawberries,chocalate and a bottle of cava to celebrate our anniversary and really everything just got better and better, the room was beautiful brilliant shower, Flat screen tv with a 5.1 sound system fab lighting great little touches like the speaker in the bathroom, turn down service with your little chocalate lip sweets. The staff could'nt have been more pleasant or helpful, the lobby is fantastic as are all the bars.But the best thing was location location location,Santa Ana really is the nicest part of madrid, you have 3 great jazz bars on your door step Cafe Central, Cafe jazz and populart which were all great in fact all the bars in the area are brilliant we especially liked Viva madrid and Olsen on C/prado 15 this is also a restaurant and has a really unusual menu, high recommended, we also loved La creazione on Ventura de la vega 9 and best of all if you like Indian food the brilliant Anapurna on Calle Zurbano 5 one of the nicest Indians we have ever been to. For sightseeing the prado was fantastic its massive you could easily spend a full day there, also the reina sofia is smaller but also worth visiting and the royal palace is breath taking, Madrid is a beautiful city and I could not recommend the Me and its location any higher

Reviews.Title: “Hotel - Yes.....Madrid - No!”
Reviews.Author: Thebairds
Reviews.Content: Modern, trendy hotel in a great location to explore the city. We spent New Year's Eve in the Penthouse Bar which has fantastic views over the city..... great music and a great atmosphere and a great crowd! There was a meal on offer but we chose not to bother with this as we arrived quite late. This was after venturing to the Puerta Del Sol and deciding it may not be too clever an idea to stay there! Bit rough!! The hotel staff were welcoming and friendly, very young and very "hip" ! Special mention to the concierges who provide an excellent helpful service. The rooms are on the small side but i would agree with an earlier review that the bed is nothing short of fantastic. Altho' small the rooms are modern, clean and have all the technology one might need. The bathroom was again modern and well appointed, especially the shower which was fab! All in all the room was most acceptable for the price we paid...which was not the hotel's own website price! Breakfast was the usual; fresh fruit, all types of eggs, bacon, cereal, toast. Pricey at 20.50 euros tho. Service here and in the bar was very good. Security was good also in that the elevators would only operate with the insertion of your room card. Check in and check out were painless even with the added nusiance of the hotel having a booking in our name for two double rooms instead of the three we booked with the website. There was absolutely no fuss made or questions asked and it was dealt with in seconds. Location was excellent, walking distance to Puerta del sol, Gran Via, Prado museum etc....be warned the queues we saw for this on the 2nd January were horrendous!! This was just after 9.00a.m! Plaza Santa Ana is a lovely little square with craft stalls and plenty going on. Altho we would thoroughly recommend the hotel we would not return to Madrid (unless for the hotel's New Year Party!) Not a patch on Barcelona or even Valencia....unfriendly, not too clean, not that much to see and do apart from the museums and shops. We look forward to trying another ME hotel after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location But Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: WhyFlyBy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days at the ME Madrid right around Christmas 2007. The hotel is located in a convenient central part of town at the north end of the Plaza de Santa Ana. It's only a few minutes walk from Puerta del Sol and about a 10 minute walk to the famous El Prado museum. We arrived by taking the metro to the Anton Martin station and walking about 5 minutes. The Plaza de Santa Ana, right outside the hotel, contains kiosks selling handicrafts, scarves/gloves, etc. We found the checkin staff and concierge to be perfectly nice. They spoke fluent English and were happy to answer any questions. The outside of the hotel is impressive and nicely lit at night. Our room was very small. In other words, there was just barely enough space to walk around the bed and not a bit more. You better go with somebody whose company you enjoy, because there's no privacy at all. The bathroom was clean and modern, sporting marble surfaces. There was no tub but the water pressure in the shower was very good. We did see a bug in the bathroom once but otherwise, the whole room was very clean. There is a free in-room safe that was big enough for my large laptop computer. The technology in the room was better than average. There was a flat screen TV recessed in the wall, a stereo system with DVD, and free wireless Internet that worked, albeit a bit slowly. The light switches were unnecessarily complex and let you set the lights in a bunch of different permutations. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant or bar. Although they looked nice, we preferred to go out. We arrived in the early afternoon, walked around a bit, then took a nap. We got up around midnight and decided to go look for food nearby, since there are many restaurants within a few blocks. We walked a block or two east of the hotel and felt uncomfortable and unsafe. There were drunks, aggressive club doormen, and maybe worse on the streets. We circled back to the north of the hotel and found a bar with snack that was only a block west from the hotel. The club was smoky but seemed perfectly safe. I understand they also have live jazz earlier in the evening. All in all, this was a good experience. I wish the room was bigger but for what we paid it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Bother! Waste Of Money!”
Reviews.Author: TJBraude
Reviews.Content: As cool as the ME looks, it is not worth 1 euro....considering how expensive it is, the staff were cold, arrogant and rude. I have dealt with my share of pretentious individuals at hotels, restaurants, clubs and bars and the staff here rank as some of the worst. The receptionists were stand-offish and the concierge was worse than bouncers at trendy NYC Meatpacking clubs... DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME! In the immediate vicinity you can find the Westin Palace, Villa Real, Urban and Ritz Carlton - all friendly and much more deserving of your business.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: NickJMurray
Reviews.Content: Hotel is uber cool and beautifully decorated in a contemporary style. 5 minutes walk from Sol square and tube and also the centre point of Spain! Bar is lovely for a drink and the restaurant looked equally nice but we did not eat there so cant comment on food. Rooms are a bit on the small side though! Staff are VERY attractive and also really nice and helpful. Would definately stay there again but am in no hurry to go back to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel experience!!”
Reviews.Author: LBashir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ME for 4 days and I could not be happier with my choice!! First of all, the location was great, we walked to all the museums, Palacio Real, Plaza Mayor, etc. Its about a 5-10 minute walk anywhere you want to go in the city (with the exception of serrano st shopping which has is a short cab ride). Also, its right around the corner from Puerto Sol which is the hub of the city. Plaza Santa Ana, where the hotel is located, is where all the tapas bars/nightlife is and it seemed that there was always something going on day or night. A great place to people watch. The hotel itself was immaculate, very stylish and modern, and we loved coming back to our room after a long day of sight seeing. We had a deluxe inside room which was smaller than other hotels we have stayed in but the room was very well laid out, had one of the most comfortable beds we have slept in and a GREAT shower. The atmosphere of the hotel is very young, urban, sophisticated, and sexy, and the crowd the same. This really is one of "in" spots in Madrid. The restaurants and bars had great atmosphere, including the rooftop penthouse which had a great view and great crowd. Finally, I want to comment about service and say that it was ABSOLUTELY EXCEPTIONAL. Room Service, maid service, and wait staff were top notch, but we the level of attention of and service we received from the Concierge at the ME was really in a class of its own. We received great suggestions on restaurants, bars, shopping, etc. but one night, Lucas from the concierge staff helped turn a bad situation we experienced into a great one (of course one that neither he nor the hotel controlled). He went out of his way to help us, i have never had a concierge or hotel provide that level of service for myself or for anyone that I have ever know. We even got a hand written note from Lucas that night hoping that everything went well. I felt like one of the celebrities who was also staying at the hotel! This is my third visit to a ME hotel, and I can't wait until they open others.

Reviews.Title: “ME Hotel Madrid - Don't bother !”
Reviews.Author: MemberSA
Reviews.Content: No atmosphere, and cold staff! It's about as wecoming as an art museum! I have just come back from this hotel after spending a long weekend there with my husband. Overall I found the place extemely cold and impersonal. It has all of the trappings of a luxury hotel, but the staff act like they are the guests of the hotel and that you are very lucky to be there ! I never felt welcomed. I really felt like they have an attitude that you must have a certain look to stay in 'their' hotel. At times felt that if I was not wearing what they perceive to be designer clothes I was being judged poorly by the snooty sfaff ! My attitude was that I'm on holidays and not at work! As a small example, when I asked for a reccommendation for a restauranct at the main desk I needed to confirm my room number and my name before they would actually even give me assistance. I mean it, no mistakes ! When I got my room number wrong the first day I had to correct the number before they would help. This was the case each time I asked for help; name and room number first. I wonder what they would have done if I wasn't staying in the hotel and asked for help... ? I don't want to go into a list examples but suffice it to say this was an attitude that the staff in their designer armani clothes had for the entire weekend. It takes more than cool surrounds to make a hotel. I paid for a luxury hotel, with warm helpful staff but I didn't get what I expected ! Will go with the Urbana next time.

Reviews.Title: “Overpromise and undereliver”
Reviews.Author: ofomenko
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding organised on the terrace of this hotel - great location and views. It ended there! Poor organisation and non-functioning jakuzzi and entertainment system in our "suite" were major disappointments. We also feel that they are not clean with the way they managed our finances for this event ... person in charge avoids any contact for two months.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: AndrewTraveler
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience. Great, chic hotel in a perfect part of Madrid. Nice room, great service. Definitely ask for a room overlooking the square -- the interior rooms looked a bit smaller and confined.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... Great experiace”
Reviews.Author: ramagana
Reviews.Content: If there is one sure bet, its this hotel...great location...great everything, Should really look at this hotel location 10, ambiance 10, rooms 10, service 10. Overall the best hotel I have been in for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “ME Madrid Reina Victoria - Flawless 5 Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: saintba
Reviews.Content: I just had a 3 night stay in the ME Madrid Reina Victoria hotel. It was great. I'm posting an objective review of the hotel below. My girlfriend had never been to Europe before so for my birthday I decided to treat the both of us to a trip through Europe. I wanted everything to be perfect. I booked each part of my trip myself since I have traveled to Europe many, many times. I was just in Spain a few months ago and I had drinks on top of the outdoor terrace at the hotel and I was really impressed by the hotel and location so I booked it. It was a GREAT experience that was truly flawless. There are 191 hotel rooms here from $350 (with tax) all the way up to $2,000 a night rooms. We stayed in a nice suite that was about $500 a night with taxes and it was great. The room was spacious, the bathroom very high end with marble throughout and the room had a big LCD TV with a DVD player (which we didn't use). The lighting system was great with controls on both sides of the bed to control lighting for the entire room. The mini-bar selection was very good. Also, there was free hi-speed wireless internet and internet with a cord and it was very fast and FREE. I was impressed as we had arrived from Buenos Aires earlier than our check-in and they had everything ready and let us check-in early. Fortunately, we flew first class so we both slept on the plane as there were seats that folded completely flat into beds so we were both ready to explore. Right away the concierge called up and asked me if I needed anything and to let me know that she would be available for anything I needed. Then the manager of the hotel called as well. I'm not sure if this is normal but it was great. Then shortly after their call, they had a nice card welcoming me and they also included both of their business cards as well and let me know if I needed anything they would be available. I thought that was a very nice touch and I was impressed. I'm in the hospitality business and I'm also a real estate developer. I could notice they spent a lot of money on the finish out of the room and they used very good items. The bed was VERY comfortable, the pillows were excellent and the room had black out blinds so we could sleep in. Also, something which was nice was they put sound-proof windows on the windows. I read a review of someone that said it was loud but I can assure you that the room was totally quiet and we didn't hear a thing. The location is PERFECT right in front of Plaza Santa Ana and it's in Central Madrid close to all the museums and not far from all the shopping on Serrano Street. There is a metro station very close as well (Banco de Espana). We ate dinner one night in the restaurant and it was great. We also drank drinks on the terrace and it's a really cool place. The staff was great and always went out of the way for us. I highly recommend this hotel. We had a great experience here. I booked directly with the hotel on their website and it was very quick and easy. I thought the value for the money was extremely good.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the ME despite a few issues”
Reviews.Author: Seasonedtraveller002
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a five night stay at the hotel. Overall our experience was good but there were a number of issues. On the positive front the location of the hotel is excellent , with plenty of restaurants , bars and shops in the immediate locality. The musems are also within 10 minutes walk of the hotel and are worth a visit. The concierge service was excellent and extemely helpful. Rooms were generous and modern and could not be faulted. We upgraded to a supreme room so the extra space was good however it did not have a bath. We had a room overlooking the square and was assured it was sound proof, it definitely was`nt and on the Sat night we were kept awake most of the night by local revellers who stopped the racket at 7.30 am Sunday morning. The check in at reception took longer than any other hotel that i have stayed in , and we were first in line. Our key card for the room did not work and after the fifth replacement the male receptionist of which there were two , both of whom had serious attitude problems , got his manager to check the door mechanism, he was helpful and courteous and the door mechanism was re configured next morning, however the key card only worked occasionally in the lift. Breakfast was good by Spanish standards , however very busy on Sat and Sun mornings with many guests having arguments with staff as the buffet was not being replenished quickly enough and staff levels were definitely under resourced. Bar is good and the roof top bar is excellent with spectacular views of the city and a must visit. There is also an independent spa adjoining the hotel which is very good and good value. Overall we would stay in the hotel again, but we would book an internal room , the positives outweigh the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Vacations from Boston
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 night stay at the ME Madrid. We had a room overlooking the Plaza de Santa Ana on the 5th floor and had a small balcony as well. The only problem with the rooms overlooking the plaza is the noise into all hours of the night ... we did get use to it but on Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights ... the partying goes on all night long! But the view itself and the small balcony were nice to have ... and again we did end up getting use to the noise after the 1st night. Overall, the hotel staff was very helpful and spoke English well. They helped us with dinner reservations, cabs, etc. The area near the hotel provides many choices for restaurants ... we walked each night and tried different types of food each night. There was a very casual pizza place just off the square that a tour guide mentioned to us and we actually had dinner there on two nights for something casual and no reservation needed. At 9 PM the place was near empty but by 915 to 9:30 it was packed both nights we were there. Food was very good and right across the street was an ice cream shop ... so we could grab an ice cream and walk around the area after dinner. The location of the hotel is excellent for all the major sites ... we walked everywhere we wanted to go ... 5 minutes to the Puerto del Sol, less than 10 to the Plaza Mayor ... and the museums and Royal Palace all within walking distanct. We took two day side trips to Segovia and Toledo and used Le Tango (letango.com) for a personal 3 hour tour. We also reserved a 3 hour walking tour of Madrid on our first full day with Le Tango. They had been recommended on this site's forum and we were not disappointed! All the guides were informative, helpful and provided great information to help with other things to do, see after the 3 hours. We also used the Madrid Vision for two days ... it's the Madrid version of the hop on, hop off bus! It was a great way to get around and see different sites or areas. Overall, the hotel was very nice, very modern, comfortable bed and nice ammenities. It is expensive but overall I think worth it. We did have breakfast each morning in the hotel and it provided a good variety of hot and cold foods.

Reviews.Title: “I would love to own the bed!”
Reviews.Author: CDiedrich
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 7 nights. The location at Plaza de Santa Ana was ideal. Everything one needed was a short walk away. There is a laundromat nearby across the plaza and a small grocery store on a street immediately behind the hotel. Previous posts mentioned the proximity to the museums and other attractions. The room was tiny! We were on in interior air shaft room, but we spent so little time in the room with Spain's nightlife that we didn't care about view. The rooftop bar did give us a bit of noise at night, but not too much. The one thing I would suggest as a change would be to get rid of the super-overpriced mini bar in the room. It takes up too much valuable space. The bars and restaurant in the hotel are ridiculous in price, fortunately there are so many surrounding choices that you don't need to use them. Security note. A friend with me had her purse stolen from the lobby of the hotel. Honestly, she wasn't watching it like she should have been, but it was discovered quickly. The staff jumped to action, helped her to contact the police, the credit card companies, and gave the security tape to the police. Then sent a apology card and fruit plate to her room. The bed was like sleeping in heaven! I have never slept so well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: gstove
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of August/beginning of September. The hotel was beautiful, very clean and modern, and the location was fantastic. The beds and pillows were the most comfortable we have ever encountered while travelling! There were also numerous TV channels in English...not that we went to Madrid to watch TV, but it was nice to be able to watch the news in English and my husband enjoyed being able to watch movies in English while he was waiting for me to get ready to go our for the night. The front desk staff was very friendly and helfpul for the most part, but we did have a leak under the sink in our bathroom and the shower wasn't draining properly. We notified the front desk, but these problems were not resolved during our stay. The breakfast buffet selection was very good, especially by European standards. The views from the rooftop bar were amazing, although part of the bar was closed for a private party the night we went up there. We ordered room service for dinner one night and it was surprisingly good, although a little on the expensive side. We found a discount rate through Travelzoo (145 euros/night) that included breakfast. At this price, the hotel was a great find, but I'm not sure it would have been worth paying their normal rates.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: lesliek
Reviews.Content: delightful staff wonderful rooms, superb location, what more can you ask? perfectly designed room, marble bathroom, great bathrobe and amenities, free internet, etc etc. yes it is mod and hip but in a delightufl spanish way. check out the rooftop bar. absolutely extraordinary view. and you can walk to tourist and authentic madrid within blocks! couldnt be happier, plan to return

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LornzAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Just arrrived back from this hotel. Ideal location for sightseeing in Madrid. Rooms on the small side but very comfortable. Hotel prices are expensive but there are plenty places to eat and drink nearby. Close to shopping, metros and open top bus.

Reviews.Title: “Wrong place, wrong time, wrong age”
Reviews.Author: Peter-Swede
Reviews.Content: Super location, very high-tech, slightly overpriced. I remember the surroundings from the late 60´s/early 70´s as a student in Madrid. The surroundings (Plaza Santa Ana) haven´t changed much (except for pricing which nowadays seem to be the same as then, although then Pesetas was the valid currency instead of Euros....). Somewhat sheepishly I found out that I had changed in the 35 - 40 years that have passed....... This is THE place for people in the 25-40 bracket, with money to spend and the stamina to do it and, above all, with the understanding of all the new technology with which the rooms are equipped. As an avid MELIA-fan I will (and have) selected other MELIA/TRYP hotels in Madrid for later stays. Peter the Swede

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel with a gorgeous location”
Reviews.Author: edleo13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 2 night stay at the ME Madrid Reina Victoria. We were in town for a Rolling Stones concert and to sightsee in Madrid. This was our first trip to Madrid and our first stay at a Sol Melia hotel. Overall we thought this was a superb hotel with a gorgeous location on Plaza Santa Ana. Arrival: We arrived at the hotel around shortly before 2PM on Wednesday, June 27th. The front desk staff was very friendly and spoke good English. Upon arrival, we were excited to learn that we had been given a complementary upgrade from an deluxe room (courtyard view) to a supreme room with a great view of Plaza del Ángel! I considered this to be a pretty generous upgrade – probably somewhere in the neighborhood of 50 Euros per night. The clerk at the desk didn’t mention why she upgraded us – later we thought it may have been because we had joined MAS Rewards before booking our reservation. Room: In a word – spectacular. First and foremost: ice cold air conditioning. Secondly, gigantic windows that provided stellar views of Plaza del Ángel and let in a wonderful natural light glow. Interior was very modern, very new, and fairly Hard Rock-ish (former owners): wood floors, plasma TV (with like 7-8 English speaking channels including Fox News), DVD player, stereo with subwoofer, large desk area, huge closet with safe etc. Frankly there were so many creature comforts in the room that you may not want to go out and sightsee! For you light sleepers, they have placed another pane of glass over the original windows to ensure absolute quiet. (There is also a sliding door that separates the entry way from main bedroom to completely eliminate noise from the hall.) Finally, it was nice to see free Internet in a full service hotel. Most similar places in the States (i.e. Hilton, Marriott, etc.) never gave away Internet at their full service properties. Bathroom: Again, very nice. The shower was great. It’s a full size walk-in shower stall with a bodyjet shower system. The toiletries were Aveda brand (I love the tingle from the Rosemary Mint shampoo!) and there were ample towels (including a few wash clothes). The bathroom is one of the few places where the Hard Rock is still directly evident – the mirror has a quote from the David Bowie track Oh! You Pretty Things. Transportation: The Sol metro stop is the closest one to the Hotel. Coming to the Hotel from Barajas airport, we took the metro (very cheap – 2.5 Euros). I probably wouldn’t recommend this to anyone except the hardiest of travelers as (a) it requires 2 transfers, (b) the red line can be very crowded at times, and (c) the many streets converging on Puerta del Sol can make finding your way to the Hotel very confusing. At first, we relied on the metro to get us places (i.e Sol to Opera for the Palacio Real and Sol to Atocha for the Prado museum), however after we learned our way around, we found it very pleasant to just walk (it’s only about 1.3 miles from the Prado to the Palacio Real). As many guidebooks note, the city is very walkable. It’s actually a lot of fun to just walk and get lost on the streets (they don’t resemble anything even close to a grid – there’s generally no rationale to how they twist & turn!) We left the city from the Atocha rail station. To get there, we took a taxi from the hotel and it cost us about 8 Euros. Laundry: Need to wash some clothes? There’s a nice Onda Blu laundromat at Calle de León 3. It’s all of 3 blocks south of the hotel (walk out the front door of the Hotel, walk three blocks, and then hang a right on Calle Leon.) There’s 8-10 self-service washers and dryers plus someone who works there full time to help you. She speaks a little English and was very nice to us. We washed and dried two loads for about 10-15 Euros. General Area: Puerta del Sol is a madhouse. Construction occupies about half the space and tourists overwhelm the rest. Gran Via isn’t much better. Plaza Santa Ana, on the other hand, is just gorgeous. It’s quiet and serene by day, but by night, all of these cute little restaurants and bars setup tables on the square. It’s a great place to end the day with a drink or something to eat. Food ideas: Chocolatería San Ginés (Pasadizo de San Ginés 11) is a must. They are famous for their churros which are served with this gooey, chocolate pudding dipping sauce. This is another good place to end your night as they are only open from 7PM to 6AM! Complaints: I don’t really have any. A few reviews have noted the price of rooms (we paid 230 Euros/night with tax), but I really felt like we got what we paid for. Having researched Madrid hotels relentlessly on Trip Advisor, there really aren’t any others that appear to be as nice and new as the ME Madrid Reina Victoria. Furthermore, during our 2 days in Madrid, I never walked by any other hotel and said “wow, I wish we would have stayed there.” Overall, this is a great hotel. The rooms are the pinnacle of comfort and the location in Plaza Santa Ana is just beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: londonscot
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a great stay at the ME Madrid. It is expensive, true, and the rooms are small, but it is in a fantastic location, the rooms are very well appointed and the service is good. This hotel is in the 'trying to be achingly hip' category, and although I suspect the decor will date quickly, it pretty much succeeds. The location is right on the Plaza Santa Ana, which has all the buzz you expect from downtown Madrid. Despite our room overlooking the square, we were not disturbed by the noise except briefly on Saturday night after Real Madrid had just won a match and were likely to win the league. The room was very comfortable with a huge TV, sound system, DVD player, and electrical points for the UK and US as well as Europe. Bathroom with Aveda shampoo etc. The service was very good - UK newspapers in the morning, a turn-down service in the evening, decent breakfast, friendly staff. We did not eat in the restaurant other than for breakfast as there are hundreds of bars and restaurants within 100m of the hotel. We had a drink in the 'Penthouse' bar which was quite cool and stylish, with good views of Madrid. Definitely worth a visit, but don't expect budget prices.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing....”
Reviews.Author: KP101London
Reviews.Content: I was disapointed at several things. This hotel has a great location but lots of buts. Firstly, it is hugely overpriced for what you get. I had a deluxe double room on the 6th floor. It was tiny. There was minimal space to walk around the bed. There are no tea/coffee making facilitis in the room. The shower is nice, but no bath and frankly i would have loved a relaxing bath. The hotel has a roof top bar which had a private party while i was there and consequently unavailable to the guests, and the NOISE was just awful. There was no breakfast included in the room tariff, and breakfast was 30 euros per person on the menu card. Concierge was less than helpfull. Before my trip i emailed the hotel to ask if they picked up their guests, i was told yes, BUT not told that this was at an extortionate rate. On the last day, i discovered the charge was 113 euros!!!!!!!!! A taxi on the way back was 38 euros. I would not return, and would recommend staying elsewhere. Conclusion - great location, Overpriced, unhelpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: galson1
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The rooms were very modern with fantastic bathrooms. Yes they were a little small but i was staying on my own and they had evrything i needed. Are you going to spend your time in Madrid in your room? The location was perfect as the square and roads leading off had many great bars offering something for all tastes. Noise wasnt a problem but i stayed in one of the internal rooms. Everything is possible they say. We checked this and asked for 2 tickets for the Santiago Bernabeau as Reals home game had been brought forward. They duly obliged with two perfect seats for a thrilling 4-3 home win. It cost a few quid but was great. Go stay there.

Reviews.Title: “ME Madrid Spain”
Reviews.Author: nahs12TrumpTower
Reviews.Content: The quick synopsis is that the hotel is very, very nice. It is an Santa Ana Plaza, where there is much going on. Certainly in walking to distance to museums. This hotel is very similiar to the W hotels..very style/hip/sexy oriented. If that's what you're looking for, this is it. Free internet in business room. The rooms are e x t r e m e l y small, almost beyond belief but you can't fault the hotel for that. It's just the original building structure. Would vertainly go back!
